Here at Borrowell, we stand in solidarity with Ukraine. We welcome all people making use of the Canada-Ukraine authorization for emergency travel (CUAET) program to apply and we will get back to you as soon as we can.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join a team of passionate thought leaders in a dynamic and collaborative environment! Cognizant Microsoft Business Group’s Applied Innovation team is hiring now and we’re looking for our next Data Analyst to join us.

The Microsoft Business Group (MBG) is a cloud-first, full-service Microsoft partner committed to delivering innovative technology solutions that solve human challenges. We are compelled by our core values to drive transformational results for clients across all company sizes, geographies and industries. The MBG team delivers full lifecycle solutions—from project inception and planning, through deployment to ongoing support and maintenance.

Why should you work at Microsoft Business Group?

Multi Award Winning Business
Official and Award-Winning Microsoft Partner
Award Winning Databricks Partner
Official GitHub Partner
Cloud Native Organization
Growing International and Diverse teams
Hugely collaborative environment, where ideas and knowledge sharing is actively encouraged

What impact will you have in this role?

As a Data Analyst in the MBG, your goal will be to enable businesses to maximize the value of their data assets. You will be responsible for designing and building scalable data models, cleaning, and transforming data, and enabling advanced analytics capabilities through reports and visualizations. You will process raw data into relevant insights based on identified business requirements to deliver relevant insights.

What will the Data Analyst be doing day-to-day?

Commanding a strong understanding of the strategic infrastructure (preferably Azure) required to make Business Intelligence rollout a success in the business at scale
Development of presales package and drive Business Intelligence and Data Modelling offering in the consultancy business
Contribute to or lead large scale DW/BI projects delivering an end-to-end Data Analytics delivery for customers
Data modelling capabilities including designing effective BI data models
Shaping an approach for governance and deployment of DW/BI in an array of organizations
Making large or complex data more accessible, understandable, and usable.
Creating charts and graphs, histograms, geographical maps, and other visual models that help to explain the meaning of large volumes of data, and isolate areas of interest.
Transforming, improving, and integrating data from many sources, depending on the business requirements.
Combining the data result sets across multiple cloud and on-premises sources
Finding hidden patterns using data
Delivering information in a useful and appealing way to users by creating rich graphical dashboards and reports

What type of experience does the Data Analyst need to be successful in this role?

Being a natural leader with strong experience of end to end roll out of DW/BI solutions with a vision of how this technology can transform business
Drive cultural change within businesses both externally and internally
Working collaboratively internally with senior leads and with partners to deliver solutions and drive an integrated vision of DW/BI and cloud technology
Embedding tangible and accessible data led change in a business.
Strong understanding of Microsoft DW/BI enterprise methodologies and roll-out methodologies
Strong understanding of dimensional modeling concepts – facts vs. dimensions, surrogate keys, and data granularity
Ability to lead and guide discussions about conceptual, logical, and physical modelling
Strong experience as a Business Intelligence developer using the Microsoft BI stack (Power BI)
Expert knowledge of DAX/MDX and Analysis Services in large deployments of Power BI
Working experience of SQL including writing, debugging, and tuning T-SQL queries, creating SQL tables, views and stored procedures and a strong understanding of relational databases
Experience in designing ETL processes including knowledge of data warehousing strategies and theories
Articulate and document architectural solutions and processes
Establish and maintain collaborative relationships with stakeholders
Knowledge of cloud computing, preferably of Azure
Excellent and confident communication and presentations skills

Certifications (desirable)

Exam DA-100: Analyzing Data with Microsoft Power BI or Exam PL-300: Microsoft Power BI Data Analyst

Does the Data Analyst role require travel?

The role is currently 100% working from home, however some travel to our local office may be required in the future.

Security Responsibility

All employees must act in accordance with Cognizant Microsoft Business Group’s corporate security standards.

Cognizant will only consider applicants for this position who are legal authorized to work in Canada without requiring employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future.

Employee Status : Full Time Employee

Shift : Day Job

Travel : No

Job Posting : Jan 17 2023

About Cognizant

Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant is ranked 185 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us @Cognizant.
Show more Show less

Does the Data Analyst role require travel?

The role is currently 100% working from home, however some travel to our local office may be required in the future.

Security Responsibility

All employees must act in accordance with Cognizant Microsoft Business Group’s corporate security standards.

Cognizant will only consider applicants for this position who are legal authorized to work in Canada without requiring employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future.

Employee Status : Full Time Employee

Shift : Day Job

Travel : No

Job Posting : Jan 17 2023

About Cognizant

Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant is ranked 185 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us @Cognizant.

Title: Analyst, Data Insights
Description:
Come Work with Us!




At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.




Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.




Job Title




Analyst, Data Insights




Job Description




What will you do?




Data Quality Monitoring




Monitor data quality control exceptions, conduct detailed investigations, including root cause analysis, and identify and document data issues.
Collaborate with business process and report owners, and other users of shared data assets to capture systemic and other self-identified data issues and control gaps.
Use standardized and ad hoc reporting to communicate data quality results, trends and insights to business partners and management.




Issues Management & Resolution (IMR)




Track and manage data quality and control issues from assignment through to resolution by applying best practices and using the Collibra IMR workflow and Jira project management tools.
Collaborate with the Chief Data Office, Data Management Offices, IT and other business functions to facilitate data remediation, adjustments and/or system changes to address the root cause of the data issues.
Provide monthly summary and detailed reporting on resolved and outstanding issues, finding and recommendations to business partners and key stakeholders.




Continuous Improvement




Propose process changes/improvement to address identified gaps or inconsistencies in data, processes and/or controls.
Gain and apply an in-depth understanding of data quality controls, data profiling tools and systems to support the definition and implementation of effective controls and reporting.
Work with the Chief Data Office and other Data Management Offices to support standards and best practices to improve data quality, participating in initiatives to raise awareness and drive improved data quality across the organization (e.g., Data Working Groups, Data Literacy projects).




PS: Collibra is RBC’s master data management platform and includes Issues Management & Resolution (IMR) workflow and reporting capability.




Must-Have:




1+ years of relevant experience with data quality principles, data control design, data management or data analysis.
Beginner to Intermediate knowledge of data analysis methods and the ability to analyze and resolve data related issues.
Education in a numerical discipline, IT, business or equivalent work experience.
Excellent communication skills, verbal and written.
Experienced in preparation of reports and presentations.
A genuine interest in working in data.




Nice-to-Have:




Experience conducting root cause analysis, using tools/frameworks such as SQL, Excel, Python, Hive.
General understanding of financial reporting, finance and risk business concepts and procedures.
Experience working with financial services and systems including finance and/or credit risk data.
Experience using Collibra or a similar data management or workflow platform.
Ability to manage multiple competing priorities during busy periods.




What’s in it for you?




We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.




A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits and competitive compensation.
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities.
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team.
Opportunities to do challenging work.




Job Summary




What is the opportunity?




In the increasingly complex world of financial services, accurate and complete data is critical for risk management and regulatory compliance. Ensuring data integrity begins with an understanding of financial services data, data quality controls and identifying and resolving data issues. As an Analyst, DQ & Issue Mgmt. Remediation you will be accountable for driving improvements in Risk and Finance data through the identification, root cause analysis, and management of data issues through to resolution for business critical processes and regulatory reports. Reporting to the Associate Director, you will define and monitor data quality controls and resolve data issues for business partners across the organization including Finance, Group Risk Management, Personal & Commercial Banking, Capital Markets, and Wealth Management.




Address:




TORONTO, Ontario, Canada




City:




CAN-NS-BEDFORD, CAN-ON-TORONTO




Country:




Canada




Work hours/week:




37.5




Employment Type:




Full time




Platform:




Strategy and Administration




Job Type:




Regular




Pay Type:




Salaried

2023-01-30-08:00

2023-02-13-08:00

Title: Entry Level - Research Data Analyst / (Remote)
Description:
We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Entry Level Research Data Analyst to join our team. This position is a remote role and will involve working with a team of analysts to gather, analyze, and interpret data to support business decisions. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical background, excellent communication skills, and a passion for problem-solving.

Key Responsibilities:

Gather and analyze large sets of data from various sources
Use statistical techniques to interpret data and identify trends and patterns
Communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner
Collaborate with other analysts to support project goals and objectives
Continuously monitor data quality and work to improve data integrity
Stay current on industry trends and developments in data analysis



Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in a related field (e.g. statistics, mathematics, computer science, economics)
Strong analytical skills and experience with data analysis software (e.g. R, Python, SQL)
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Power BI) is a plus
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a remote environment



This is an entry-level position, and we are willing to train the right candidate. If you are a data-driven individual with a passion for problem-solving and a desire to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment, we encourage you to apply.

Note: The company is open for the remote work and flexible hours for the candidates who are willing to work remotely.

Title: Data Entry Research Analyst - (Remote)
Description:
We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Data Entry Research Analyst to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for collecting and analyzing data from various sources, inputting and maintaining accurate records, and providing support to the research team. This is a remote position that requires a self-motivated individual who can work independently and meet deadlines.

Key Responsibilities:

Collect and analyze data from various sources, including online databases, surveys, and reports
Input and maintain accurate records in various databases and systems
Provide support to the research team by conducting research and data analysis as needed
Identify and report any discrepancies or errors in the data
Communicate effectively with the research team and other stakeholders to ensure accurate and timely completion of projects
Keep up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in data entry and analysis



Qualifications:

Strong attention to detail and ability to work independently
Ability to meet deadlines and work in a fast-paced environment
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Knowledge of data analysis and data entry techniques
Strong computer skills, including proficiency in Excel and other data analysis software
Strong communication and interpersonal skills
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field, such as statistics, mathematics, or computer science



Note: Remote work experience is a plus.

If you are a highly motivated individual with a passion for data analysis and research, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. We offer a competitive salary, flexible working hours, and opportunities for professional growth and development.

Title: Data Analyst - Operations (Remote)
Description:
Data Analyst - Operations 

Are you looking for your next challenging and rewarding opportunity? Then this is the position for you!

You will be a point of contact to troubleshoot issues for our end user community and work beyond tactical support to analyze issues and identify opportunities for process improvements.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

70% - Data Analysis - pulling data, identifying missing data, following up with supplier to get data completed

30% - Process Improvement - create process improvements for solutions from data analysis



This is a great opportunity to be part of a larger organization that believes in promoting talent from within. This is an exciting role that will definitely advance your career! This is a 6-12 month contract opportunity with potential to extend or convert to direct hire. This role will be working remotely and you must be able to work eastern standard time zone.

REQUIRED SKILLS:

1+ years of analysis experience

Proven Process analysis and improvement - given incomplete work and took ownership to figure out a solution

Strong Excel skills - ability to create Pivot tables, V-LookUps, Charts, Graphs, Formulas

Basic SQL Experience - write, pull, and modify queries from a database (Access or SQL Server or similar database)

Powerpoint experience

Experience drawing conclusions from data

Outstanding written and verbal communication skills

Effective interpersonal and problem solving skills - driver mentality!

Ability to handle and prioritize multiple tasks

Bachelor's degree in I.E or Supply Chain or related field



PREFERRED SKILLS:

Knowledge of word processing tools and spreadsheets (MS Office Word, Excel etc.)

Working knowledge of office equipment

Basic understanding of databases

Effective interpersonal and problem solving skills - driver mentality!

Ability to handle and prioritize multiple tasks

Bachelor's degree in I.E or Supply Chain or related field



PREFERRED SKILLS:

Knowledge of word processing tools and spreadsheets (MS Office Word, Excel etc.)

Working knowledge of office equipment

Basic understanding of databases

Title: Analyst, Client Data Analytics
Description:
Come Work with Us!




At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.




Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.




Job Title




Analyst, Client Data Analytics




Job Description




What is the opportunity?




Client Data Analytics is part of the Controls & Governance team of the Client & Data Management Group (C&DMG), provides monitoring and performance analysis for the all aspects of client onboarding and refresh activities. The analyst works with stakeholders to produce metrics for effective monitoring, timely reporting and identification of action plans around KPIs and KRIs.




What will you do?




Support the delivery of business analytics
Ensure data is consistently maintained to agreed operational and regulatory standards throughout the client lifecycle.
Help maintain & monitor an inventory of data & key controls showing ownership, frequency and SLA’s across the client lifecycle.
Support the development of actionable ongoing management reporting that is focused on trends and includes proactive identification and reporting of emerging risks (KPIs and KRIs).
Monitor the metrics from the risk and control framework and ensure that the ongoing health of the processes are monitored
Ensure sustainable remedial action when issues are identified.
Proactively identify operational risks/control deficiencies in the business and opportunities to improve the team & client experience.
Collaborate to create processes and monitoring tools, following a risk based approach including appropriate exception management and escalation policies.
Support ongoing reporting that is focused on trends and emerging risks from different sources of information across business units.
Support the creation of a consolidated view of risk and performance, including initiatives, compliance deficiencies and corrective action.




What you need to succeed?




Undergraduate degree
2 - 3+ years of Capital Markets experience
Quantitative analytic skills, including experience with data analysis and data presentation
Strong database experience
Expertise in one or more of Python, VBA, and Tableau
MS Office, with particular expertise in Excel and PowerPoint
Superior verbal & written communication skills
Superior analytical & problem solving skills
Demonstrated ability to manage ambiguity in a difficult/stressful work environment
Demonstrated knowledge & experience with risk and quality control frameworks
Collaboration & team skills; with a focus on cross-group collaboration




Nice-to-haves




Formal qualifications as Graduate or Post-Graduate Level.
Knowledge of products and operations of Capital Markets, Investment Banking
Creative thought process and ability to innovate
Attention to detail while working with high volume of data and transactions




What’s in it for you?




We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.




A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
Opportunities to do challenging work
Flexible work/life balance options




Job Summary




Address:




TORONTO, Ontario, Canada




City:




CAN-ON-TORONTO




Country:




Canada




Work hours/week:




37.5




Employment Type:




Full time




Platform:




Capital Markets




Job Type:




Regular




Pay Type:




Salaried




Posted Date:




2022-11-25-08:00




Application Deadline:




2023-02-06-08:00




Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment




At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.




We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our Banking client in Toronto, Ontario is looking to hire a Data Analyst for a 6-months contract role with the possibility of an extension.




What You Will Be Doing




Set up various types of public and private securities (funds, bonds, money markets, etc.)
Provide a high level of service by responding to all client inquiries within a reasonable timeframe in order to maintain the company’s image and strengthen client retention.
Verify and confirm with vendor sources for any discrepancies in set-up information.
Establish communication networks with all business units for the receipt of security set-up data.
Ensure that the end-of-day checking procedure for any same-day requests are completed, and existing procedures are followed and kept informed on all policies and compliance issues.
Review/monitor all set-up issues to ensure timely follow-up and resolution.
Act as a team player, participate in the team’s cross-training activities, and provide coverage during staff absences.
Identify issues and problems and escalate immediately.




What You Will Need To Succeed…




Excel
Degree in Business/Finance/Accounting.
FI experience.
Highly analytical.
Detail-oriented.




Nice To Have Skills




Bloomberg or CDs or bony.




Looking for Meaningful Work? We can help!




If you're a technical professional, you know that it can be difficult to find fulfilling work that advances your career. At the Ian Martin Group, we exist to connect professionals like you with meaningful work at industry-leading companies in your field. And we walk the walk, too: as a Certified B Corporation, we believe in using business as a force for good for people, our communities, and the environment.




We value diversity and inclusion and encourage all qualified people to apply. If we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process, please contact us at recruit@ianmartin.com




We encourage all qualified candidates to apply; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At TTi, people come for the opportunity and stay for the culture!

Job Description Summary

Job Description:

We are looking for an enthusiastic and experienced individual to fill the role of Data Analyst.


The Data Analyst is responsible for working closely with project sponsors to deliver enhanced reporting standards and operational efficiency for the business group.

This individual will be accountable for preparing and modelling data, creating visualizations, analyzing information, and managing Power BI assets to ensure projects accurately reflect our stakeholder requirements.

The successful candidate must communicate clearly, think strategically, be creative, solve problems, pay close attention to detail, and be a team player!

What you will do:


The Data Analyst will manage end-to-end project work assignments to deliver best in class reporting solutions.

In this position, the Data Analyst will:

Profile, clean, and transform raw data into trustworthy and meaningful information.
Ensure data integrity standards by identifying and correcting variances in source data.
Manage user profile groups and maintain object/row level security assignments.
Provide actionable insight by creating well-designed tabular model structures.
Monitor dataset refresh schedules and troubleshoot gateway/connection failures.
Optimize performance of tabular models and custom measure calculations.
Create stunning visualizations that help decision makers solve business problems.
Analyze, interpret, and communicate report information, patterns, and trends.
Improve current dashboard reporting by integrating Power BI AI capabilities.
Manage distribution and sharing of report publications, dashboards, and datasets.


Who you are:

Enthusiastic about your career path and eager to learn new and emerging technologies.
Results driven and detail oriented with the ability to deliver projects ahead of schedule.
A collaborator who can prioritize and multitask on individual and shared assignments.
Resilient, patient, and determined to overcome complicated business challenges.
An excellent communicator who embraces change and motivated to do the right thing.
Someone who sets lofty expectations of themselves and continually pursues excellence.



What you have done:

Bachelor’s Degree preferably in Statistics, Mathematics or Computer Science.
2-3 years of demonstrated work experience as a Data Analyst or equivalent.
Solid understanding of Business Intelligence tools including Microsoft Power BI.
Proficient in Microsoft Office applications and advanced knowledge Excel.
Experience with SQL, Python, R-Scripting and other programming languages.

Title: Entry level / Virtual Data Entry Analyst (Remote)
Description:
We are seeking a highly motivated individual to join our team as a virtual data entry analyst assistant. This entry-level role is a remote position, and the ideal candidate will have strong attention to detail and excellent organizational skills.

Responsibilities

Enter data into various systems and databases accurately and in a timely manner
Verify data by comparing it to source documents
Retrieve and maintain data by sorting and filing documents
Update existing data
Resolve discrepancies by using standard procedures or returning incomplete documents to the team leader for resolution
Protect operations by keeping information confidential

Requirements

Strong attention to detail and ability to spot errors
Excellent organizational skills
Strong typing skills
Basic computer proficiency, including experience with Microsoft Office
Ability to work independently and meet deadlines
Strong verbal and written communication skills
High school diploma or equivalent required

This is a remote role and schedule may be flexible.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Junior Settlement Data Analyst
Description:
Nexus Energy is a privately held company based in Toronto, Ontario. We participate in energy wholesale markets across Eastern Canada and the Northeastern United States and are currently expanding operations into the retail & REC space.

Finance & Settlements team is currently looking for a motivated and talented individual to provide solutions & support to both the trading and operation teams.

 

Responsibilities: 

 

·        Retrieve settlement data and perform analysis & investigations for potential discrepancy.

·        perform weekly and monthly reconciliations to verify settlement and invoicing accuracy.

·        Work closely with the Data & IT team to establish, upgrade and maintain automated data retrieval tools and processes.

·        Work closely with the Date & IT team to assist in deploying production and non-production environments.

·        Operate and maintain internal applications and tools to ensure the accuracy and punctuality of various internal & external reports.

·        Work closely with the trading team to verify and update different charge components related to different types of transactions and deals.

·        Work closely with different teams within the organization to define internal reporting requirement, structure, and procedures.

·        Apply analytical and technical skills to investigate day-to-day system and business issues, determine the root cause and delivery viable solutions.

·        Performing ad hoc data analysis, interpreting, and communicating business insights.

 

Minimum Skills & Qualifications:

·        University or college education in Business, Finance, Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or related disciplines.

·        Hands-on experience with Excel (including pivots, lookups, etc).

·        Hands-on experience with Python and SQL statements.

·        Good experience working with database and IT application support

·        Strong written & oral communication skills

·        Excellent problem solving and team building skills

·        Adaptable, able to learn new skills/technologies

 

Preferred Qualifications:

·        Understanding and experience with the North American power market

·        Application development experience with Excel VBA in the financial industry is a plus

·        Strong database development skills

 

What We’re Offering

 

Pay for performance environment that offers competitive salary and incentives
Numerous opportunities for professional growth and development
Comprehensive employer paid benefits coverage
Registered pension program professionally managed by RBC
Monthly team building and recreational events
Annual sporting & lifestyle allowance and corporate discounted rate for gym membership

Title: Data Analyst - Finance
Description:
Who is Mother Parkers?




We are one of the largest tea and coffee manufacturers in North America, with a mission to create a better beverage experience for our customers. As a leading customer solutions provider to some of North America’s largest retailers and foodservice chains, we use state-of-the-art technology and new product innovation to help our customers grow their business and deliver superior products to their clientele. Our team of coffee and tea experts are deeply passionate about what we do, proud of our 100+ years of business success, and excited about building a future with endless possibilities. Come join our team and work among the best, collaborate with high performers, and contribute to challenging work every day!




The Role:




We have an exciting opportunity in our Finance department for an experienced Business/Data Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for the redesign, standardization, and automation of current processes within the commitment pricing team, with the purpose of improving efficiencies and implementing new solutions. As well, you will use your data insights expertise to create new interactive dashboards and reports that provide key, actionable metrics for various stakeholders.




What you get to do:




Collaborate with the Business Intelligence team to develop performance tracking dashboards and reporting to provide accurate decision-making tools across the Commitment Pricing department.
Identify and automate key processes in Commitment Pricing and implement solutions to mitigate bottlenecks and inefficiencies.
Summarize vast amounts of data through developing models or reports to present the info in a simplified way.
Document key processes and support the transition from AX to D365.
Design tools to analyze Coffee buys and identify pricing actions in timely manner to improve financial performance.
Develop, build, distribute, and maintain processes that visualize/track key performance measures in support of the Commitment Pricing department.
Redesign and standardize current reports to ensure consistency in the layout of information.
Complete Ad hoc projects as required.

What you bring to the role:




Post-secondary education in business, finance, economics, sciences, analytics or related field.
5 years+ relevant business experience in Data Analytics or insights.
Experience in process development, continuous improvement, reporting tools, identifying efficiencies and problem areas within data streams.
High proficiency in Microsoft Excel, able to utilize pivot tables and charts, VLOOKUP, VBA macros, and various formulas.
Enterprise solution software experience (Microsoft AX Dynamics preferred, I21, D365).
Enterprise Business Intelligence (Power BI) solution experience.
Efficient, self-motivated with the ability to follow through and implement process improvement.
Hands on, ability to operate independently, and take initiative with minimal supervision.
Eager, willing and capable to help where needed in a fast-paced customer focused environment.
A continuous improvement mindset.
Natural curiosity to dig deep into departmental complexities/processes.

What we offer you:

Flex hours and the opportunity to work from home.
Competitive Total Rewards package – health benefits coverage on day 1, employer matched retirement savings plans, optional Health or Wellness Spending Accounts.
Employee discount program on our coffee and tea products.
Dress for your day – when you’re in the office, come in your jeans, or a business suit if you’re meeting with a client.
Tuition Assistance Program – we value continuous learning and self-development.










By providing your information to us, you understand and agree to Mother Parkers Tea & Coffee’s Privacy Policy: https://www.mother-parkers.com/privacy-policy/










While Mother Parkers welcomes all applications, we do not accept unsolicited resumes from employment agencies or search firms. Only those candidates who meet the minimum requirements will be contacted. Mother Parkers is committed to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities. Accommodation is available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

  • Hands on, ability to operate independently, and take initiative with minimal supervision.
  • Eager, willing and capable to help where needed in a fast-paced customer focused environment.
  • A continuous improvement mindset.
  • Natural curiosity to dig deep into departmental complexities/processes.

What we offer you:

  • Flex hours and the opportunity to work from home.
  • Competitive Total Rewards package – health benefits coverage on day 1, employer matched retirement savings plans, optional Health or Wellness Spending Accounts.
  • Employee discount program on our coffee and tea products.
  • Dress for your day – when you’re in the office, come in your jeans, or a business suit if you’re meeting with a client.
  • Tuition Assistance Program – we value continuous learning and self-development.




By providing your information to us, you understand and agree to Mother Parkers Tea & Coffee’s Privacy Policy: https://www.mother-parkers.com/privacy-policy/




While Mother Parkers welcomes all applications, we do not accept unsolicited resumes from employment agencies or search firms. Only those candidates who meet the minimum requirements will be contacted. Mother Parkers is committed to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities. Accommodation is available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Title: Entry level / Virtual Data Entry Analyst Assistant (Remote)
Description:
We are looking for a focused data entry clerk to continuously update our companys databases. The data entry clerk will liaise with and follow up with employees within the company as well as with customers to collect information. The data entry clerk will capture the data into relevant databases in a timely and accurate manner. You will identify and correct errors, and swiftly bring them to the attention of relevant parties where necessary.

Requirements

High school diploma.

1+ years experience in a relevant field.

Good command of English.

Excellent knowledge of MS Office Word and Excel.

Strong interpersonal and communication skills.

Ability to concentrate for lengthy periods and perform accurately with adequate speed.

Proficient touch typing skills.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join Triovest, one of the largest privately-owned Canadian commercial real estate companies, as a Data Analyst in Toronto.




This role will be responsible for collecting, analyzing and interpreting large sets of data, creating reports and visualizations, identifying trends and insights and communicating findings to internal and external stakeholders to drive business decisions.




The candidate should have a bachelor’s degree and 3+ years of experience in data analysis within Commercial Real Estate. The Data Analyst will have experience using Power BI and Yardi software to analyze and interpret large sets of data and have strong communication, presentation skills and be highly organized and detail oriented.




The Data Analyst will play a critical role in driving our business forward by using data to inform decision and support our business leader’s efforts. If you are passionate about data and commercial real estate and want to be part of a team that’s making an impact, we want to hear from you!




Triovest is an Equal Opportunity Employer

We believe in the power of diversity and we are dedicated to creating a diverse, equitable and inclusive environment at Triovest. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available upon request during the recruitment and selection process. For all internal and external applicants who require accommodation in the recruitment and selection process, please contact eboyack@triovest.com for assistance/support.




Vaccination Policy

Triovest requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. An exemption from this requirement is provided on an exceptional reason, such as medical, creed or religious reasons in accordance with the relevant Human Rights legislation in the province in which you work.

Title: Data Analytics Intern
Description:
We are looking for a Data Analytics Intern between the second week of May and end of August, 2022 to work on a hybrid basis (half remote and half in the Toronto office, on Bay Street) – please note, this requirement might change. Some of the major role responsibilities include but are not limited to:




Collecting, storing and analyzing a variety of data using a multitude of approaches and programs
Bringing technical expertise to ensure accuracy of data within the insurance industry
Knowing how to manipulate Excel files and to use it in conjunction with other programs
Performing data visualization
Other work as assigned




The Boiler Inspection and Insurance Company is part of the Munich RE umbrella, a German multinational insurance company. As one of the world’s leading reinsurers, its shares are listed on all German stock exchanges. BII is closely linked to the US parent company.

Title: Data Analyst Associate
Description:
TD Description

All companies are not the same. What makes TD special as a business is also, what makes us special as an employer. Why TD?

TD's Colleague Promise: A better you. A better us.

A more confident you means a stronger us. We empower you to grow your skills, gain new perspectives, and create impact at work and in your community. That’s our unique and inclusive culture.

Department Overview

Our Associate Programs offer new graduates the opportunity to work in one of TD's many lines of business, and the chance to work on challenging projects and assignments, alongside experienced colleagues, and receive coaching and mentorship from business leaders and the Early Talent Experience team, to set you up for success in your career at TD.

As an Associate, you will also have access to programming, tools and a community of support for your pursuits and interests beyond the 9-5. This includes leadership talks, lunch and learns, self-development workshops, TD sponsored conferences, socials, team challenges, volunteer opportunities, career coaching and more. You will be part of a cohort along with other TD Associates from across Canada! If one of our over 20+ Associate programs is of interest to you, please read on and apply today.

Job Description

You will have the opportunity to work with one of our various teams within the DaaS group. From Day 1, you will be treated as an equal member of the team and given meaningful assignments to help us deliver improvements to our data platforms across multiple segments such as Core Banking, Business Banking, Insurance, Wealth, or Enterprise Platforms.

Job responsibilities for a Data Analyst Associate may vary by area. This may include, but is not limited to the following:


Work with business and technology partners to define, develop and document detailed business, data and system requirements.


Participate as a member of agile pod team focused on developing new capabilities, including agile ceremonies.


Collaborate with data engineers, product owners, quality engineers and other stakeholders to deliver an end-to-end capability from concept to production-deployment.


Have performed data analysis, profiling, clean-up, data wrangling and validation as part of University assignments.


Based on data analysis, provide recommendations for data remediation, improvements.


Participate in program/ system research, analysis, detailed design and problem resolution.


Respond to user enquiries on data platform, in a timely manner.


Troubleshoot and determine root cause and resolution for application defects.


Apply Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and Project Management Methodology (PMLC) to complete specific tasks for projects.


Continuously enhance knowledge/expertise and keep up-to-date with leading-edge technologies trends/developments.


Develop expertise in data platform, infrastructure, data pipeline, analytical tools and design techniques that can contribute to effective solution development and delivery.


Good communication, interpersonal, collaboration skills to work in an agile cross-functional team, with different stakeholders.


Have owned, delivered a project assignment in University starting from Inception, Initiation, Execution until Implementation. Project outcome reviewed and measured as expected.



Job Requirements

Must be graduated, or graduating between May 2022 and September 2023, in Computer science, Engineering, Computing, or equivalent
Strong communication and inter-personal skills with the ability to deliver message and ideas effectively to diverse audiences such as business, development, quality engineers and management stakeholders.
A thirst for constantly exploring emerging technology such as Azure, python, Talend, Tableau, Informatica.
Familiarity with Jira and Confluence.
Proficient with Excel, Visio, SQL, some reporting and analytical tools.
Understands Data Modeling concepts.
Able to manage multiple priorities and work independently, as well as part of a team.
Experience with technology project delivery and agile delivery methodology would be an asset.
Some prior experience with creating visualization such as Process and Data Flows.
Good documentation skill; can produce data mapping between Source and Target Systems. Capture User Stories and Use Cases.
Hands-on programming experience would be an asset, which could include familiarity and strength in any of the following: C, C++, C#, Object C, Java, Java Script, Python, NodeJS, SQL, J2EE, Web Services, DB2, MS SQL.


Additional Information


Please note: This role will have varying start dates as applications are being reviewed on an ongoing basis


Applications must include a resume (maximum of 2 pages).


We welcome all applications; however, we will only contact qualified candidates chosen for an interview. Thank you for your interest.


TD requires employees to reside in the country where the role is located, irrespective of remote working arrangements



Assigned Line of Business Requirements
Please note that the line of business that you are assigned to may require specific skills not mentioned in this posting

Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Entry level / Virtual Data Entry Analyst Assistant (Remote)
Description:
We are currently seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Entry Level Data Entry Analyst Assistant to join our virtual team. This is a remote position that requires a reliable internet connection and a computer. The ideal candidate will have strong organizational skills and the ability to work independently.

Responsibilities

Accurately input and maintain data in various systems and databases
Ensure data integrity and accuracy through regular audits and quality control checks
Communicate with internal teams to gather and clarify information needed for data entry
Provide support to other team members as needed
Meet or exceed established data entry goals and deadlines

Qualifications

Strong attention to detail and accuracy
Strong organizational skills and ability to multitask
Basic computer skills, including proficiency in Microsoft Office
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Willingness to learn and adapt to new technologies and systems

This is an entry-level position, and previous experience in data entry is not required. We will provide training and support to help you succeed in this role.

If you are interested in joining our team, please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your qualifications and experience. We look forward to hearing from you!

Desired Skills And Experience

Online Data Entry,Assistant Directing,Data Administration,Data Analysis,Virtual Administrative Support,Virtual Administration

Title: Data & Analytics Intern (12 months)
Description:
BMW Group Financial Services is offering a well-rounded internship with the focus on realizing data-based sales performance that permeates from headquarter down to each single sales outlet within Canada. This role is a part of an interdisciplinary team with a start-up mentality to innovate within a traditional automotive OEM for premium cars.




Specific responsibilities include but not limited to:




Working in an interdisciplinary team of sales, marketing, finance, and IT experts, willing to share knowledge and expertise with you.
Helping gather data from multiple sources; document and catalog into a central repository system.
Supporting the setup of KPI-oriented / data-based reports and analysis for all levels of management and enhance digital transformation of BMW Group Financial Services.
Processing raw data to desired output format and performing analysis on it.
Driving automation of reports and ensuring availability of accurate data in dashboards.
Collaborating within Agile Working Model and processes such as Scrum, Kanban using JIRA platform.
Current student or recent graduate in Data Science, Data Analytics or a comparable course of studies
Minimum one-year experience within Sales, Marketing, Business Development or IT
Relevant analytics and/or BI related working experience is preferred
Strong knowledge in MS Office, especially PowerPoint and Excel
Knowledge in transactional & analytical data structure and SQL
Knowledge in data visualization programs like Tableau, Qlik, or Power BI
Analytical thinking and first knowledge in analyzing and visualizing data




Benefits of working at BMW Group Canada include:




An award winning culture.
Cutting edge of innovation and creativity.
Incredible BMW, MINI and Motorrad employee vehicle/motorcycle programs.
Flexible working models.
Highly competitive compensation.
Performance incentives programs.
First-rate health and wellness benefits.
World-class office space.
Enjoy fresh meals in our amazing fully staffed and subsidized onsite cafeteria.
Energize at our fully loaded coffee/tea bar.




BMW Group Canada is committed to attracting and retaining a diverse team of associates and creating an inclusive environment. BMW Group Canada does not discriminate against applicants based on race, national or ethnic origin, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or disability or any other status or condition protected by applicable federal, provincial or territorial law.




BMW has an accommodation process in place that provides accommodations for employees with disabilities. Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request. If you require a specific accommodation because of a disability or a medical need, or you would like to learn more about our Accessibility policies, provide feedback or request documentation, please contact Accessibility@bmw.ca.

Title: Analyst - Customer Insights
Description:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada




Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast dates back to 1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. To reach our goal, we need the best talent to help us evolve and drive change across the business – and boldly help shape Canada’s retail industry. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies.




Customer Analytics & Strategic Insights is a high performing analytics team whose responsibilities include campaign analytics (audience selection, strategy design, performance analysis); building and maintaining self-serve, interactive dashboards; and providing customer and portfolio insights. There is a significant amount of cross-divisional collaboration and exposure to many aspects of the business.




What You’ll Do




Develop marketing campaign targeting incorporating test and learn strategies for digital/email/traditional channels based on objectives obtained through written and verbal communication with our business partners.
Provide ongoing and ad-hoc campaign performance analysis which will include success of the campaign, insights and recommendations for future campaigns.
Explore and analyze data from multiple databases and resources.
Develop new data visualization dashboards while enhancing and maintaining existing reports; utilizing platforms such as Tableau.
Generate ad-hoc analysis based on customer data and transactional behaviour, enabling our business partners to make informed decisions.
Collaborate with multiple parts of the business and serve as a subject matter expert.
Participate in business council and other projects as a marketing analytics lead.
Champion change and innovation across all supported areas of analytics.




Who You Are




We are looking for individuals who are:




Creative and courageous with the ability to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold, strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment
Action oriented and comfortable taking calculated risks to better serve our customers and business
Outcome focused, critical thinkers with the ability to analyze and visualize, to ensure continuous improvement across our entire business
Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward




What You Bring




Undergraduate degree in Math, Science, Economics or related programs
Understanding of the credit card business/financial services industry
Programming experience, preferably in SAS or SQL; knowledge of Python, R or Hive would be an asset
Intermediate experience with business intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau, Power BI)
Superior analytical and problem-solving skills, previous experience in an analytics environment
Proven ability to translate business needs into program/technical requirements
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong attention to detail and accuracy
Adaptable and flexible; ability to navigate changing priorities




Canadian Tire and its family of companies are boldly shaping retail in Canada and we continue to deliver a positive experience for our customers. As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies.




To learn more about this team and the Canadian Tire family of companies follow us on LinkedIn.




Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.

We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.

Title: Data Analyst (Contract)
Description:
Bayshore HealthCare is one of the country’s leading providers of home and community health care services and is a Canadian owned company. Bayshore HealthCare is proud to showcase its achievement as a Platinum member of Canada’s Best Managed Companies Program every year since 2006.




Bayshore Home Care solutions team is looking for a Data Analyst to join their Consumer Insights and Market Research team.




This position is a 12-month contract with the possibility of extension.




Key Duties And Responsibilities




Using statistical tools to interpret data sets, paying particular attention to trends and patterns that could be valuable for diagnostic and predictive analytics efforts.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in data sets. Preparing reports that effectively communicate trends and patterns.
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets that could be helpful for the business
Derive actionable insights from data sets
Interpret data, formulate reports, and make recommendations
Reviewing and analyzing data from multiple sources and communicating results and recommendations
Data mining and validating data integrity
Translating business needs into analytics/reporting requirements to support decisions and workflows with required information
Developing and building frameworks and processes to analyze unstructured data as well as data from traditional sources
Identify opportunities to improve processes and strategies with technology solutions.
Improve, automate, and simplify existing reporting, and ensure it is clearly communicated to stakeholders in business context.
Develop and manage a detailed project schedule and work plan
Familiarity with concepts like customer lifecycle management and customer lifetime value
Provide project updates on a consistent basis to various stakeholders about strategy, adjustments, and progress
Support the Sr. Manager, Consumer Insights and Market Research with larger analytics projects and ad-hoc requests
Adhere to Bayshore Policies and Procedures.
Maintain confidentiality of client and corporate information and discusses same only with appropriate Bayshore personnel.




Work Location : Mississauga, National Office ( Hybrid)




Education And Experience




1 to 2 years of demonstrated success and experience in relevant field – Data Analysis
Ability to interpret large amounts of data and to multi-task
Excellent knowledge of statistical packages, databases, and business research tools acumen
Familiarity with CRM programs
Working knowledge of data warehousing, modelling, and mining
Proven ability to solve problems creatively
Project Management skills and exceptional organizational skills. Ability to command many details simultaneously.
Experience seeing projects through the full life cycle
Strong interpersonal skills and extremely resourceful
Proven ability to complete projects according to outlined scope, budget, and timeline
Ability to take initiative, manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment; work collaboratively with cross-functional teams; and ensure high quality deliverables with high attention to detail.
Working knowledge of PowerBI and Microsoft Excel for data analysis
Demonstrated prioritization ability, solution oriented and resilient with the ability to adapt and work well under pressure
Excellent oral and written communication skills.




Primary Location




ON-Mississauga

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
We are a fast-growing Canadian intimate apparel brand with a passion for empowering our community. We are hiring a Sr Data Analyst to join our team to build business performance dashboards, socialize learnings and recommend growth opportunities. You will partner with key stakeholders to identify business challenges and provide insights to drive product and program strategy.




Responsibilities:

Define and develop dashboards and visualization for key metrics and KPIs in Looker
Collaborate with the Analytics Engineering team to expand coverage of reliable data and automate recurrent data needs
Build and maintain regular and ad hoc dashboards and tailored visualizations that help teams make data-driven decisions
Partner with key stakeholders to dive deep into the business challenges and identify insights that will drive product and program strategy




We are looking for:

2-3 years of experience with Looker (LookML Models, Building Derived Tables)
Experience in relational and dimensional datasets, data warehouses, and ETL techniques to deliver BI solutions
3+ years of relevant experience in data analytics, data science, or related field
Advanced knowledge and expertise of SQL
Understanding of data engineering pipelines and building dashboards for data visualization
Excellent written and verbal communication skills; the ability to effectively communicate with both technical and non-technical teams
Strong critical thinking and problem solving skills

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Position: Data Analyst

Location: Fully Remote

Starts: Spring 2023

Duration: Up to two years

Status: Freelance

Rate: Up to $55/hr DOE

Our client, a Toronto-based digital agency, is looking for a Data Analyst to potentially join their team in a long term freelance role.

What you'll be doing in this Data Analyst role:

You'll join an agile team working on digital projects for a government client focuses on data migration, storage and anlysis
You'll build plans to analyze new and existing data forms: identifying linkages, integrating data models, developing policies and presenting statistical analyses
You'll develop and share service metrics and dashboards
You'll advise on data-driven governance policies
You'll mentor and collaborate team members throughout project planning and development


Qualifications for this Data Analyst role:

5+ years of relevant experience
Experience leading data science and analytics (for both digital and non-digital services)
Experience working with cross-functional teams in a large, complex environment
Preferable you have experience working with a public sector organization


Apply online with a description of your qualifications and any relevant work samples if you're interested in this role.

Submit resume (and samples if applicable) to: caroline.cegielski@jobalert.creativecircle.com

Creative Circle ULC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, colour, race, citizenship, ethnic origin, place of origin, creed, disability, family status, marital status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, record of offences and/or any other ground protected by applicable law. If you require accommodation in the application process on the basis of a disability or any other ground protected by applicable law, please contact a member of our Human Resources team at HumanResources@creativecircle.com or your Creative Circle Recruiter to make arrangements.

Title: Data Analyst, Financial Services Group
Description:
Who Are We?




We built our ﬁrm to be everything typical consultancies are not. 




At Optimus SBR, we are a dynamic group of entrepreneurial thinkers who come from diverse backgrounds and fields of specialty with a passion for growing business – both ours and our clients’.




As a firm that was built on culture, we value our people and their growth, and we firmly believe that our people come first. Each of us embody the entrepreneurial spirit and have something unique to contribute to the fabric of our organization. Things like our seven employee created-and-led committees and regular celebratory events came from employees who subscribed to building a culture that puts people first. As a consulting firm, our people are our business – their happiness and engagement is directly correlated to our success.




That’s why we’ve been consistently rated one of the best places to work in North America – and are one of the fastest growing.




The Position




As we continue to grow, we will have exciting opportunities for Data Analysts to join our Financial Services Group. 




The successful candidates will have the opportunity to collaborate, build and succeed as part of a team of high performing professionals, and the ability to share challenges and rewards that come from working with a dynamic group of entrepreneurial thinkers who come from diverse backgrounds and fields of specialty with a passion for growing businesses - both ours and our clients’.




Our Data Analysts demonstrate a high level of technical, industry knowledge and skills, working on various development projects across multiple lines of business within Banking and Financial Services.




You are ambitious, enthusiastic and adaptable with the ability to solve complex problems in a fast-paced environment. You have solid working experience and understanding of the processes within Banking and Financial Services. You are confident, ambitious and have the ability to wear multiple hats and adapt to changing needs and environments while working independently.




Responsibilities




Key resource in collecting, organizing, and interpreting data information to make it useful for a range of lines of businesses
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
Evolving and managing cross functional processes to ensure data integrity & compliance across numerous, diverse user communities
Champion the use of data to drive decision making and inform clients of quality standards/thresholds of acceptance for data input
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
Participate in project planning, administration and recommendation documents
Contribute to the life and culture of Optimus SBR 

 

Qualifications 




Advanced level programming ability and experience with leading data tools (i.e. SQL, SAS, Netezza, Python, Tableau, R, Hadoop, Power BI etc.)
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
Ability to create reports and dashboards
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Prior banking and financial services experience is considered a strong asset
Prior consulting experience, is an asset
Excellent writing and communication skills. Bilingualism in English & Spanish is considered an asset.
Results-oriented individual with the ability to meet aggressive timelines
Innovative and dynamic. Brings an entrepreneurial spirit to our business
Strong work ethic and someone who is energetic, enthusiastic and committed to developing their career
Required Education: Related University Degree 




What's in it for you?




Whether you come from another consulting firm, or have experience working in industry, we welcome your unique perspectives and knowledge into our talent pool.




When you come on board, we offer a comprehensive Total Rewards Program including:

Competitive compensation
Annual performance bonuses
Flexible health benefits
Career development program
A performance culture that encourages, promotes and celebrates hard work, innovation, and overall employee contributions. One that encourages you to define your pathway, and the timeline to achieve the next level.




Beyond compensation, we also offer:

A culture of rewards and recognition
An ability to make a difference and a lasting impact
A chance to work with dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing teams
An opportunity to do challenging work and to contribute above and beyond
A flexible work/life balance
Join one of our many committees to broaden your horizon, meet new people, enhance your skills and give back to your community and workplace.




A Bold Attitude




It means that we’re authentic. What you see is what you get. No preconceived notions. No consultant speak. No nonsense.




It means that we like to think of ourselves as the anti-consultants. We don’t assume to have prescribed answers. We make sure we’re asking the right questions, collaborate with our clients, and get results.




It means that we’re engaging. Our work may never be easy, but that doesn’t mean working with us needs to feel hard. Or onerous. Or boring. The issues we tackle may be challenging, but it’s in our DNA to make the answers inspiring.




It means we judge strategy by its execution. Ideas only make an impact if they inspire action.

It means that we embrace the fog. Our processes, our frameworks, and our trust in one another inspires a sense of conﬁdence that no matter how complex the situation, we’ll ﬁnd clarity.




It means that our ambition drives us to build the kind of company we’ve always wanted to work for, and the type of company our clients have always wanted to work with.




We thank all applicants in advance for their interest however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

We thank all applicants in advance for their interest however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Mediabrands - Data Analyst & Developer roles (General Application)
Description:
Interested in joining Mediabrands? This job post is a general application for Data Analyst and Developer opportunities at Mediabrands.




Working with an established Data & Tech team, Data Analysts and Developers are responsible for providing reporting and data management assistance to Mediabrands Canada's internal and external clients.




Data Analyst And Developer Opportunities Range From




Jr. Decision Science Analyst
Jr. Data Analyst
Jr. Business Intelligence Developer
Audience & Analytics Coordinator
Analyst, Decision Science
Data Analyst
Business Intelligence Developer
Analyst, Audience & Analytics
Sr. Decision Science Analyst
Sr. Data Analyst
Sr. Business Intelligence Developer
Senior Analyst, Audience & Analytics




Key Responsibilities




Work with Data & Technology Solutions Team teams on continued support and maintenance of existing dashboards and data feeds
Provide Ad Hoc Analysis of data sources and decide on best way to incorporate them into reports and dashboards
Identify and troubleshoot issues with existing processes and fix issues as and when then occur
Liaise with Data Providers to ensure data feeds are always online and working consistently
Create reports and dashboards within Tableau using the best data visualization techniques
Make recommendations for improvements in dash-boarding and reporting to management
Develop a thorough understanding of existing processes and client needs
Liaise with a variety of internal stakeholders




Desired Skills & Experience




MS SQL Server Scripting – selecting, joining, aggregating, debugging & creating views and procedures
Strong understanding of RDBMs systems – specifically reporting
Strong problem solving, business analysis and quantitative skills
Strong communication skills (verbal & written); ability to provide concise, clear reporting and actionable analysis
Ability to pull data from multiple sources and formulate comprehensive and actionable reports
Proven ability to self-check work to ensure results are error-free
Ability to plan, organize and work on multiple tasks simultaneously
Proficiency with MS Excel & Powerpoint
Post-secondary education in Marketing, Advertising, Social Sciences, Computer Sciences or related fields (Nice to have)
Experience with Business Intelligence, Tableau, Data Visualization, Python, and R (Nice to have)




What do we prioritize at Mediabrands & Kinesso Canada? Putting People First.




🌱 Investing in Your Career Growth: 42% of staff across Canada were promoted last year. With a network of agencies in Canada and over 130 offices worldwide, we support your professional goals locally and globally. #likeaboss




😎 Promoting Flexible Working: A hybrid workweek that works for you! Prefer to work from another country? We have the opportunity to work from anywhere in the world for 6 weeks each year. #youdoyou




❤️ Prioritizing Your Wellbeing: We start with a minimum of 37 paid days off including vacation and monthly wellness days. We also have 4-day long weekends year-round, meeting-free Friday afternoons, half-day summer Fridays, competitive benefits, RRSP matching, and more. Mental health training is provided for everyone and we have certified Mental Health First Aiders on staff to offer support. #selfcarematters




🙏 Building a Community Where Everyone Belongs: Leading the industry in our efforts to increase representation, celebrate uniqueness, and build community, we always look for new ways to foster a sense of belonging through our culture, our partnerships and our work. #youbelong




🎨 Embracing Challenging Projects: We offer opportunities to be involved with memorable, collaborative and engaging media campaigns for internationally recognized brands. Our work is reflective of the passion, agility, curiosity and drive of individuals across Mediabrands and Kinesso. #winningtogether




Employment Transparency




IPG Mediabrands is an equal opportunity employer and we welcome and encourage applications from all interested parties, regardless of their preferred official language. Accommodations are available, upon request, for those with a disability or medical need during any stage of the recruitment process. We thank all candidates for their interest in IPG Mediabrands, however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.




About Us




IPG Mediabrands is the global media arm of Interpublic Group (NYSE: IPG). Today, the network manages $39 billion in marketing investment on behalf of its clients, employing over 10,000 marketing communication specialists in more than 130 countries.




A proven entity in helping clients maximize business results through integrated, intelligence-driven marketing strategies, IPG Mediabrands is committed to driving automated buying, pay-for-performance and digital innovation solutions through its network of media agencies which in Canada includes UM, Initiative and Media Experts. Its roster of specialty service agencies including MAGNA, Cadreon, Reprise Digital, Orion and Kinesso, offer technologies and industry moving partnerships that are recognized for delivering unprecedented bottom line results for clients.
