Title: Strategy Transformation Data Analyst
Description:
Come Work with Us!




At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.




Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.




Job Title




Strategy Transformation Data Analyst




Job Description




What is the opportunity?




Are you interested in the opportunity to work as a Strategy Transformation Data Analyst? This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a dynamic team responsible for enabling and driving adoption of strategic tools and engineering mindset behaviors across the global technology team, supporting our Investor & Treasury Services business and clients. The Strategy Transformation Data Analyst will enable and make an impact on our broader organization.




What will you do?




Data gathering & analysis to support executive reporting and help drive decision-making across different on the Strategy Transformation.
Strategic roadmap measures and benefits tracking and monitoring.
Marketing & communications of strategy benefits success stories.
Coordination and facilitation across strategic initiatives and milestones delivery.
Monitoring, tracking and reporting I&TS IT Strategic metrics and measures for executive reporting across different levels across the organization, including metrics evolutions journey that allows better alignment across business & IT.
Communicate and create content that helps to explain I&TS IT teams and share the linkage and how the T&O Strategy enables us as IT function to deliver business goals.




What do you need to succeed?




Must-have




1-2 year of experience with a focus on business, marketing, engineering, or related areas.
Leadership acumen and a passion to apply it in a dynamic business environment.
Excellent interpersonal and highly developed communication skills (verbal and written).
Creative and analytical thinker who is self-driven and capable of working in a fast paced environment.
Strong MS Office skills – Word, Outlook, Excel and PowerPoint.
Self-motivated, able to manage time and work with minimal supervision.




Nice-to-have




Active curiosity in technology and innovation
Experience dealing with ambiguity (thrives on conditions characterized by ambiguity)
Relationship management and building partnerships with key stakeholder
Ability to develop others




RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.




What’s in it for you?




We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.




A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
Flexible work/life balance options
Opportunities to do challenging work




Job Summary




Address:




TORONTO, Ontario, Canada




City:




CAN-ON-TORONTO




Country:




Canada




Work hours/week:




37.5




Employment Type:




Full time




Platform:




Technology and Operations




Job Type:




Regular




Pay Type:




Salaried




Posted Date:




2022-11-17-08:00




Application Deadline:




2023-01-31-08:00




Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment




At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.




We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.




Join our Talent Community




Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.




Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers.

Title: HR Data Analyst
Description:
GFL Environmental is looking for an HR Data Analyst to join our team based out of our Corporate Office in Vaughan! The Human Resources Data Analyst provides administrative and data support to the HR department. The position is best suited to a strong administrator with an interest in Human Resources who enjoys variety and thrives when working independently.

Key Responsibilities:

Updates and maintains employee records and HR databases using HRIS system (Workday)
Maintains records in system; ensures employee profiles are accurate and up to date
Processes documentation for all employees in accordance with company policy and procedures
Processes new employee requisite forms necessary to set up payroll
Analyzes employee related statistics and reports exceptions


Knowledge, Skills and Competencies:

Completion of a college diploma or university degree in HR or Business
Previous experience working in an HR department
Aptitude with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint) and HRIS
Workday experience is an asset
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, as well as excellent interpersonal skills
Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment with minimal supervision
Collaborative team player with a strong client service approach
Acts responsibly and ethically while working with sensitive and confidential personal information
Strong organizational skills and excellent attention to detail
Ability to learn new things quickly and adapt to changing priorities


We thank you for your interest. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

GFL Environmental is an equal opportunity employer and encourages women, Aboriginal people, persons with disabilities and members of visible minorities to apply. We seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences. GFL will provide accommodations to job applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. If you require an accommodation, please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Data Analytics Lead Analyst
Description:
Job Id: 22585027




Job Overview




The Data Analytics Lead Analyst is a senior-level position responsible for liaising between business users and technologists, a strategic professional who stays abreast of developments within Compliance Technology Services and contributes to directional strategy. Recognized subject matter Data Quality authority for Compliance Technology Services. Requires Capital Markets and trade surveillance data experience. Developed communication and diplomacy skills are required to guide, influence, and convince others, in particular colleagues in other areas. Significant impact on the area through complex deliverables. Provides advice and counsel related to Data Quality or Capital Markets and trade surveillance data. Work impacts Compliance, which eventually affects the overall performance and effectiveness of Citigroup.




Responsibilities:




Applies in-depth understanding of how data quality collectively integrates within the Compliance Data Technology Services as well as coordinate and contribute to the objectives of Compliance Technology Services.
Identify and communicate risks and impacts and propose risk mitigation options, considering business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment
Employs developed communication and diplomacy skills are required in order to guide, influence and convince others, in particular colleagues in other areas and occasional external customers.
Produces detailed analysis of issues where the best course of action is not evident from the information available, but actions must be recommended/ taken.
Provide in-depth and sophisticated analyses with interpretive thinking to define problems, develop innovative solutions and influence strategic functional decisions
Supervise day-to-day staff management issues, including resource management, work allocation, mentoring/coaching and other duties and functions as assigned
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.




Qualifications:




7+ years experience with data analysis working with trade surveillance products and their life cycle.
5+ years experience and have the ability to write and execute SQL code in complex ways and a backlog in dealing with large volumes of data.
Strong knowledge of any following Capital Markets products: Equity, Options, Futures, FX, Commodities, Fix Income, Non-Equity, Derivatives, Rates, and GPS.
Ability to interact with team members in geographically diverse areas to handoff work back-and-forth to achieve maximum productivity and is an excellent communicator.
Proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint) with extensive experience using Excel for data analysis.




Education:




Bachelor's degree - Computer Science, Finance or Data Science /University degree or equivalent experience




Citi Canada is an equal opportunity employer. Accordingly, we will make accommodations to respond to the needs of people with disabilities (including, without limitation, physical and mental health disabilities) during the recruitment process and otherwise in accordance with law. Individuals who view themselves as Aboriginals, members of visible minority or racialized communities, and people with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

Technology




-------------------------------------------------




Job Family:

------------------------------------------------------

Full time




------------------------------------------------------




Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.




Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.




Citigroup Inc. and its subsidiaries ("Citi”) invite all qualified interested applicants to apply for career opportunities. If you are a person with a disability and need a reasonable accommodation to use our search tools and/or apply for a career opportunity review Accessibility at Citi.

Title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst
Description:
“Are you passionate about recycling and sustainability and want to make a positive impact for the environment and society?”

A prerequisite for a functioning circular economy is that all products and materials are returned after use. RLG has a vision of building and operating a reverse supply chain for our customers that optimizes collection and recycling in order to maximize materials recovered for use in new products and packaging while driving innovation.

Reverse Logistics Group (RLG) is seeking a BI Data Analyst to expand our environmental compliance solutions with a focus on supporting the implementation of Ontario’s future Blue Box program, supporting other business lines, and supporting our growing Canada team.

RLG is a tech-enabled service provider with twenty-four offices worldwide. We serve some of the world’s largest producers, e-commerce, and retail organizations in over eighty countries. In 2021, RLG expanded its operations into Canada. We are a small dynamic start-up team working together in Canada with ambitious growth plans to accelerate our impact.

Job Description

The Business Intelligence Data Analyst will work collectively and collaboratively with RLG’s Operations team, IT and Software Product Development team. Primarily, in this role, you will be supporting the various Operational service delivery functions and, secondarily, supporting staff in other divisions and their activities.




Your Key Responsibilities:

Support the Operations team and other internal stakeholders with operational data reconciliation contributing to operational invoice reviews and approval
Support IT and Product Development team to integrate Power BI with RLG’s software
Prepare data for analysis, model data in Microsoft Power BI, and visualize data of operational and business activities
Design and build scalable data models, clean and transform data, and enable advanced analytic capabilities that provide meaningful business value
Construct tables, views, and reports from multiple data sources, to enable key decision-making
Generate standard monthly reports for review and approval by internal stakeholders
Generate standard and ad-hoc reports based on specific operational requests and projects
Other duties as assigned




Your Profile:

College Diploma or Bachelor’s Degree in statistics, engineering, or mathematics
Fundamental understanding of data repositories and data processes, both on-premises and in the cloud
Power BI skills (e.g. data visualization, relational databases, SQL, DAX, power query, and similar BI tools)
Microsoft Certified: Power BI Data Analyst Associate considered an asset
Minimum of two years of relevant work experience
Confident in the Microsoft Office environment, especially Excel. Experience with pivot tables, lookups, conditional formatting, array formulas etc. considered an asset
Data Studio and/or other connector tools
Strong data analysis skills with a holistic business views to suggest improvements and corrections
Strong organizational skills and customer service focused
Professional communication skills (written and verbal)
Self motivated, and competent when working independently, and within teams
Capable of working with high efficiency and accuracy under time pressures
Demonstrated ability to handle confidential information
Possess a flexible, adaptable approach with a high level of responsiveness to business needs




What to expect:

Comprehensive employer paid health and dental benefits from day 1
Employer matching of employee RSP contribution
RLG is supportive of professional development and training, with opportunities to work globally
RLG has a dynamic international working environment: 39 nationalities with diverse backgrounds
Hybrid position: two days a week from home and three days a week from our office in downtown Toronto

Should you require accommodation or support in any aspect of our recruitment and selection process, we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Data Analyst - Health Records - Regular Full-Time (230083)
Description:
Toronto, ON, CA Posted: 1/20/2023 2:00:22 PM

We currently have a Regular Full-Time opportunity for a Data Analyst in the Health Records department at our Bayview campus.

Hours Of Work

Weekdays: Days; 8hrs; As per schedule

Summary Of Duties

The Data Analyst in the Release of Information Department is Responsible for:

Providing timely response to requests for Release of Personal Health Information for all type of requests such as: Patients, insurance, legal, medicals, etc.
Provide support to Risk Management by processing records required for medical/legal investigations
Accurately track Release of Information Requests Using the Winrecs application system
Ensure that requests are processed within established timelines.
Generate weekly & monthly reports to identify outstanding requests.
Generate invoices or statement for payment for services.
Answer phones;
Review charts to identify documentation requested and flag for photocopying.
Access the Electronic Patient Record System to retrieve and print necessary patient information.
Access Patient Care System to validate patient demographic information, visits, attending physician, etc.
Access the departmental chart tracking & deficiency system to reserve and locate charts.
Liaise with Medical Staff to ensure completion of documentation required to process a request.
Submit referral forms and pertinent patient information to other facilities.
Prepare patients’ record for Review and Capacity Board

Qualifications/Skills

Canadian HealthCare Information Management Associated certification and member in good standing with the Association required or a higher level of education in the health care related field may be considered.
Recent experience in a Health Records Department – Release of Information environment is a definite asset
Proven sound knowledge of Personal Health Information Privacy & Security related acts & guidelines
Ability to communicate effectively with all levels of staff and maintain good public relations with physicians, patients and other hospital staff
Sound judgment and diplomacy
Proven ability to respond effectively in stressful situations
Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written)
Effective time management, and resource management skills; able to work well under pressure and tight deadlines

Qualified candidates are invited to submit their cover letter and resume (in one document) quoting 230083 to:

Human Resources

Sunnybrook Health Sciences Centre

To apply, please click "Apply for Position" at the bottom of this page.

Sunnybrook Health Sciences Centre is committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). If you require accommodation for disability during any stage of the recruitment process, please indicate this in your cover letter.

Sunnybrook Health Sciences Centre is strongly committed to inclusion and diversity within its community and welcomes all applicants including but not limited to: visible minorities, all religions and ethnicities, persons with disabilities, LGBTQ persons, and all others who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas.

Please be advised that in order to be eligible for employment at Sunnybrook, all new hires must have received the full series of a COVID-19 vaccine or combination of COVID-19 vaccines approved by Health Canada (e.g., two doses of a two-dose vaccine series, or one dose of a single-dose vaccine series); AND have received the final dose of the COVID-19 vaccine at least 14 days ago. Medical exemptions or any other kind of requested exemption based upon the Hospital’s obligations pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code will be considered on a case-by-case basis.

HTML:
Toronto, ON, CA Posted: 1/20/2023 2:00:22 PM

We currently have a Regular Full-Time opportunity for a Data Analyst in the Health Records department at our Bayview campus.

Hours Of Work

Weekdays: Days; 8hrs; As per schedule

Summary Of Duties

The Data Analyst in the Release of Information Department is Responsible for:
  • Providing timely response to requests for Release of Personal Health Information for all type of requests such as: Patients, insurance, legal, medicals, etc.
  • Provide support to Risk Management by processing records required for medical/legal investigations
  • Accurately track Release of Information Requests Using the Winrecs application system
  • Ensure that requests are processed within established timelines.
  • Generate weekly & monthly reports to identify outstanding requests.
  • Generate invoices or statement for payment for services.
  • Answer phones;
  • Review charts to identify documentation requested and flag for photocopying.
  • Access the Electronic Patient Record System to retrieve and print necessary patient information.
  • Access Patient Care System to validate patient demographic information, visits, attending physician, etc.
  • Access the departmental chart tracking & deficiency system to reserve and locate charts.
  • Liaise with Medical Staff to ensure completion of documentation required to process a request.
  • Submit referral forms and pertinent patient information to other facilities.
  • Prepare patients’ record for Review and Capacity Board
Qualifications/Skills
  • Canadian HealthCare Information Management Associated certification and member in good standing with the Association required or a higher level of education in the health care related field may be considered.
  • Recent experience in a Health Records Department – Release of Information environment is a definite asset
  • Proven sound knowledge of Personal Health Information Privacy & Security related acts & guidelines
  • Ability to communicate effectively with all levels of staff and maintain good public relations with physicians, patients and other hospital staff
  • Sound judgment and diplomacy
  • Proven ability to respond effectively in stressful situations
  • Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written)
  • Effective time management, and resource management skills; able to work well under pressure and tight deadlines
Qualified candidates are invited to submit their cover letter and resume (in one document) quoting 230083 to:

Human Resources

Sunnybrook Health Sciences Centre

To apply, please click "Apply for Position" at the bottom of this page.

Sunnybrook Health Sciences Centre is committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Medical exemptions or any other kind of requested exemption based upon the Hospital’s obligations pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code will be considered on a case-by-case basis.

Title: ST-Analyst, Data Analytics & Reporting (8-12 months, Summer 2023, co-op)
Description:
About Apotex Inc.

Apotex Inc. is a proudly Canadian, global pharmaceutical company that produces high-quality, affordable medicines for patients around the world. Apotex employs almost 8,000 people worldwide in manufacturing, R&D, and commercial operations. Apotex Inc. exports to more than 100 countries and territories and operates in more than 45 countries, with a significant presence in Canada, the US, Mexico, and India. Through vertical integration, Apotex is comprised of multiple divisions and affiliates including Apotex Inc., focused on generics; Apobiologix, a division of Apotex Inc. focused on biosimilar development; Aveva, an affiliate of Apotex Inc. fully integrated global developer and manufacturer of complete transdermal solutions; Apotex Consumer Products, a division of Apotex Inc. focused on brand name products; and Global Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients (GAPI), a division of Apotex Inc. focused on the manufacturing of active pharmaceutical ingredients (API) for Apotex and third parties. For more information visit: www.apotex.com .

Job Summary

Serves as an entry level position within Global New Product Launch; focus is on delivering customized and professional services related to NPL processes (in the form of customized reporting and data sets).

Collaborate with NPL management to ensure business tools support the mandate of this group.

Job Responsibilities

Assist executives & management with customized reports & business analysis related to NPL process.
Assist executive in defining & tracking Business Success Criteria performance metrics. Manage business performance reporting of key performance indicators, metrics, measures & business results. Measure the effectiveness of the KPIs & facilitate fine tuning of the KPIs to assure the quality delivery of all projects & customer satisfaction.
Provide strategically focused analysis & business reporting to enable informed decision making internally & for senior management. Support development & implementation of NPL strategic & FY operational plans, including resource/capacity planning, by providing accurate & detailed reports.
Research, analyse, develop & implement business effectiveness & improvement initiatives including models, tools & prototypes for NPL & provide strategic advice on business practices & processes to enhance efficiency & effectiveness. Utilize advanced analytical techniques to identify root causes of issues & implement corrective action/solutions.
Develop & foster effective & mutually beneficial collaboration & data sharing with other departments. Collaborate with counterparts in Sales & Marketing, R&D, Supply Chain, Finance & Operations related to NPL process to obtain business data that support launch readiness & maintain ongoing supply of commercialized products.
Define & manage data fields required in specific analysis. Collaborate with key contacts in other data source areas, negotiate & establish process to ensure accurate & updated data are available for analysis & reporting. Create & manage database using linked data, generate regular & ad-hoc reports to provide data analysis across various areas. Establish data linking & mapping with various systems.
Work as a member of a team to achieve all outcomes
Perform all work in support of our Corporate Values
Perform all work in accordance with all established regulatory & compliance & safety requirements
Work in a safe manner collaborating as a team member to achieve all outcomes
Demonstrate Behaviours that exhibit our organizational Values: Collaboration, Courage, Perseverance & Passion.
Ensure personal adherence with all compliance programs including the Global Business Ethics & Compliance Program, Global Quality policies & procedures, Safety & Environment & HR policies.
All other relevant duties as assigned.

Job Requirements
Education
Must be enrolled in a recognized post-secondary Co-op education program (working towards a university degree or equivalent in Business and / or Management Analytics).
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Strong knowledge of and experience with Microsoft Suite Applications – particularly Excel. Knowledge of project management software is a plus.
Excellent oral and written English communication skills.
Strong decision-making, interpersonal, communication and facilitation skills.
Excellent attention to detail.
Excellent time management and organization skills (ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously).

At Apotex, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible work environment, where all employees feel valued, respected and supported.

Apotex offers accommodation for applicants with disabilities as part of its recruitment process. If you are contacted to arrange for an interview or testing, please advise us if you require an accommodation.

Title: Senior Business Intelligence (BI) and Data Analyst
Description:
Role Description










The Senior Business Intelligence (BI) and Data Analyst is responsible for analytics and insight that support all areas of business including ongoing enhancement and performance of a leading loyalty program and non-loyalty/operation analytics for a fuel retailer. The analyst will also be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining advance analytic tools/ dashboards.







The ideal candidate has strong knowledge of Tableau, creativity in finding solutions for data visualization and hands-on experience in building complex dashboards. The ideal candidate will also have solid data mining capabilities campaign analytics, customer analysis, and predictive modeling, preferably in a fast-moving retail like pharmacy, fuels retailing or grocery.







This role is a unique opportunity to join a dynamic team of analytical professionals that partners up with Business and Technology to design innovative, value-adding customer engagement solutions for our clients. The role is a great fit for motivated individuals seeking to further develop their expertise in the area of retail, complex customer behavior and predictive analytics.







Primary Responsibilities







Develop advanced dashboards and self-serve tools using Tableau, including dashboard design and development, as well as design and development of underlying data structure
Generate analytical insights that drive the performance of a large-scale loyalty program
Establish mechanisms for program / campaign performance measurement
Create custom analysis that add strategic value to the understanding of customer behavior and / or campaign performance
Check data integrity and manipulate large volumes of data
Communicate findings to peers within Analytics team, and, on occasions, to partners from business and technology
Contribute to process standardization and creation of scalable solutions
Contribute to the overall operations and culture of the company, fostering our values and policies







Capability Requirements – education, skills & experience




Graduate degree in Statistics, Mathematics, or other quantitative fields
3+ years of expert-level experience with Tableau and other BI tools
3+ years of expert-level hands-on coding in SQL
Solid understanding of the structure of relational databases
Data mining experience
Ability to take complex data and visualize it to a business story
Ability to find creative solutions to analytical and data problems
Ability to develop analytical frameworks and generate / communicate business insights
Attention to detail, high aptitude for problem solving and a natural interest in understanding and explaining consumer behavior / business
Good communication skills
Proficiency with SAS or Python is an asset

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
We are on a new path called NEXT HORIZON

The insurance industry is changing at an exponential pace, driven by changing customer experience, climate change and technology. In response Gore Mutual is making bold moves to reposition our company as a purpose driven, digitally led national insurer. Next Horizon is our 10-year vision and strategy that sets a new path for our company.

Come and make your mark on our Next Horizon!

Reporting to the Manager of Business Intelligence, the Senior Data Analyst will be responsible for developing reports that give actionable insight to business teams. This will help drive business decisions and support operational efficiency. The Senior Data Analyst will also help drive improvement and standardization in the business intelligence ecosystem.

What will you do?


Work with business stakeholders to understand requirements and data use-cases; with a focus on how data relates to the business needs
Design and implement data pipelines to curate and transform data for report development
Curate data from various SQL data sources
Designing, prototyping, and documenting new analyses, reports, and visualizations
Build reports/dashboards using Power BI to support the business in data-driven decision making and operations
Support cross-functional projects within Data and Analytics department, working with tiger teams on end-to-end development of high-value initiatives
Help foster an environment within the organization that promotes the use of data and analytics as a tool to support business decisions


What will you need to succeed?


Formal education from a community college or an undergraduate degree in business, data science or computer science.
6+ years of experience in business intelligence development, and data analysis.
Proficiency in SQL, Power BI, Azure data factory, and wireframing.
Ability to work independently and manage time efficiently.
Sense of accountability and ownership.
Exposure to property and casualty industry and data pipeline development is required.
Analytical mindset and ability to problem solve in a disruptive change led eco system.


Gore Mutual Insurance is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities during all phases of the recruiting process, including the application process. If you require accommodation because of a disability, we will work with you to meet your needs. If you are selected for an interview and require accommodation, please advise the HR representative who will consult with you to determine an appropriate accommodation.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Senior Business Intelligence Analyst

Location: Mississauga, ON(hybrid/3 days in a week)




We are looking to hire an experienced Senior Business Intelligence Analyst to support the next generation of payment solution for eCommerce team. The Business Analyst will join the Emerging Payments’ team and be responsible for working with business, technology, and operational partners to understand requirements and translate these into functional solutions.




The Business Intelligence Analyst plays a pivotal role in the proper solutioning and design of Business Intelligence solutions for payment data. The Analyst designs data model and field mappings to load transactional data from payment systems into the data warehouse to build reporting and analytic capabilities. In this role, you will be a key contributor responsible for enabling the business with the right information, tools, and technologies to gain valuable insights and make data-driven decisions.




Responsibilities:




· Collaborate with business stakeholders to gather, document, and analyze business requirements to turn data into insights that support business decisions.

· Produce functional specifications, data mapping documents and maintain end-to-end requirements traceability.

· Build and support data transformations, data structures and dependencies, and data models.

· Develop a detailed understanding of relevant business processes, strategies, and goals to provide reporting/dashboards.

· Design and build informative and impactful reports, data visualizations and dashboards to deliver insights for users at all levels.

· Contributes to the planning and execution of reports /dashboards testing tasks.

· Investigate irregularities within data reporting and work cross-functionally to identify and solve inconsistencies or anomalies

· Manage multiple tasks and projects efficiently, and clearly communicate progress and status with business stakeholders

· Contribute to elaborate product roadmap, release, and implementation plans.

· Adhere to project management processes through all phases of the project life cycle, by providing regular updates on FRD progress.

· Use proactive communications to solicit stakeholders’ feedback and approvals to ensure the timely delivery of FRDs and project milestones.

· Co-ordinate and review impact analysis to ensure all risks are mitigated.




Qualifications:




· Should have at least 7 years in a technology and/or business roles

· Experience working in Financial Services or a large complex and/or global environment

· Experience supporting Business intelligence and reporting activities

· Experience using BI tools like Tableau, Power BI, …

· Experience with Agile project management, Jira, and Confluence

· Ability to leverage data to build insights

· Ability to create and maintain good relationships at all levels within the organization

· Proven interpersonal, diplomatic, prioritization and effective communication skills

· Tenacity, Proactive, Creative, Good listening, Strong analysis, and design skills

· Experience in eCommerce or digital payments a plus




Education:




· Bachelor's degree/University degree or equivalent experience

· Master's degree preferred

Title: Business Insight Analyst
Description:
Description

Job Description

Being part of Air Canada is to become part of an iconic Canadian symbol, recently ranked the best Airline in North America. Let your career take flight by joining our diverse and vibrant team at the leading edge of passenger aviation.

Business Insights positions main focus is in the exploration of operational and customer related data using visualizations and identifying potential data relationships in various datasets. The position will be responsible for integrating operational and customer data to conduct modeling and analysis. The position also includes data mining, reporting, statistical modelling and forecasting for various operational and customer measures. The position will support various branches, cross-functional strategies and will require a data visualization skill set.

This position is open for Toronto/ Montreal office.

Key Functions & Accountabilities: (Responsibilities, Activities, Authority levels, etc)

Evaluate, innovate, and recommend mathematical and statistical approaches for the improvement of current processes.
Develop, implement, and maintain statistical models.
Analyze data, identify trends, produce statistical reports.
Present findings to appropriate value stream.
Design and program queries for extracting information and metrics from data stored in various databases.
Automate current processes and reporting where data is involved.
Design, program, automate, and maintain ad-hoc databases and queries, dashboards, KPIs, scorecards, reports.
Provide supporting data and analysis for business case development for various improvement initiatives.
Utilize analysis best practices to evaluate business issues.
Develop Operational reporting applications to better understand operational pain points
Resolve data integrity and accuracy issues through assessment and evaluation and propose strategies to reduce reoccurrence
Create Monitoring plans to prevent data quality problems.
Provide knowledge transfer of technical skills, report generation, data management, and analysis procedures.
Present findings to appropriate value streams and teams as appropriate.

Qualifications

University degree or college diploma in Statistics, Computer Science or related disciple.
Experience working with data / or as a business insight analyst
Experience using standard statistical software such as R, SAS or other data mining programming tools is required.
Programming and/or knowledge in: SQL, Python.
Strong analytical and applied logic skills.
Creative problem solver who thinks strategically, is results oriented and attentive to details.
Excellent analytical and communication skills (both written and oral) and the ability to meet deadlines in a fast-paced multitasking environment.
Candidate must be self-motivated, can multi-task, and work effectively in an unstructured environment
Ability to understand financial implication of operational decisions and develop cost-benefit studies.
Bilingualism in English and French, an asset.

Conditions Of Employment

Candidates must be eligible to work in the country of interest, at the time any offer of employment is made and seeking any required work permits/visas or other authorizations which may be required is the sole responsibility of the candidates applying for this position.

Linguistic Requirements

Based on equal qualifications, preference will be given to bilingual candidates.

Diversity and Inclusion

Air Canada is strongly committed to Diversity and Inclusion and aims to create a healthy, accessible and rewarding work environment which highlights employees’ unique contributions to our company’s success.

As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from all to help us build a diverse workforce which reflects the diversity of our customers, and communities, in which we live and serve.

Air Canada thanks all candidates for their interest; however only those selected to continue in the process will be contacted.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Our Story

About You

You are a high achiever looking to thrive in a fast-paced environment. You take pride in your own work but are comfortable collaborating with a team of highly motivated individuals. You can communicate clearly and concisely with teammates and clients, and you enjoy strong company culture and camaraderie. You can navigate multiple corporate functions, including global lines of service and corporate centers of excellence. You possess strong interpersonal skills and are willing to take on diverse tasks to achieve the team’s common goal. You value personal and professional growth and are ready to take the next step in advancing your career.

If this sounds like you, well, then you will love the culture at Avison Young!

About Us

Avison Young is a global commercial real estate brokerage and advisory firm, offering transaction, management, financial and consulting services. We’ve designed our corporate structure to best serve our clients by enhancing collaboration across our organization.

Real estate can have an enormous positive impact on people’s lives – and we’re in the business of making spaces and places work better for people. Our purpose is to create real economic, social and environmental value as a global real estate advisor, powered by people.

We care about each other and we have each other’s backs. This makes Avison Young a great place to be a client, and a great place to work. We support the whole person and their complete wellness – economic, mental and physical – because what’s best for our business comes from our people bringing their whole selves to work.

Of course we love it here, but outsiders think we’re pretty great too: Avison Young was awarded the prestigious America’s Best Midsize Employers for 2022, presented by Forbes and Statista, Inc. We’re proud to be regularly recognized for our team, services and culture and our team members enjoy comprehensive compensation and benefit programs. Through our customized work options, we give our people the flexibility to create a work environment that puts their overall well-being first. After all, we are powered by people.

Overview

As a data engineer at Avison Young, you will take ownership of the development of our data pipelines, data infrastructure and Data warehousing. You will team up with technical and business stakeholders, advocate for a high-quality processes and data, and eliminate roadblocks. You'll also enhance our collaborative environment by supporting the engineers on your team through mentorship and knowledge sharing.

In the role, you will partner cross functionally with Innovation, IT and Product. This role will be working on our organizations internal analytics database as well as client facing products that allow our revenue professions to tell the story of the market so you will be able to drive clear results that have a direct impact on our bottom line, and you will be responsible for achieving and exceeding business growth.

Responsibilities

We are seeking data engineer to join our data architecture team. The main functions anticipated for this role include, but are not limited to, the following:

Connecting new data sources to our Global Data Warehouse
Working with Stakeholders and Providers to create new robust data pipelines using a range of tool sets
Monitoring all areas of performance on our platforms
Assisting with Modelling, ETL/ELT and all configuration of wide range of toolsets
Securing all confidential configuration and documentation

What We Value In a Data Engineer

Customer-focused: We believe that doing what’s right for the customer is ultimately what will drive our business forward.
Obsessed with quality:
Team players. You believe that more can be achieved together. You listen to feedback and also provide supportive feedback to help others grow/improve.
Fast learners: You love learning how to use new technologies and then rapidly apply them to new problems.
Pragmatic: You know when it’s appropriate to take shortcuts that don’t sacrifice quality or maintainability.

This is a challenging, entrepreneurial position where the incumbent is expected to be self-motivated (with a very supportive team!) and work autonomously, while maintaining effective communication with the team and ensuring alignment with ‘big picture’ goals.

Qualifications

2+ years of industry experience
B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science or equivalent experience
Strong knowledge of SQL
ELT/ETL tools such as dbt, Airflow, Spark or other modern data engineering toolset
Experience in implementation and supporting Data Warehouse models – particularly Data Vault and Kimball
Experience with Docker and containerized development
Programming experience in Python & use of tools such as GIT
Cloud platforms experience is a plus (MS Azure and/or AWS/GCP)
Excellent written and oral communication skills

Our Equal Opportunity Commitment

Avison Young practices as an equal opportunity employer in all services locations around the world. We are committed to building and maintaining a workforce diverse in experience, skills and knowledge with uniformity in service excellence, commitment and integrity.

The firm maintains a strict policy to ensure employment opportunities are equal and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, protected veteran or military service status, or any other elements protected by law.

For those requiring assistance with disabilities, information relating to the need for accommodation and accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.

Avison Young is committed to employing the best talent with the most fair and equitable recruitment practices. Apply with us TODAY!
Show more Show less

Title: Senior Business Data Analyst
Description:
Botsford is looking for a Sr. Business Data Analysts to support one of our Canadian Banking clients Lifecycle Management programs. They're in the process of onboarding on a new product line in the US market onto Fenergo and the initiative is currently still in a greenfield state. They need strong resources to come in and help develop the data migration strategies and well as manage the data analysis processes, identify discrepancies, and remediate any client data as required to support the initiative.




This will be a multi-year initiative with the first go-live happening by the end of Q4 of 2023.




Main Responsibilities

Contribute to data requirements prioritization and leverage techniques to drive out priorities
Work collaboratively with their business partners, stakeholders from multiple IT teams and external vendors
Perform data analysis and remediate any data issues arising through the migration process
Collaborate closely with IT teams and external vendors to provide holistic solution options, focusing on client experience, ensuring the design and development meets the business and user needs.
Support User Acceptance Testing by supporting planning, development of test cases and execution of tests




Must Haves:

Strong proficiency with SQL, SQL querying, and data analysis
Experience working with Client Data
Experience working within Capital Markets Technology preferably in Client Lifecycle Management
Proven experience with various project delivery methodologies such as Waterfall, Iterative and/or Agile




Nice-to-have:

Python Scripting
Experience working directly on Fenergo Application

Title: Senior Analyst, Optimization and Analytics - Canadian Tire Corporation
Description:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada




Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast dates back to 1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. To reach our goal, we need the best talent to help us evolve and drive change across the business – and boldly help shape Canada’s retail industry. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies.




Interested in being a part of a team that is leading the evolution of retail in Canada?




Embracing and driving change is critical to our success. The complexity and rate at which the retail industry is transforming has increased exponentially in recent years and we are committed to being a leader in the industry. As such we are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join the Canadian Tire Family of Companies.




The Senior Analyst will analyze data from multiple data sets with the goal of identifying, developing and supporting insightful recommendations focused on our network performance. Reporting to the Manager, Optimization and Analytics, the Senior Analyst will assist in the translation of data insights into actionable recommendations. This individual will aid in support and improving of key applications in the Dealer Relations’ team by leverage their automation and data analysis skill set to improve processes. This individual will also support the Dealer Relations’ mandate to foster a collaborative relationship between the Corporation, CTDA and Dealers to enable the successful execution of CTC strategies and initiatives.




What You’ll Do




You understand the importance of data integrity. With an “automate first” mindset, you have the skills and abilities to formulate actionable insights for business stakeholders and to synthesize information across a broad ecosystem to enable data-driven decision making. You are a team player with strong communication skills and with a collaborative spirit. You’re able to network on all levels and have a genuine curiosity that grows your understanding of projects. In this role you will:




Build and improve models and data mining techniques which help assess the overall health of our Dealer network performance.
Review and support current key applications within the division and where possible, enhance analysis with the use of statistical methods to provide support on findings
Develop reporting dashboards & reports to translate complex data into actionable insights across the organization
Query, extract and transform raw data from multiple data warehouses to conduct key insight and in-depth analysis of customer interactions across various channels
Develop and improve key reporting tools using MS Access, MS Excel and VBA code.
Develop and maintain internal databases.
Be responsible for and improving the management and handling of data and act as the Dealer Relations data steward.
Partner with IT and business stakeholders to influence decision-making with data




Who You Are




We are looking for high performing individuals who are:




Agile and innovative individuals, who are able to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold and strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment
Creative thinkers who take initiative and are capable of building, launching and managing projects/programs that drive results for our customers
Problem solvers with the ability to analyze and prioritize to meet business objectives
Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward




What You Bring




Strong analysis, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills with meticulous attention to detail
Ability to create links in Data to build a story.
Ability to identify root cause of issues, recommend solutions and proven ability to draw tangible conclusion from complex and varied data sets
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Access
Retail Experience is considered an asset
Demonstrated organization skills, enabling efficient prioritization of work
5+ years of professional experience demonstrating advanced analytical abilities
University degree or College Diploma (Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or related field an asset)
Ability to program in MS-Access & Excel using Visual Basic is a must, good working knowledge of SQL scripting language
Experience in Automation Platforms such as Power Automate, Power Apps and Excel VBA as well as data preparation, analysis, and statistical tool sets including Power BI, Python, Knime, Power Suites.
Collaborate across teams to create synergies and support with analytical solutions and automation.
Collaborate across teams to bridge the knowledge gap between data and analytics.
Support teams with delivery of effective storylines.
Manage project timelines through effective communication and feedback loops.




Canadian Tire and its family of companies are boldly shaping retail in Canada and we continue to deliver a positive experience for our customers. As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies.




To learn more about this team and the Canadian Tire family of companies follow us on LinkedIn.




Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.

Title: Data Quality Analyst ( Tableau Reporting Analyst)
Description:
Our Banking client in Toronto, Ontario is looking to hire a Tableau Reporting Analyst for a 6-months contract role with possibility of Extension.




What You Will Be Doing…




Build high quality Tableau reports.
Analyze data sources and data points to identify the trends and share insights with business users.
Maintain user access and restriction to reports and its underlying data.
Responsible for automating the data refreshes of the data source in Tableau.
Ensure the weekly, monthly refresh of data files and keep the Dashboard up to date.
Deliver the device-based dashboards by using Tableau mobile.
Responsible for the user walkthrough session and assisting any issues reported.
Proactively identifies innovative opportunities to enhance the reporting and data quality.
Act as a team player, participate in the team’s cross training activities, and provide coverage during staff absences.
Identify issues and problems and escalate immediately.




What You Will Need To Succeed…




Must Have Skills:




3 years+ of Tableau at Expert level
Tableau dashboard building
SQL
Degree




Nice To Have Skills




IBMs Information Analyzer is NTH
Colibra is NTH




Looking for Meaningful Work? We can help!




If you're a technical professional, you know that it can be difficult to find fulfilling work that advances your career. At the Ian Martin Group, we exist to connect professionals like you with meaningful work at industry-leading companies in your field. And we walk the walk, too: as a Certified B Corporation, we believe in using business as a force for good for people, our communities, and the environment.




We value diversity and inclusion and encourage all qualified people to apply. If we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process, please contact us at recruit@ianmartin.com




We encourage all qualified candidates to apply; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted……

Title: Senior Analyst, Data Insights
Description:
Come Work with Us!




At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.




Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.




Job Title




Senior Analyst, Data Insights




Job Description




Data Quality Monitoring




Monitor data quality control exceptions, conduct detailed investigations, including root cause analysis, and identify and document data issues.
Collaborate with business process and report owners, and other users of shared data assets to capture systemic and other self-identified data issues and control gaps.
Use standardized and ad hoc reporting to communicate data quality results, trends and insights to business partners and management.




Issues Management & Resolution (IMR)




Track and manage data quality and control issues from assignment through to resolution by applying best practices and using the Collibra IMR workflow and Jira project management tools.
Collaborate with the Chief Data Office, Data Management Offices, IT and other business functions to facilitate data remediation, adjustments and/or system changes to address the root cause of the data issues.
Provide monthly summary and detailed reporting on resolved and outstanding issues, finding and recommendations to business partners and key stakeholders.




Continuous Improvement




Propose process changes/improvement to address identified gaps or inconsistencies in data, processes and/or controls.
Gain and apply an in-depth understanding of data quality controls, data profiling tools and systems to support the definition and implementation of effective controls and reporting.
Work with the Chief Data Office and other Data Management Offices to support standards and best practices to improve data quality, participating in initiatives to raise awareness and drive improved data quality across the organization (e.g., Data Working Groups, Data Literacy projects).




PS Collibra is RBC’s master data management platform and includes Issues Management & Resolution (IMR) workflow and reporting capability.




Must-have:




3+ years of relevant experience with data quality principles, data control design, data management and data analysis.
Intermediate to advanced knowledge of data analysis methods and the ability to analyze and resolve complex data related issues.
2+ years of experience conducting root cause analysis, using tools/frameworks such as SQL, Excel, Python, Hive.
Education in a numerical discipline, IT, business or equivalent work experience.
Excellent communication skills, verbal and written.
Proficiency in preparation of reports and presentations.




Nice-to-have:




General understanding of financial reporting, finance and risk business concepts and procedures.
Experience working with financial services and systems including finance and/or credit risk data.
Experience using Collibra or a similar data management or workflow platform.
Ability to manage multiple competing priorities during busy periods.




What’s in it for you?




We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.




A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits and competitive compensation.
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities.
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team.
Opportunities to do challenging work.




Job Summary




What is the opportunity?




In the increasingly complex world of financial services, accurate and complete data is critical for risk management and regulatory compliance. Ensuring data integrity begins with an understanding of financial services data, data quality controls and identifying and resolving data issues. As a Senior Analyst/Manager, Data Quality Issue Management you will be accountable for driving improvements in Risk and Finance data through the identification, root cause analysis, and management of data issues through to resolution for business critical processes and regulatory reports. Reporting to the Associate Director, you will define and monitor data quality controls and resolve data issues for business partners across the organization including Finance, Group Risk Management, Personal & Commercial Banking, Capital Markets, and Wealth Management.




Address:




TORONTO, Ontario, Canada




City:




CAN-NS-BEDFORD, CAN-ON-TORONTO




Country:




Canada




Work hours/week:




37.5




Employment Type:




Full time




Platform:




Strategy and Administration




Job Type:




Regular




Pay Type:




Salaried




Posted Date:




2023-01-26-08:00




Application Deadline:




2023-02-12-08:00




Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment




At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.




We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.




Join our Talent Community




Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.




Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers.

Data Quality Monitoring


  • Monitor data quality control exceptions, conduct detailed investigations, including root cause analysis, and identify and document data issues.
  • Collaborate with business process and report owners, and other users of shared data assets to capture systemic and other self-identified data issues and control gaps.
  • Use standardized and ad hoc reporting to communicate data quality results, trends and insights to business partners and management.


Issues Management & Resolution (IMR)


  • Track and manage data quality and control issues from assignment through to resolution by applying best practices and using the Collibra IMR workflow and Jira project management tools.
  • Collaborate with the Chief Data Office, Data Management Offices, IT and other business functions to facilitate data remediation, adjustments and/or system changes to address the root cause of the data issues.
  • Provide monthly summary and detailed reporting on resolved and outstanding issues, finding and recommendations to business partners and key stakeholders.


Continuous Improvement


  • Propose process changes/improvement to address identified gaps or inconsistencies in data, processes and/or controls.
  • Gain and apply an in-depth understanding of data quality controls, data profiling tools and systems to support the definition and implementation of effective controls and reporting.
  • Work with the Chief Data Office and other Data Management Offices to support standards and best practices to improve data quality, participating in initiatives to raise awareness and drive improved data quality across the organization (e.g., Data Working Groups, Data Literacy projects).


PS Collibra is RBC’s master data management platform and includes Issues Management & Resolution (IMR) workflow and reporting capability.


Must-have:


  • 3+ years of relevant experience with data quality principles, data control design, data management and data analysis.
  • Intermediate to advanced knowledge of data analysis methods and the ability to analyze and resolve complex data related issues.
  • 2+ years of experience conducting root cause analysis, using tools/frameworks such as SQL, Excel, Python, Hive.
  • Education in a numerical discipline, IT, business or equivalent work experience.
  • Excellent communication skills, verbal and written.
  • Proficiency in preparation of reports and presentations.


Nice-to-have:


  • General understanding of financial reporting, finance and risk business concepts and procedures.
  • Experience working with financial services and systems including finance and/or credit risk data.
  • Experience using Collibra or a similar data management or workflow platform.
  • Ability to manage multiple competing priorities during busy periods.


What’s in it for you?


We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.


  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits and competitive compensation.
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities.
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team.
  • Opportunities to do challenging work.


Job Summary


What is the opportunity?


In the increasingly complex world of financial services, accurate and complete data is critical for risk management and regulatory compliance. Ensuring data integrity begins with an understanding of financial services data, data quality controls and identifying and resolving data issues. As a Senior Analyst/Manager, Data Quality Issue Management you will be accountable for driving improvements in Risk and Finance data through the identification, root cause analysis, and management of data issues through to resolution for business critical processes and regulatory reports. Reporting to the Associate Director, you will define and monitor data quality controls and resolve data issues for business partners across the organization including Finance, Group Risk Management, Personal & Commercial Banking, Capital Markets, and Wealth Management.


Address:


TORONTO, Ontario, Canada


City:


CAN-NS-BEDFORD, CAN-ON-TORONTO


Country:


Canada


Work hours/week:


37.5


Employment Type:


Full time


Platform:


Strategy and Administration


Job Type:


Regular


Pay Type:


Salaried


Posted Date:


2023-01-26-08:00


Application Deadline:


2023-02-12-08:00


Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment


At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.


We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.


Join our Talent Community


Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.


Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers.

Title: Master Data Analyst (Hybrid)
Description:
Why join Stryker?




We are proud to be named one the World’s Best Workplaces and a Best Workplace for Diversity by Fortune Magazine! Learn more about our award-winning organization by visiting stryker.com




Our total rewards package offering includes bonuses, healthcare, insurance benefits, retirement programs, wellness programs, as well as service and performance awards – not to mention various social and recreational activities, all of which are location specific.




Who we want:




Detail-oriented process improvers. Critical thinkers who naturally see opportunities to develop and optimize work processes – finding ways to simplify, standardize and automate.
Meticulous documenters. Detail-oriented people who enjoy maintaining meticulous documentation of reports, metrics, proposals, and presentations.
Analytical problem solvers. People who go beyond just fixing to identify root causes, evaluate optimal solutions, and recommend comprehensive upgrades to prevent future issues.




What you will do:




You will be responsible for the management of the quality and integrity of product master data and costing within Stryker Canada’s ERP. You will be responsible for managing portfolios, successful global acquisition integrations, support from other divisions, global process improvements while maintaining and delivering a high service level to the local business. Additionally you will work closely with the Corporate Master Data Governance team, the International Master Data group and must serve as a contributing member of the Finance team while championing Stryker’s Mission and Values.




Responsibilities:




Responsible for the quality and integrity of product master data in Canada’s ERP system.
Manage annual cost update project for Canada; act as a liaison between various departments, coordinate timelines and tasks required by other users, analyze data to ensure correctness in providing accurate costs to update local inventory, impacting and driving numerous business-critical processes.
Responsible for the quality and integrity of product master data owned by Canada in GIM, including creating and maintaining attributes critical for global projects.
Advocate for Canada in the global master data conversation; effectively and creatively escalate issues to Stryker divisions, educate on local ERP capabilities, constraints, and requirements with the purpose of initiating positive change to drive sales.
Represent Canada in annual global cost update project.
Shape global MDM environment; actively contribute to weekly GIM discussions, act on GIMpact Announcements, manage awareness of local stakeholders in data changes.
Manage effective acquisitions; provide guidance to other groups on implementation and requirements, actively participate in testing and process improvement initiatives.




What you need:




Bachelor of Business Administration or Commerce degree preferred
1 to 2 years of data analysis or financial analyst experience required.
Ability to work in office at least 1 day per week.
Knowledge of Oracle 11i ERP, SAP, Hyperion, Cognos, SQL programming an asset.
Must be able to actively participate in global discussions to solve issues on a large-scale that have global impact while taking competing issues into consideration.
Must be able to understand complex processes, abstract structures and follow detailed operating procedures.
Project and time management skills; must be able to prioritize and handle shifting priorities, demands and timelines through analytical and problem-solving capabilities.
Highly proactive with the ability to collaborate with other groups and individuals.
Must be responsible, accountable and quality-driven with a strong attention to detail.




Know someone at Stryker?




Be sure to have them submit you as a referral prior to applying for this position. Learn more about our employee referral program at https://careers.stryker.com/referrals/
Show more Show less

Title: Data Analyst – Coder - Decision Support - Regular Full-time (230136)
Description:
Toronto, ON, CA Posted: 1/18/2023 12:58:17 PM

We currently have a Regular Full-time opportunity for a Data Analyst – Coder in the Decision Support department at Bayview campus.

Hours Of Work

Weekdays: Days; 8hrs; As per schedule

Summary Of Duties

The Data Analyst is responsible for the appropriate analysis, coding and abstracting of Inpatient discharges from the patient records into the Med2020 WinRecs information system. The position also ensures that information is submitted to the Canadian Institute for Health Information (CIHI) in a timely manner, according to guidelines set by CIHI/MOHLTC and the hospital. Specific tasks include:

Assigns ICD-10-CA/CCI codes related to Acute Care Discharges (DAD)
Applies ICD10-CA/CCI coding methodologies resulting in proper grouping outcomes
Abstracting information according to standards from MOHLTC/CIHI (DAD, NACRS), and hospital abstracting guidelines
Ensures that all visits to be coded are done and balance at the end of each month Document productivity in accordance with departmental protocols
Perform regular audits on coded/abstracted data to ensure quality of coded data and adherence to coding standards
Other related duties as assigned

Qualifications/Skills

Graduate from a recognized Health Information Management/Professional program.
Current active CHIMA member in good standing and maintained on an annual basis.
Certification with the Canadian Health Information Management Associate (CHIMA).
2 year previous experience in inpatient DAD coding
An in-depth knowledge and understanding of CMG's, HIG’s, ACW's, Case Mix Index (CMI) and expected length of stay
Demonstrated coding competency in Inpatient and Emergency patient records.
Demonstrated excellent organizational and communication skills.
Ability to work independently and exercise tact and discretion
Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.
Proficient in Windows-based applications environment and keyboard speed of 40 wpm
Demonstrated ability to function in a changing and sometimes stressful work environment
Must be willing to travel between Sunnybrook campuses as required

Qualified candidates are invited to submit their cover letter and resume (in one document) quoting 230136 to:

Human Resources

Sunnybrook Health Sciences Centre

To apply, please click "Apply for Position" at the bottom of this page.

Sunnybrook Health Sciences Centre is committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). If you require accommodation for disability during any stage of the recruitment process, please indicate this in your cover letter.

Sunnybrook Health Sciences Centre is strongly committed to inclusion and diversity within its community and welcomes all applicants including but not limited to: visible minorities, all religions and ethnicities, persons with disabilities, LGBTQ persons, and all others who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas.

Please be advised that in order to be eligible for employment at Sunnybrook, all new hires must have received the full series of a COVID-19 vaccine or combination of COVID-19 vaccines approved by Health Canada (e.g., two doses of a two-dose vaccine series, or one dose of a single-dose vaccine series); AND have received the final dose of the COVID-19 vaccine at least 14 days ago. Medical exemptions or any other kind of requested exemption based upon the Hospital’s obligations pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code will be considered on a case-by-case basis.
