Title: Principal Data Analyst
Description:
Shogun is on a mission to empower brands to create exceptional ecommerce experiences, and in the process, build the best remote company.

Since being in the Winter 2018 batch of Y-Combinator, we've seen tremendous growth while intentionally creating a culture where people from all backgrounds belong. Our company and products are informed by diverse perspectives from the best talent around the world. We are fully remote, have no offices, and are looking for team members who are excited to work remotely.

We closed our Series A and B in 2020, and after raising a $67.5M Series C in 2021, we are scaling faster than ever. Some of our investors include Insight Partners, Initialized Capital, Accel, VMG Partners, and Y Combinator. Join us to grow your career with our rapidly growing company!

Location

For this position, we are looking for candidates located in the United States and Canada.

What You'll Do

As a Principal Data Analyst here at Shogun, you understand startups are chaotic and you kind of like it. You'll navigate and reign in the chaos to take ownership of our data analytics strategy and execution. By partnering directly with business stakeholders, you will work proactively to ensure the right questions are being answered. You use data to tell a story - one that will inform and influence Shogun's strategic and investment decisions.

You will also be Shogun's "data steward", ensuring both the integrity of our data, and access to it. Through your rigorous management of our data stack (SQL, Looker, dbt, Fivetran, Snowflake, Census and Salesforce) business leaders across the organization will have the right information when they need it.

Here you'll work at the intersection of quantitative analysis, data mining and presenting data to ensure our business uses data-informed strategies to grow and improve our product offerings.

What You'll Bring

Deep experience owning and leading the analytics function in an emerging environment
8+ years of data analytics experience with an emphasis on working cross-functionally throughout an organization
A strong ability to translate data into actionable insights—you are able to explain your findings in a comprehensible way, tailoring your message for your audience.
Complete comfort working with SQL, dbt and Looker
Experience working within a Product Led Growth strategy


A Note to Future Shogies

We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting potential Shogies. If you have relevant skills that are not reflected in your resume, we welcome your candidacy and encourage you to share more in an optional cover letter, even if your experience doesn't match our exact requirements. We are committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace where everyone feels like they belong. We encourage you to apply if you feel this role is a good fit for you, and we look forward to hearing from you!

What We Offer (Varies by Location)

Competitive salary
Company-sponsored healthcare, visioncare, dentalcare for you and your dependents
Retirement plans with matching contributions (401k, Pension, and RRSP)
Paid parental leave
Stock options
Yearly company and department off-sites
Home office set-up reimbursement
Monthly home office productivity reimbursement
Co-working space reimbursement
PTO, sick leave, holidays, Shogie appreciation days, COVID-19 related time off
Learning and Development reimbursement
Mental health and wellbeing offerings
Quarterly Wellness reimbursement
Remote work – We are a diverse and distributed team that uses Slack, Zoom, Notion, and other tools to stay connected


Our Values

Work in the open: Operate with high integrity and choose what's right over what's easy. Be transparent as a company and with each other
People are People: Treat yourself, colleagues, and customers with dignity, empathy, and respect. Start from a presumption of positive intent
Win and grow together: Strive to be the best, individually, and as a team. Support and encourage each other. Seek opportunities for growth


Shogun supports workplace diversity and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender identity/expression, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, physical or mental disability, or any other protected class.

Please refer to the position specific location requirements listed under the location section of the job description as we are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the mentioned location(s) without requiring employment visa sponsorship. Click here (or click apply if no hyperlink) if you are a New York or Colorado-based, US candidate.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The ideal candidate will use their passion for big data and analytics to provide insights to the business covering a range of topics. They will be responsible for conducting both recurring and ad hoc analysis for business users. 

 

Responsibilities
Understand the day-to-day issues that our business faces, which can be better understood with data
Compile and analyze data related to business' issues
Develop clear visualizations to convey complicated data in a straightforward fashion




Qualifications

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Statistics or Applied Mathematics or equivalent experience
1 - 2 years' Data Analysis experience
Proficient in SQL

Title: Data Analyst - Data Management & Analytics
Description:
We are actively looking for data analysts across multiple levels, willing to grow, to join our consultants' team and quickly growing global data practice. CAPCO is a 6000 people strong consulting firm fully dedicated to the financial services industry. We lead key data transformation projects and help our customers unlock the value of their data. We pride ourselves in delivering success for our clients and in growing our people.




As a Data Analyst, you will:




Leverage your existing analytical skills and expertise to help clients meet their challenges
Take part in strategic data transformation projects and value creation through use of data
Enable data-driven decisions through advanced analytics, visualisation, quality data and dedicated datasets
Engage data using analytical tools and languages to perform data manipulation and analysis
Be involved with managing, cleansing, abstracting and aggregating data
Support the importance of data processes, data integrity and cleanliness, and the strategic use of data
Work with or act as project manager to scope and analyse the area of analysis




What we offer you:




The opportunity to join a growing, thought leading, global team of data professionals
An attractive remuneration package, reflecting your experience, including a company car or a green mobility budget, net allowances, end-of-year bonuses, health insurance, a mobile phone and subscription, laptop and meal vouchers
Organised individual learning tracks with access to leading online skills development platforms, to onsite and online teachers and to our global experts. Our learning materials cover all areas of data (Governance, Management, Manipulation, Decision science, Engineering)
A hybrid (on-site/remote) work environment
A shared objective to achieve a good work-life balance
A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work with senior partners and directly with clients
A diverse, inclusive, meritocratic culture




What we look for:




Professional experience of 2-8 years in a data related position, with a preference for roles within the financial industry or a consultancy firm
Bachelor or Master degree in a relevant field
Excellent analytical, reporting and presentation skills
Good knowledge of SQL, Python and preferably one visualisation tool (Tableau, PowerBI...)
Being able to work and liaise with various stakeholders, ranging from business to technical stakeholders
You are a creative problem solver with a hands-on approach
Fluency in French or Dutch and excellent knowledge of English




About Capco:




We are a management and global technology consultancy firm focused on financial services, with all major Belgium financial institutions as clients. Our professionals combine innovative thinking with unrivaled industry knowledge to offer clients consulting expertise and data transformation to move their organizations forward.




Joining Capco means joining an organisation that is committed to an inclusive working environment where you’re encouraged to #BeYourselfAtWork. We celebrate individuality and recognize that diversity and inclusion, in all forms, is critical to success. It’s important to us that we recruit and develop as diverse a range of talent as we can and we believe that everyone brings something different to the table – so we’d love to know what makes you different.




To learn more about Capco, visit us at https://www.capco.com/careers

We are a management and global technology consultancy firm focused on financial services, with all major Belgium financial institutions as clients. Our professionals combine innovative thinking with unrivaled industry knowledge to offer clients consulting expertise and data transformation to move their organizations forward.


Joining Capco means joining an organisation that is committed to an inclusive working environment where you’re encouraged to #BeYourselfAtWork. We celebrate individuality and recognize that diversity and inclusion, in all forms, is critical to success. It’s important to us that we recruit and develop as diverse a range of talent as we can and we believe that everyone brings something different to the table – so we’d love to know what makes you different.


To learn more about Capco, visit us at https://www.capco.com/careers

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Vous êtes passionné.e par la data ? Le comportement des consommateurs vous intrigue ?

Les données vous parlent et vous savez les faire parler afin d’améliorer la prise de décision ?

Alors postulez chez SIRIUS Insight et mettez vos compétences au profit d’entreprises issus du retail, de l’automobile, des banques et assurances, des pharmacies, des mutuelles, … Vos analyses et recommandations feront la différence pour leur développement.

 

L’entreprise et vos futurs collègues

SIRIUS Insight est une PME belge localisée à Louvain-la-Neuve et spécialisée dans la stratégie géomarketing. Nos clients font appel à nous pour croiser leurs données avec Dividuals®, pour bénéficier de nos conseils dans la définition du réseau de points de vente optimal, pour estimer les ventes futures, pour déterminer le risque de churn, pour vérifier l’impact de différents scénarios, ... L’équipe dont vous ferez partie est composée d’experts en géomarketing. Le respect, la prise d’initiative, l’entraide et la confiance sont les éléments clés qui conditionnent notre fonctionnement.

 

11 millions d’habitants et plus de 200.000 points de vente et de service : ce que vous ferez de ces données

Ces deux chiffres éveillent votre curiosité et votre besoin d’analyser ? Chez SIRIUS Insight ce sera votre mission : investiguer tout type de données, les croiser avec des données telles que Dividuals® et apporter du conseil. Qui est le client de l’entreprise ? Qui faut-il cibler ? Comment se comportent les clients/prospects ? Sur lesquels faut-il concentrer les efforts ? Où se situe le groupe cible ? Où faut-il investir dans de nouveaux points de vente ? C’est vous qui activerez les bons outils et données pour apporter des réponses à ces différentes questions.

 

Vos missions chez SIRIUS Insight seront particulièrement variées et vous pourrez compter sur une équipe d’experts pour vous soutenir.

Vous participez activement aux briefings des clients afin d’entendre leurs défis.
Vous aidez à déterminer la solution appropriée en regard du défi posé.
Vous êtes responsable de la réalisation des analyses suggérées et avez le support des collègues analystes.
Vous visualisez les informations de manière à ce qu’elles soient intelligibles et attractives. Vous créez cartes, graphes, rapports, présentations ou l’ensemble dans des tableaux de bords interactifs (PowerBI, Tableau, …)
Vous présentez vous-même aux clients vos observations et recommandations.
Vous détectez des opportunités intéressantes pour le développement du client.

 

Des aptitudes d’analyse et l’envie de s’améliorer en permanence : le profil que nous recherchons

Nous recherchons un/une collègue qui se projette facilement dans l’univers du client. Il/elle plonge dans diverses données et est en mesure de recommander au client les actions à mettre en place. Vous ne disposez pas de l’ensemble des compétences, mais vous n’avez pas peur d’approfondir vos connaissances ? Alors n’hésitez pas à postuler également.

 

Expérience et compétences métier

Vous avez un master orienté business (économie, gestion), un master scientifique ou une formation ou expérience équivalente.
Vous « parlez » ou avez des notions Python, R et SQL.
Vous maitrisez le français ou le néerlandais, et vous êtes capables de travailler dans l’autre langue et en anglais.
Vous disposez des bases techniques ou statistiques pour mener l’analyse de données.
Si vous avez un intérêt pour la modélisation et les nouvelles techniques d’intelligence artificielle, vous pourrez les mettre au profit des clients et développer davantage ces compétences.

 

Compétences personnelles

Vous avez d’excellentes compétences interpersonnelles.
Vous comprenez les besoins et les enjeux de vos interlocuteurs.
Vous êtes en mesure de vulgariser les méthodes et de recommander des actions.
Vous-êtes autonome tout en ayant un esprit d’équipe.
Vous êtes en mesure de planifier votre travail.
Vous remettez en question des pratiques et avez la capacité d’apprendre facilement de nouveaux outils, méthodes, langages, ...

 

Notre offre : un job varié, une équipe soudée et un fonctionnement « phygital »

Nous vous offrons un job impactant et varié que vous exercez en compagnie d’autres experts. Chez SIRIUS Insight, vous intégrez une équipe bienveillante à taille humaine. Vous aurez la possibilité de vous développer, de vous former, de prendre des initiatives et de manipuler des données uniques telles que notre segmentation des consommateurs Dividuals®. Nous vous offrons un cadre de travail flexible ou vous pourrez combiner le télétravail et le travail en nos bureaux situés à Louvain-la-Neuve. Vous bénéficiez d’un package salarial en adéquation avec vos compétences, complété d’avantages extra-légaux dont une voiture de société.

 

Faisons connaissance !

Vous lisez toujours cette offre d’emploi et êtes de plus en plus enthousiaste à l’idée de rejoindre notre équipe ? Envoyez-nous votre candidature et faisons connaissance.

Lors de l’entretien vous aurez la possibilité de poser toutes vos questions, présenter vos aspirations, découvrir l’entreprise et même de rencontrer vos futurs collègues.

Envoyez votre candidature par e-mail à Karolien Sottiaux - hr@siriusinsight.be

Title: DATA ANALYST
Description:
For one of our client in the finance sector we are looking for a Medior to Senior Data Analyst/Business Analyst with SAS, SQL and Python experience.







The responsabilities :



Translating the business needs into an analytical request:



Hereby you will be discussing and challenging the needs and requirements with your stakeholders.
While thinking along you already think a step further in terms of a feasibility analysis, setting realistic timelines, and cross-checking the data needs and availabilities.
Based on this, you define a suitable approach and solution that fits the needs. These you communicate in a clear and transparent way to your stakeholders.

Go over to the execution phase, this by applying some advanced analytical skills, capabilities and techniques, some examples are:



Getting to know all the data available, the different tools to query, visualize and analyze this data
Create some advanced ad-hoc reporting for specific needs using dashboarding tools like Cognos
Executing an in-depth analysis on our customer data base to come up with answers to some specific questions or needs from the business





You will have :



- A good package !



- 50% of remote

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a Data Analyst to work for us remotely

Job Requirements
3-5 years of professional experience in each of the following 3 areas in the context of Artificial Intelligence (or Machine Learning or Data Science or Data Analytics) projects:
Data Analysis
Business Requirements Gathering
Project Management.
3-5 years of professional experience in each of the following 2 areas:
Data Science and Artificial Intelligence (R-RStudio, Python-Anaconda or Knime);
Dashboarding and Data Analytics (Power BI or SAP Analytics Cloud)
Minimum 3-5 years of professional cumulative experience in the following 4 areas (with a minimum of 1 year professional experience per area):
Database development, Data Modelling and SQL (Oracle RDMBS or SQL Server);
ETL tools (BODI or BODS would be an asset);
Business Objects
Data Warehouse

Due to the particular nature of the client, candidates should also have the following non-technical skills:

Capability of integration in an international/multicultural environment, rapid self-starting capability and experience in working in team;
Ability to participate in multilingual meetings;
Ability to work in multi-cultural environment, on multiple large projects;
Excellent Team Player
High degree of discretion and integrity is required


WHO ARE WE?

CRI Group belongs to VASS GROUP as of November 2021 (https://vasscompany.com/en/).

VASS is a leading digital solutions group of companies headquartered in Madrid, Spain, present in 25 countries in Europe, the Americas and Asia with more than 4,300 professionals.

VASS helps large companies in their digital transformation process, developing and executing the most innovative and scalable projects, from strategy to operations.

All our growth comes from our talented people, passion for innovation, and a constant search for improvement, always the VASS way: "Complex made simple".

Title: Data Analyst – Diminuer l’empreinte carbone
Description:
Data Analyst – Diminuer l’empreinte carbone




Notre partenaire, une société internationale Belge, recherche un(e) Data Analyst / BI Analyst dans le but de renforcer leur département Data & Analytics.




Data Analyst – L’entreprise :




Notre partenaire est l’une des entreprises les plus innovantes de Belgique. Elle propose des solutions sur mesure à ses clients dans les domaines de la Mobilité, transport et environnement.




Sa technologie unique au monde lui a rapidement permis d’être leader sur le territoire européen avec notamment des bureaux en France, Allemagne, Italie, Espagne et Pays Bas.




Cette entreprise belge reconnue vous permettra d’évoluer dans des équipes jeunes et dynamiques ou il fait bon vivre.




Data Analyst – Le rôle :




Premièrement, la structure aime avant tout les gens curieux, collaboratifs, désireux d'avoir un impact et qui valorisent l'innovation, l'autonomie et l'esprit d'équipe.




Deuxièmement, dans ce poste spécifique, il sera important pour vous d'avoir de l'expérience sur les points suivants : Data Visualisation – Recherche dans différentes Databases – Analyse Business




L’objectif principal sera d’accélérer et d’améliorer la prise de décision des acteurs du monde de la mobilité via vos reporting et analyse.




Data Analyst – Le profil :




Cous disposez d’un Bachelor or Master Degree en Business / Computer Science / Engineering
Vous avez 2 ans d’expérience en tant que Data Analyst – BI Engineer
Vous maitrisez un outil de Data Viz (Qlik – Power BI – Tableau) & SQL




Data Analyst – L’offre:




Salaire annuel allant jusque 70.000 € (en fonction de votre expérience)
Assurance groupe & Hospitalisation
Frais de représentation / net – 100 €
Véhicule de fonction + carte essence ou Budget Mobilité
Bénéficiez d’horaires flexibles (2/3 jours de télétravail/semaine)
Participez à des Teams Building de folie
Avoir des perspectives d’évolutions et prendre le Lead sur une équipe Data & Analytics
Rejoignez une structure en pleine expansion et remplie d’ambition




If you are interested, even if you don’t match 100% of the required skills - please apply - your application is welcome !




Data Analytics – Data Reports – Business Analyst – Business Intelligence Analyst – Business Intelligence – BI – BI Engineer – Data Analyst – Qlik – Power BI – Qlikview – Qliksense – Tableau – Data Viz – Vizualisation – MSBI – SSRS – SSIS – Functional Analysis

Title: Data Engineer/Data Analyst
Description:
Data Engineer / Data Analyst




For one of our customers, a multinational active in global materials technology and recycling, we are looking for a Data Engineer / Data Analyst for one of their business units.




Challenges

You will be responsible for the design, implementation and improvements of data models with the ultimate goal of enabling the end users to do self-service analytics in Power BI.

You have the right technical skills to assess the data needs of the business unit and give your expert advice on data extraction, transformation and loading.
You help identify data dependencies, perform data modeling, data mapping and validate reports/dashboard results.
You work closely with the internal teams to create the necessary dashboards in Power BI.
You keep an eye on data governance rules.

Required skills

Master’s degree in Engineering, IT, Computer Sciences, Applied Economics or any related area
Knowledge of dimensional data models, data management and cloud computing
Experience with Power BI is required, experience with TimeXtender is an asset
Fluent in English and Dutch

Practical

Full-time, based in Brussels and with potential travel to another site
As of January / February 2023

Show more Show less
HTML:
Data Engineer / Data Analyst


For one of our customers, a multinational active in global materials technology and recycling, we are looking for a Data Engineer / Data Analyst for one of their business units.


Challenges

You will be responsible for the design, implementation and improvements of data models with the ultimate goal of enabling the end users to do self-service analytics in Power BI.

  • You have the right technical skills to assess the data needs of the business unit and give your expert advice on data extraction, transformation and loading.
  • You help identify data dependencies, perform data modeling, data mapping and validate reports/dashboard results.
  • You work closely with the internal teams to create the necessary dashboards in Power BI.
  • You keep an eye on data governance rules.

Required skills

  • Master’s degree in Engineering, IT, Computer Sciences, Applied Economics or any related area
  • Knowledge of dimensional data models, data management and cloud computing
  • Experience with Power BI is required, experience with TimeXtender is an asset
  • Fluent in English and Dutch

Practical

  • Full-time, based in Brussels and with potential travel to another site
  • As of January / February 2023

Title: Data Analyst (Remote in EU)
Description:
⚡ Who we are

Lodgify is a fast-growing startup focused on building vacation rental software that enables property owners and managers to independently manage and market their business online. We are an international team of more than 190 people and 43 different nationalities in the heart of Barcelona, and we've been featured twice in Wired's 100 Hottest European startups list.




⭐ About the role

We are looking for a talented Data Analyst to join our Data Team.

The Team's goal is to support the Business and enable the organisation to make informed decisions using a data-driven approach.




⭐ What will you do:

Get a deep knowledge of the business and look for opportunities to leverage data across the organisation.
Design and maintain insightful dashboards.
Create data models in line with business requirements.




⭐ What you must have:

4 years + experience as a data analyst, business intelligence engineer or analytics engineer.
Business acumen: ability to be proactive and challenge assumptions.
Hands-On experience on Tableau.
Good knowledge of SQL and Python.
Hands-On experience on a cloud data warehouse (Bigquery, Redshift or Snowflake).




Benefits

- Travel and Expenses budget to visit Barcelona.

- Referral program with paid compensation.

- Great culture & working environment with an international team of 50 different nationalities.

- Mental well-being.

- Regular team-building events and activities.

- Training and mentorship program.

- Yearly performance reviews.







⭐ Why you’ll love us:

You’ll be part of a growing, dynamic company with a truly international team. At Lodgify, we are full of contagious energy, hard work, and passion for what we do. Lodgify is committed to creating a workplace where everyone is heard and feels a sense of belonging.




We are proud to have an international team that acknowledges a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. At Lodgify, we celebrate diversity and difference, and we are strongly committed to building an inclusive environment for all our employees.




All applications must be submitted in English. Applications in any other language will not be considered.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Functieomschrijving




Profiel:




Je hebt minimaal 3 jaar ervaring als Data Analist of Data Visualisatie Consultant

• Data-analyse, visualisatie en storytelling is waar je passie ligt.

• SQL en datamodellering hebben geen geheimen voor jou.

• Je hebt een goede kennis van Power BI. Kennis van andere BI-tools is een pluspunt (Tableau, Qlik…). Kennis van visualisatieontwerpprincipes is een pluspunt.

• Je bent nauwkeurig, analytisch sterk en denkt altijd in oplossingen.

• Je bent een vlotte communicator zowel intern als extern op IT- en businessniveau.




Wat heeft het bedrijf te bieden?




Deel uitmaken van een scale-up : je werkt binnen de volwassen context van een grote bedrijf, het grootste IT-netwerk van België.

• Een inspirerende omgeving: elke dag ondersteunen we je om nieuwe dingen te leren en je grenzen te verleggen.

• Leuke collega's: je komt te werken in een team dat altijd bereid is om hun kennis te delen en plezier te maken tijdens teamevents, lunches en onze jaarlijkse skireis.

• Een platte structuur: je werkt in een werkomgeving met een platte structuur en een open cultuur waarin iedereen benaderbaar is en elke stem telt.

• Een aantrekkelijk salaris: aangevuld met extralegale voordelen zoals een firmawagen, laptop, gsm, maaltijdvergoeding en verzekering.

Functieomschrijving


Profiel:


Je hebt minimaal 3 jaar ervaring als Data Analist of Data Visualisatie Consultant

• Data-analyse, visualisatie en storytelling is waar je passie ligt.

• SQL en datamodellering hebben geen geheimen voor jou.

• Je hebt een goede kennis van Power BI. Kennis van andere BI-tools is een pluspunt (Tableau, Qlik…). Kennis van visualisatieontwerpprincipes is een pluspunt.

• Je bent nauwkeurig, analytisch sterk en denkt altijd in oplossingen.

• Je bent een vlotte communicator zowel intern als extern op IT- en businessniveau.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a Data Analyst to work for us remotely

Job Requirements

3-5 years of professional experience in each of the following 3 areas in the context of Artificial Intelligence (or Machine Learning or Data Science or Data Analytics) projects:
Data Analysis
Business Requirements Gathering
Project Management.
3-5 years of professional experience in each of the following 2 areas:
Data Science and Artificial Intelligence (R-RStudio, Python-Anaconda or Knime);
Dashboarding and Data Analytics (Power BI or SAP Analytics Cloud)
Minimum 3-5 years of professional cumulative experience in the following 4 areas (with a minimum of 1 year professional experience per area):
Database development, Data Modelling and SQL (Oracle RDMBS or SQL Server);
ETL tools (BODI or BODS would be an asset);
Business Objects
Data Warehouse

Due to the particular nature of the client, candidates should also have the following non-technical skills:

Capability of integration in an international/multicultural environment, rapid self-starting capability and experience in working in team;
Ability to participate in multilingual meetings;
Ability to work in multi-cultural environment, on multiple large projects;
Excellent Team Player
High degree of discretion and integrity is required

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Robert Half is currently looking for a data analyst.

As Data Analyst in the Life Transformation Program, you interpret data and turn it into information which can offer ways to improve the business, thus affecting business decisions. You will gather information from various sources and interpret patterns and trends - as such your job does highlight the analytical nature of your role. Once data has been gathered and interpreted, you will report back what has been found in a comprehensive study to the wider business, IT and architecture colleagues.

Your Job Will Include, But Is Not Limited To

You will often make recommendations about the methods and ways in which our company obtains and analyses data to improve quality and the efficiency of data systems.

Collecting and interpreting data, as well in mainframe as in linux systems
Analyzing results of possible transformation
Reporting the results back to the relevant members of the business, IT and architecture and explain it from different perspectives
Identifying patterns and trends in data sets
Working alongside teams within the business or the architecture team to establish business needs
Defining new data collection and analysis processes

Must have

Level Master informatica or equal by experience;
Knowledge and experience as data analyst or functional analyst;
Knowledge and experience in insurance, domain Life;
Knowledge of the MS Office suite (Outlook, Word, Excel, …);
Experience in data models and reporting packages;
Ability to analyse large datasets
Ability to write comprehensive reports
Strong verbal and written communication skills
An analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving
Stress resistant, flexible and multitasking and able to adapt in a continue changing environment
Organizational skills
Team player & able to work independent

Nice to have

Experience with Scrum
Knowledge of PRINCE2
Experience with Enterprise Architect
Experience with Jira

Interested?

Please contact us.

Robert Half BV processes the data from applicants that is required to carry out the application process. You can find more information on data protection, in particular on your rights, at

Title: CRM & Data Analyst (H/F/X)
Description:
De Data afdeling bij AlphaCredit bestaat uit vier diensten (Data Analytics & CRM, Business Intelligence & Reporting, Data Project, Data Management Office). Het Analytics & CRM-team bestaat uit een vijftal medewerkers die door middel van innovatieve data-management operaties en statistische analyses bijdragen aan de rendabiliteit van onze verschillende business portefeuilles, de profitabiliteit van onze marketing acties en de optimalisatie van onze operationele processen. Voor dit departement zijn we op zoek naar een CRM & DATA ANALYST (M/V/X).




JOUW JOB

Als CRM & Marketing Analist help je bij het beheren van onze commerciële campagnes (klantenselectie en profitabiliteitsanalyses) en bij het ontwikkelen van statistische modellen die bijdragen aan de rendabiliteit van onze verschillende business portefeuilles.

Zo ontwikkel je statistische modellen die de responsgraad op onze Direct Marketing-campagnes verbeteren, tot betere profilering leiden van bestaande en nieuwe klanten, onze acquisitie campagnes verbeteren en die leiden tot optimalisatie van onze marketing-mix (pricing, channels). Je slaagt erin om data om te toveren tot relevante en heldere business inzichten enstrategische adviezen.

Samengevat :

Zorg jij ervoor dat onze marketingcampagnes goed beheerd worden d.m.v. op punt gestelde selectieprocedures en de juiste inzichten wat betreft rendabiliteit (significantietests tussen target en controle groepen; ROI-berekening);
Adviseer je het marketing departement betreffende Customer Relationship Management d.m.v. de ontwikkeling van predictieve modellen (response, appetite, uplift scoring) en segmentaties (random forest, clustering), customer lifetime value enz.;
Gebruik en ontwikkel je datamining technieken en algoritmes om patronen en relaties in grote volumes van data komende van diverse bronnen (marketing data, online data, transactionele data, corporate data) te ontdekken;
Begeleid je het marketing departement bij het optimaliseren en personaliseren van aanbiedingen voor klanten. Een ‘customer oriented’ en ‘event and trigger based’ model staat hier centraal.
Ontwikkel je KPI dashboards die de business toelaten de beste strategische beslissingen te nemen.

JOUW PROFIEL

Je beschikt over een universitaire master met een kwantitieve focus (data science, statistiek, handelsingenieur, wiskunde, econometrie, psychologie);
Je hebt een aantal jaren (idealiter 3 tot 5) ervaring in een data-analytische functie (data analyst, business intelligence analyst,…)
Je hebt professionele ervaring in het programmeren met SPSS (rechtstreeks programmeren in syntax editor)
Je hebt professionele ervaring in het programmeren met Python of wil dit graag leren
Je hebt naast interesse in data ook een interesse in campagnemanagement en in hoe analytische inzichten gebruikt kunnen worden in de businesspraktijk;
Je beschikt over een analytische ervaring voor de ontwikkeling van tests, segmentaties, waarschijnlijkheidsmodellen en/of predictieve modellen (kennis van regressieanalyses, clusteranalyse, factoranalyse,…);
Je hebt een zeer goede kennis van Microsoft Office, voornamelijk Excel of Access;
Je kunt zelfstandig, maar ook in team werken en je bent stressbestendig; je kan om met onvoorziene en soms strakke deadlines
Je bent sociaal en kan je makkelijk integreren in een team
Je kan je analyses op een eenvoudige manier uitleggen aan de business lines (medewerkers en managers van niet-data teams, directeurs,…);
Je beschikt over voldoende communicatievaardigheden om presentaties te houden of wil hierin bijleren;
Je werkt nauwkeurig en je bent geïnteresseerd in de strategische overwegingen van de onderneming.
Je spreekt goed Engels en bij voorkeur één van de beide landstalen (NL / FR).

ONS AANBOD

Een leerrijke functie in een flexibele werkomgeving
Een open werksfeer en toffe collega’ s die samen met jou streven naar een hoge klantentevredenheid
Talrijke opleidingsmogelijkheden om je kennis en competenties te blijven ontwikkelen
Een contract van onbepaalde duur in een groeiend bedrijf binnen een sterke BNP Paribas groep
Een competitief salaris, aangevuld met een uitgebreid pakket extralegale voordelen (verzekeringen, maaltijdcheques, extralegale verlofdagen, etc.)
Een Flex Income Plan waarbij je jaarlijks je eindejaarspremie (met een vast collectief keuzemoment) kunt omzetten in extra voordelen waaronder een fietsleasing, extra verlofdagen, een wagen,…
Focus op work-life balance.

  • Een open werksfeer en toffe collega’ s die samen met jou streven naar een hoge klantentevredenheid
  • Talrijke opleidingsmogelijkheden om je kennis en competenties te blijven ontwikkelen
  • Een contract van onbepaalde duur in een groeiend bedrijf binnen een sterke BNP Paribas groep
  • Een competitief salaris, aangevuld met een uitgebreid pakket extralegale voordelen (verzekeringen, maaltijdcheques, extralegale verlofdagen, etc.)
  • Een Flex Income Plan waarbij je jaarlijks je eindejaarspremie (met een vast collectief keuzemoment) kunt omzetten in extra voordelen waaronder een fietsleasing, extra verlofdagen, een wagen,…

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Ben jij een data-analytisch genie met een passie voor het ontdekken van verborgen patronen en trends in grote hoeveelheden data? Dan is dit bedrijf op zoek naar jou! Als Data analist bij ons zal je verantwoordelijk zijn voor het analyseren en interpreteren van de data om ons te helpen bij het nemen van data-gedreven beslissingen.

Dit bedrijf is een toonaangevend mediabedrijf met een portfolio van gedrukte en digitale media, evenementen en diensten. Onze bedrijf heeft een rijke geschiedenis en een stevige reputatie in de media-industrie. Ze geloven in de kracht van data-analyse om onze business te versterken en zijn op zoek naar een enthousiaste Data analist om huns team te versterken.

Takenbeschrijving:

Het analyseren en interpreteren van grote hoeveelheden data
Het ontwikkelen van rapporten en dashboards
Het geven van advies aan het management over data-gedreven beslissingen
Het implementeren van data-analyse methoden en tools

profiel:

Een afgeronde opleiding in een relevante richting, zoals informatica, wiskunde of statistiek
Ervaring met data analyse en het werken met grote datasets
Sterke vaardigheden in Excel en SQL
Ervaring met data visualisatie tools zoals Tableau of Power BI
Proactieve en nauwkeurige werkhouding
Goede communicatievaardigheden

Aanbod:

Wij bieden een competitief salaris dat kan oplopen tot 70K, afhankelijk van ervaring en kwalificaties.
een uitdagende en afwisselende baan in een dynamische werkomgeving.
Daarnaast bieden ze een aantrekkelijk pakket aan extra voordelen, zoals flexibele werktijden, een goede work-life balance, en de mogelijkheid om deel te nemen aan opleidings- en ontwikkelingsprogramma's.

Waarom voor dit bedrijf kiezen?

Werk bij een toonaangevend en innovatief mediabedrijf
Maak deel uit van een team van gepassioneerde en enthousiaste professionals
Werk aan data-analyse projecten die direct impact hebben op de groei van het bedrijf
Mogelijkheid om invloed uit te oefenen op belangrijke beslissingen van het bedrijf
Mogelijkheid om jouw vaardigheden te ontwikkelen.

This international Financial Services brand work to produce tailored solutions for customers in a fast moving market. Now they are looking for a talented Data engineer to join their well-established data analytics teams. They value employee input and do a lot for a great working culture!

TSQL and SQL Server

Title: Clinical Insights Analyst
Description:
Clinical Insights Analyst




For my leading Biopharmaceutical client in Beerse (BE) I am looking for a Clinical Insights Analyst with experience as a Business/Data analyst. You will contribute to the development of visualization and support the clinical trial activities.




RESPONSIBILITES

Participate in the optimization of user management, content management, performance management and lifecycle management related to reporting and metrics
Support clinical activities such as medical safety review, analytical risk-based monitoring, data review and cleaning.
Work with business owners to develop and deliver reports and metrics such as, but not limited to Medical monitoring visualizations and ad hoc reporting as assigned.
Participate in executing strategy around reporting and metrics aligned with ICOA & EBIS strategy and business needs, optimizing the related systems infrastructure and by working with other EBIS teams, as well as GD IT, and external vendors.
Takes a leadership role with development and delivery of reports, templates and metrics and related activities

PROFILE

Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Science or Computer Science
Minimum 4+ years of experience as a Business/Data Analyst or working within Data Warehouse platforms and BI tools within a clinical trial environment
Direct working experience with matrixed teams
Knowledge of Tibco Spotfire, Python, R, SAS, SDTM data structure and SQL
Experience in pharma & life sciences industry is preferred




PRACTICALITIES

Duration: till 31-12-2023 (high chance of extension)
Start: ASAP (flexible)
Hours p/w: Fulltime
Hybrid: 2/3 days on site
Location: Beerse




INTERESTED?

Get in touch ASAP by sending your CV to s.krakers@panda-int.com or call me on +31202044502!

You can also refer a friend and both earn a bonus on placement.

Voor dit departement zijn we op zoek naar een CRM & DATA ANALYST (M/V/X).

Jouw Job

Als CRM & Marketing Analist help je bij het beheren van onze commerciële campagnes (klantenselectie en profitabiliteitsanalyses) en bij het ontwikkelen van statistische modellen die bijdragen aan de rendabiliteit van onze verschillende business portefeuilles.

Zo ontwikkel je statistische modellen die de responsgraad op onze Direct Marketing-campagnes verbeteren, tot betere profilering leiden van bestaande en nieuwe klanten, onze acquisitie campagnes verbeteren en die leiden tot optimalisatie van onze marketing-mix (pricing, channels). Je slaagt erin om data om te toveren tot relevante en heldere business inzichten enstrategische adviezen.

Samengevat :

Zorg jij ervoor dat onze marketingcampagnes goed beheerd worden d.m.v. op punt gestelde selectieprocedures en de juiste inzichten wat betreft rendabiliteit (significantietests tussen target en controle groepen; ROI-berekening);
Adviseer je het marketing departement betreffende Customer Relationship Management d.m.v. de ontwikkeling van predictieve modellen (response, appetite, uplift scoring) en segmentaties (random forest, clustering), customer lifetime value enz.;
Gebruik en ontwikkel je datamining technieken en algoritmes om patronen en relaties in grote volumes van data komende van diverse bronnen (marketing data, online data, transactionele data, corporate data) te ontdekken;
Begeleid je het marketing departement bij het optimaliseren en personaliseren van aanbiedingen voor klanten. Een ‘customer oriented’ en ‘event and trigger based’ model staat hier centraal.
Ontwikkel je KPI dashboards die de business toelaten de beste strategische beslissingen te nemen.


Jouw Profiel

Je beschikt over een universitaire master met een kwantitieve focus (data science, statistiek, handelsingenieur, wiskunde, econometrie, psychologie);
Je hebt een aantal jaren (idealiter 3 tot 5) ervaring in een data-analytische functie (data analyst, business intelligence analyst,…)
Je hebt professionele ervaring in het programmeren met SPSS (rechtstreeks programmeren in syntax editor)
Je hebt professionele ervaring in het programmeren met Python of wil dit graag leren
Je hebt naast interesse in data ook een interesse in campagnemanagement en in hoe analytische inzichten gebruikt kunnen worden in de businesspraktijk;
Je beschikt over een analytische ervaring voor de ontwikkeling van tests, segmentaties, waarschijnlijkheidsmodellen en/of predictieve modellen (kennis van regressieanalyses, clusteranalyse, factoranalyse,…);
Je hebt een zeer goede kennis van Microsoft Office, voornamelijk Excel of Access;
Je kunt zelfstandig, maar ook in team werken en je bent stressbestendig; je kan om met onvoorziene en soms strakke deadlines
Je bent sociaal en kan je makkelijk integreren in een team
Je kan je analyses op een eenvoudige manier uitleggen aan de business lines (medewerkers en managers van niet-data teams, directeurs,…);
Je beschikt over voldoende communicatievaardigheden om presentaties te houden of wil hierin bijleren;
Je werkt nauwkeurig en je bent geïnteresseerd in de strategische overwegingen van de onderneming.
Je spreekt goed Engels en bij voorkeur één van de beide landstalen (NL / FR).


Ons aanbod

Een leerrijke functie in een flexibele werkomgeving
Een open werksfeer en toffe collega’ s die samen met jou streven naar een hoge klantentevredenheid
Talrijke opleidingsmogelijkheden om je kennis en competenties te blijven ontwikkelen
Een contract van onbepaalde duur in een groeiend bedrijf binnen een sterke BNP Paribas groep
Een competitief salaris, aangevuld met een uitgebreid pakket extralegale voordelen (verzekeringen, maaltijdcheques, extralegale verlofdagen, etc.)
Een Flex Income Plan waarbij je jaarlijks je eindejaarspremie (met een vast collectief keuzemoment) kunt omzetten in extra voordelen waaronder een fietsleasing, extra verlofdagen, een wagen,…
Focus op work-life balance.


AlphaCredit is marktleider voor consumentenkredieten in België en Luxemburg en behoort tot de groep BNP Paribas. Vanuit ons kantoor,op wandelafstand van het station Brussel Centraal, bieden we alle mogelijke kredietoplossingen aan via onze professionele partners of rechtstreeks aan klanten.

AlphaCredit blijft uitbreiden! Daarom zijn we op zoek naar dynamische collega’s!

Vergeet zeker niet de vermelden waar je onze vacature hebt gezien.

Primary Location

BE-BRU-Brussels

Job Type

Standard / Permanent

Job

DATA

Education Level

Master Degree or equivalent (> 4 years)

Experience Level

At least 3 years

Schedule

Full-time

Competency Profile

Digital Project/Process

Entity

Alpha Credit Group

Title: BI Analyst
Description:
Hays is looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to join our client’s BI team.




Your responsibilities as a Business Intelligence Analyst

Play a vital role in driving data-driven decision making as a BI Analyst reporting to the BI Head. You will have the opportunity to work on a variety of exciting projects including:

• Integrating and preparing data for our DWH and CDCI's DataMart's

• Developing, maintaining, and improving daily/weekly and monthly reports

• Managing ad-hoc analyses to uncover key insights and trends

• Continuously improving our MIS solutions to drive efficiency and effectiveness

• Utilizing standard BI tools such as SAS, SQL, Microsoft Office, Python, R to develop operational solutions and processes.




What we are looking for

You have a Master's degree in a data-oriented field such as business, statistics, or informatics, and at least 2 years of professional experience. While experience in a similar position and in the banking sector is a plus, curiosity and intellectual flexibility is the most important.

In this role, you will utilize your expertise in standard BI tools such as SAS and knowledge of Python and R to lead data management and BI efforts.

You must have a strong communication skills, fluency in Dutch or French and English is a must.




What you will get in return

Are you looking for an exciting opportunity to take your career to the next level and make a real impact on the efficiency of a leading bank's BI activity? Look no further! This unique position within the bank offers the chance to develop your skills and expertise from multiple angles. As part of an international group, your future team is regularly involved in global development projects at the data level, providing ample opportunity for national and international interactions without the need for extensive travel.




Join a young, dynamic, and innovative team in a working environment that values customer focus, integrity, and partnership. Enjoy a competitive salary package with added benefits such as meal and eco vouchers, pension scheme, hospitalization and life insurance, and a flexible homeworking policy. You'll be encouraged to share your opinions, suggestions, and concerns in a speak-up culture with a flat organizational structure and open communication with both management and other departments.




Take advantage of an extensive range of training opportunities through their learning platform, to develop your technical, soft and leadership skills. Don't miss this chance to be a part of a corporate culture that values its employees and their growth.




Your new company

Our client is one of the largest and most stable banks in Europe. The company has three main activities - Corporate Bank, Investment Bank, and Private Bank – and offers endless opportunities for growth and advancement. In Belgium, they are a major player in the Wealth Management and Private Banking market.

Title: Data Integration Analyst
Description:
ICON plc is a world-leading healthcare intelligence and clinical research organisation. From molecule to medicine, we advance clinical research providing outsourced services to pharmaceutical, biotechnology, medical device and government and public health organisations. With our patients at the centre of all that we do, we help to accelerate the development of drugs and devices that save lives and improve quality of life. Our people are our greatest strength, are at the core of our culture, and the driving force behind our success. ICON people have a mission to succeed and a passion that ensures what we do, we do well.




The Main Responsibilities Of The Role Include




Developing and implementing data flows
Delivering the acquisition, cleansing, and transformation of data
Identifying opportunities through the production of analysis, comparisons and benchmarks
Engaging with subject matter experts within the organisation to understand data quality and lineage
Understanding and working with colleagues to ensure continued compliance with information governance framework and statute
Undertaking complex analysis of information to ensure consistent and accurate reporting to meet the needs of stakeholders.
Providing regular data and information updates
Routinely undertaking data-quality checks to a high-level of data accuracy
Leveraging business intelligence tools i.e. Spotfire for analysis and review.
Ensuring systems code and documentation are inspection ready




This position can be based in either our Livingston office or can be fully remote/home-based in the UK.




About You




A solutions orientated, analytical and customer focused individual with a global business mind set and a strong background in operational excellence!




To Enable Success In This Position You Will Have




Here at ICON we want our employees to succeed and ensure that they are set up for this success through constant training, development and support.




We’re looking for someone with a Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Maths, Science or Computer Science
Experience using computer languages to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets
Previous SQL experience is essential
Experience working with and creating data architectures.
Experience of clinical data and domains (Experience working within Clinical Trials or the wider Pharmaceutical industry) preferable but not necessary
Data Warehouse experience with exposure to Big Data
Experience of Data Analysis, Data Quality and Data Lineage
Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams.
A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.




Benefits Of Working In ICON




Our success depends on the knowledge, capabilities and quality of our people. That’s why we are committed to developing our employees in a continuous learning culture - one where we challenge you with engaging work and where every experience adds to your professional development.




At ICON, our focus is to provide you with a comprehensive and competitive total reward package that comprises, not only an excellent level of base pay, but also a wide range of variable pay and recognition programs. In addition, our best in class employee benefits, supportive policies and wellbeing initiatives are tailored to support you and your family at all stages of your career - both now, and into the future.




ICON, including subsidiaries, is an equal opportunity and inclusive employer and is committed to providing a workplace free of discrimination and harassment. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.




If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process, or in order to perform the essential functions of a position, please let us know.

Title: CRM & Data Analyst (H/F/X)
Description:
Le département Data d’AlphaCredit se compose de quatre services (Data Analytics & CRM, Business Intelligence & Reporting, Data Project, Data Management Office). L’équipe Analytics & CRM est composée de cinq collaborateurs qui, grâce à des opérations innovantes de gestion des données et des analyses statistiques, contribuent à la rentabilité de nos différents portefeuilles d’activités, à la rentabilité de nos actions marketing et à l’optimisation de nos processus opérationnels. Pour ce département nous sommes à la recherche d’un CRM & DATA ANALYST (H/F/X).




Votre Fonction




En tant qu’analyste CRM & Marketing, vous aiderez à gérer nos campagnes commerciales (sélection des clients et analyses de rentabilité) et à développer des modèles statistiques qui contribuent à la rentabilité de nos différents portefeuilles d’activités.




Par exemple, vous développez des modèles statistiques qui améliorent le taux de réponse à nos campagnes de marketing direct, conduisent à un meilleur profilage des clients existants et nouveaux, améliorent nos campagnes d’acquisition et conduisent à l’optimisation de notre marketing mix (pricing, channels). Vous réussissez à transformer les données en informations commerciales pertinentes et claires et des avis stratégiques.




Résumé




Vous assurez-vous que nos campagnes marketing sont bien gérées au moyen de procédures de sélection affinées et des bonnes informations en termes de rentabilité (tests de signification entre les groupes cibles et témoins; Calcul du retour sur investissement);
Conseiller le service marketing sur la gestion de la relation client en développant des modèles prédictifs (response, appetite, uplift scoring) et des segmentations (random forest, clustering), customer lifetime value, etc.;
Vous utilisez et développez des techniques et des algorithmes d’exploration de données pour découvrir des modèles et des relations dans de grands volumes de données provenant de diverses sources (données marketing, données en ligne, données transactionnelles, données d’entreprise);
Vous guidez le service marketing dans l’optimisation et la personnalisation des offres pour les clients. Un modèle « customer oriented» et « event and trigger based» est central ici.
Développez vos tableaux de bord KPI qui permettent à l’entreprise de prendre les meilleures décisions stratégiques.




Votre Profil




Vous êtes titulaire d’une maîtrise universitaire à vocation quantitative (science des données, statistiques, ingénierie commerciale, mathématiques, économétrie, psychologie);
Vous avez un certain nombre d’années (idéalement 3 à 5) d’expérience dans un poste d’analyse de données (analyste de données, analyste d’intelligence d’affaires,...)
Vous avez une expérience professionnelle en programmation avec SPSS (programmation directement dans l’éditeur de syntaxe)
Vous avez une expérience professionnelle en programmation avec Python ou souhaitez apprendre ceci
En plus de vous intéresser aux données, vous vous intéressez également à la gestion des campagnes et à la façon dont les informations analytiques peuvent être utilisées dans la pratique commerciale;
Vous avez une expérience analytique pour le développement de tests, segmentations, modèles probabilistes et/ou modèles prédictifs (connaissance des analyses de régression, analyse en grappes, analyse factorielle,...) ;
Vous avez une très bonne connaissance de Microsoft Office, principalement Excel ou Access;
Vous pouvez travailler de manière autonome, mais aussi en équipe et vous êtes résistant au stress; vous pouvez faire face à des délais imprévus et parfois serrés
Vous êtes social et pouvez facilement vous intégrer dans une équipe
Vous pouvez expliquer d'une manière simple vos analyses aux métiers (employés et responsables d’équipes non data, directeurs,) ;
Vous avez suffisamment de compétences en communication pour faire des présentations ou vous voulez apprendre dans ce domaine;
Vous travaillez avec précision et vous êtes intéressé par les considérations stratégiques de l’entreprise.
Vous parlez bien l'anglais et de préférence l'une des deux langues nationales (NL / FR).




Notre offre




Une fonction enrichissante dans un environnement de travail flexible
Une atmosphère de travail ouverte et des collègues enthousiastes qui, avec vous, s'efforcent d'atteindre un niveau élevé de satisfaction des clients.
De nombreuses possibilités de formation pour continuer à développer vos connaissances et compétences.
Un contrat à durée indéterminée dans une entreprise en pleine évolution au sein d'un groupe BNP Paribas solide.
Un salaire compétitif, complété par un large éventail d'avantages extra-légaux (assurances, chèques repas, jours de congé extra-légaux, etc.)
Un Flex Income Plan dans lequel vous pouvez convertir chaque année votre prime de fin d'année (avec un moment de choix collectif fixe) en avantages supplémentaires, parmi lesquels un vélo en location, des jours de congé supplémentaires, une voiture, etc.
L'accent est mis sur l'équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée.




Leader du crédit à la consommation en Belgique et au Luxembourg, AlphaCredit fait partie du groupe BNP Paribas. Nous proposons un éventail complet de solutions de crédit, par le biais de nos partenaires professionnels. AlphaCredit continue à se développer ! C’est pourquoi nous sommes à la recherche de nouveaux collègues dynamiques.




Merci de mentionner le canal par lequel vous avez pris connaissance de cette offre d’emploi

  • Vous assurez-vous que nos campagnes marketing sont bien gérées au moyen de procédures de sélection affinées et des bonnes informations en termes de rentabilité (tests de signification entre les groupes cibles et témoins; Calcul du retour sur investissement);
  • Conseiller le service marketing sur la gestion de la relation client en développant des modèles prédictifs (response, appetite, uplift scoring) et des segmentations (random forest, clustering), customer lifetime value, etc.;
  • Vous utilisez et développez des techniques et des algorithmes d’exploration de données pour découvrir des modèles et des relations dans de grands volumes de données provenant de diverses sources (données marketing, données en ligne, données transactionnelles, données d’entreprise);
  • Vous guidez le service marketing dans l’optimisation et la personnalisation des offres pour les clients. Un modèle « customer oriented» et « event and trigger based» est central ici.
  • Développez vos tableaux de bord KPI qui permettent à l’entreprise de prendre les meilleures décisions stratégiques.


Votre Profil


  • Vous êtes titulaire d’une maîtrise universitaire à vocation quantitative (science des données, statistiques, ingénierie commerciale, mathématiques, économétrie, psychologie);
  • Vous avez un certain nombre d’années (idéalement 3 à 5) d’expérience dans un poste d’analyse de données (analyste de données, analyste d’intelligence d’affaires,...)
  • Vous avez une expérience professionnelle en programmation avec SPSS (programmation directement dans l’éditeur de syntaxe)
  • Vous avez une expérience professionnelle en programmation avec Python ou souhaitez apprendre ceci
  • En plus de vous intéresser aux données, vous vous intéressez également à la gestion des campagnes et à la façon dont les informations analytiques peuvent être utilisées dans la pratique commerciale;
  • Vous avez une expérience analytique pour le développement de tests, segmentations, modèles probabilistes et/ou modèles prédictifs (connaissance des analyses de régression, analyse en grappes, analyse factorielle,...) ;
  • Vous avez une très bonne connaissance de Microsoft Office, principalement Excel ou Access;
  • Vous pouvez travailler de manière autonome, mais aussi en équipe et vous êtes résistant au stress; vous pouvez faire face à des délais imprévus et parfois serrés
  • Vous êtes social et pouvez facilement vous intégrer dans une équipe
  • Vous pouvez expliquer d'une manière simple vos analyses aux métiers (employés et responsables d’équipes non data, directeurs,) ;
  • Vous avez suffisamment de compétences en communication pour faire des présentations ou vous voulez apprendre dans ce domaine;
  • Vous travaillez avec précision et vous êtes intéressé par les considérations stratégiques de l’entreprise.
  • Vous parlez bien l'anglais et de préférence l'une des deux langues nationales (NL / FR).


Notre offre


  • Une fonction enrichissante dans un environnement de travail flexible
  • Une atmosphère de travail ouverte et des collègues enthousiastes qui, avec vous, s'efforcent d'atteindre un niveau élevé de satisfaction des clients.
  • De nombreuses possibilités de formation pour continuer à développer vos connaissances et compétences.
  • Un contrat à durée indéterminée dans une entreprise en pleine évolution au sein d'un groupe BNP Paribas solide.
  • Un salaire compétitif, complété par un large éventail d'avantages extra-légaux (assurances, chèques repas, jours de congé extra-légaux, etc.)
  • Un Flex Income Plan dans lequel vous pouvez convertir chaque année votre prime de fin d'année (avec un moment de choix collectif fixe) en avantages supplémentaires, parmi lesquels un vélo en location, des jours de congé supplémentaires, une voiture, etc.
  • L'accent est mis sur l'équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée.


Leader du crédit à la consommation en Belgique et au Luxembourg, AlphaCredit fait partie du groupe BNP Paribas. Nous proposons un éventail complet de solutions de crédit, par le biais de nos partenaires professionnels. AlphaCredit continue à se développer ! C’est pourquoi nous sommes à la recherche de nouveaux collègues dynamiques.


Merci de mentionner le canal par lequel vous avez pris connaissance de cette offre d’emploi


Lieu principal


BE-BRU-Bruxelles

CDI


Domaine d'activité


DATA


Niveau d%27Etudes


Master ou équivalent (> 4 ans)


Niveau d%27expérience


Au moins 3 ans

Title: BI Consultant
Description:
Who are we ?




The Positive Thinking Company is a global tech partner that delivers end-to-end tech solutions. We are positive thinkers who believe that collaboration betters our world! · https://positivethinking.tech/




Who are you ?




As a Positive Thinker you...

· Speak Dutch or French and have a good knowledge of English.

· Have at least 3 years of experience as a BI developer/analyst.

· Will be an outstanding candidate if you share our values: Positive thinking, Collaboration, Evolution, Commitment.

· Hold a degree in Computer science or Economics, but above all we are looking for a passionate person who can present a project that he/she is proud of 😉




What will you do ?




As a BI specialist, you oversee different phases on the whole BI chain.

You will have the opportunity to work with a variety of clients and sectors and on a daily basis you will:

· Collect requirements from the business

· Identify and collect the data from different data sources

· Develop, design and implement ETL solutions and data storage systems, through your knowledge of ETL tools (Informatica, Data integrator, Talend, SSIS …)

· Model Data (datawarehouse, data vault, data marts), CDC, Data Lake

· Integrate data in the data warehouse and create data marts

· Ensure the data quality and analyse data

· Present reports and create insightful information and help managers make better data-driven decisions, through your knowledge of reporting tools (Tableau, SAP BI, Power BI, Qlik…)

· Provide expertise advice for the continuous improvement of the data capabilities




The technical environments available with our customers are: SQL, Oracle (Data integrator, OBIEE...), Informatica, Microsoft (SSIS, SSRS, SSAS), Azure SQL, Amazon Redshift, PosgreSQL, Talend, Alteryx, IBM (Datastage, Cognos), Kimball, DataVault, SAP (SAP BI, Data integrator) …




On top of that, you could be involved in our solution centres where we develop tailored solutions for our clients. For some concrete examples of projects, check our uses cases: https://positivethinking.tech/use-cases/?exp%5B%5D=expertise-data-analytics)




What are we offering you ?




- EVOLUTION

o Personal follow-up during your career at PTC

o Catalogue with a wide variety of trainings for hard- and soft skills, private language classes, unlimited access to an E-learning platform (Udemy, Pluralsight,…) and possibility to get certified every year

- COLLABORATION

o Opportunity to join the BI community and participate in knowledge sharing sessions, events, workshops, etc.

o Join one of the passion communities and practice your hobby or share your interests with other positive thinkers

o International collaboration, possibility to work worldwide

- ON TOP OF THAT:

o Competitive salary with a flexible mobility package (variety of choice, including: Electrical cars, electrical bikes, payment of rent/mortgage...)

o Copyrights

o You will become part of a growing team of people keen on applying the latest technologies and knowledge. You will be able to work in a dynamic, innovating environment with the proper touch of geekiness and yearning for board games.

Title: Junior Insights Researcher
Description:
Job Title - Junior Insights Researcher
Reports Into - Insights Manager
Location - Remote / Anywhere




A Little Bit about Kwalee….

Kwalee is one of the world’s leading multiplatform game developers and publishers, with well over 900 million downloads worldwide for mobile hits such as Draw It, Teacher Simulator, Let’s Be Cops 3D, Airport Security and Makeover Studio 3D. We also have a growing PC and Console team of incredible pedigree that is on the hunt for great new titles to join TENS!, Eternal Hope, Die by the Blade and Scathe.




What’s In It For You?

We want everyone involved in our games to share our success, that’s why we have a generous team profit sharing scheme from day 1 of employment
Creative Wednesdays! (Pitch and make your own games every Wednesday)
Great work-life balance with flexible working hours
Quarterly team building days - work hard, play hard!
Monthly employee awards




Are You Up To The Challenge?

As a Junior Insights Researcher you’ll be planning and carrying out player research to help guide our games.




Your Team Mates

Our team of publishers, producers and researchers source and onboard external mobile game developers who wish to make chart-topping success. We support these developers in their journey with our publishing knowledge and metrics to ensure we get the kind of games millions love.




What Does The Job Actually Involve?

Plan and conduct market and user research activities for stakeholders across the company.
Manage relationships with key products stakeholders, creating a research roadmap to run along-side product development
Plan and suggest research to support product development, all the way through the product lifecycle, from idea to hard-launch and beyond
Identify research opportunities that will impact player understanding, product design and quality
Use a variety of quantitative and qualitative research methodologies to answer the questions proposed by stakeholders
Collaborate with cross functional teams such as Digital Marketing to support broader analytics and insights work that drive business impact.




Your Hard Skills

Academic background in psychology, social studies or other human behavioural sciences
Experience of, or a demonstrably strong interest in the interactive entertainment industry (e.g., video/mobile gaming, video/entertainment platforms)
Excellent knowledge of quantitative and qualitative research methods
Excellent survey writing skills
Experience in data manipulation and statistical software (e.g., SPSS, R/Python or any other)
Experience with data visualisation tools such as Tableau
Degree in psychology, HCI, social sciences, or related field
Effective written, storytelling, verbal and presentation skills;
Fluent in English
A passion for gaming




Your Soft Skills

Kwalee has grown fast in recent years but we’re very much a family of colleagues. We welcome people of all ages, races, colours, beliefs, sexual orientations, genders and circumstances, and all we ask is that you collaborate, work hard, ask questions and have fun with your team and colleagues.




We don’t like egos or arrogance and we love playing games and celebrating success together. If that sounds like you, then please apply.




A Little More About Kwalee

Founded in 2011 by David Darling CBE, a key architect of the UK games industry who previously co-founded and led Codemasters, our team also includes legends such as Andrew Graham (creator of Micro Machines series) and Jason Falcus (programmer of classics including NBA Jam) alongside a growing and diverse team of global gaming experts.




Everyone contributes creatively to Kwalee’s success, with all employees eligible to pitch their own game ideas on Creative Wednesdays, and we’re proud to have built our success on this inclusive principle.




We have an amazing team of experts collaborating daily between our studios in Leamington Spa, Lisbon, Bangalore and Beijing, or on a remote basis from Turkey, Brazil, Cyprus, the Philippines and many more places around the world. We’ve recently acquired our first external studio, TicTales, which is based in France.




We have a truly global team making games for a global audience, and it’s paying off: - Kwalee has been voted the Best Large Studio and Best Leadership Team at the TIGA Awards (Independent Game Developers’ Association) and our games have been downloaded in every country on earth - including Antarctica!

Show more Show less

Title: Data Engineer (Remote)
Description:
Data Engineer – Unlock your potential!




How can you increase success in a range of domains utilising AI technology?




We are looking for a Data Engineer to join a thriving Data Science organisation focused on optimizing growing businesses and advancing the accuracy of decisions made. You will be adept with using a trio of programming languages to reduce huge risks for a range of organisations! As a Data Engineer, you will be managing big datasets for businesses and align them with their tailored needs.




As a Data Engineer, you will play critical part in building, and developing data pipelines. You will work collaboratively with management teams to fully comprehend the objectives involved, being left to work both independently and within a team led structure.




You will have a solid understanding of programming languages such as C++ and / or Python, with advanced SQL skills. You will be able to work with an experimental attitude to problem solving.




Just a few things you are entitled to as a Data Engineer:

- Competitive compensation package

- Fully remote role, flexible working arrangement

- Have your deep knowledge impact worldwide organizations such as Google and Microsoft

- Be part of an incredible community of Engineers and Scientists







Sound interesting?

Title: Data Analyst - Consultant Financial Services (min 2 years of experience)
Description:
Data Analyst - Consultant Financial Services (min 2 years of experience)




Initio is looking for experienced Team Members to hop on board our Data practice!




Are you eager to develop your skills to the next level? Do you want to be the next Initio talent?

Seize the opportunity to be part of a team driven by professionals and join Initio!




Initio is a fast-growing consulting firm that represents the best of both worlds - a Belgian human-size company with a team of 80 highly qualified consultants, part of the square group of over 800 professionals.




Your role:

We are looking for individuals with a strong sense of purpose and ownership. This means that

you will be proactive, quickly adapt to changing situations and create value for both Initio and our amazing clients:

During your assignments, you will help implement impactful changes and apply the best-practice methodology to ensure sustainable, innovative, and high-performance business transformations.
Internally, as a member of our Data Practice, you will be involved in research, white papers, training, and new offers development. This will allow you to broaden your competencies and build up knowledge whilst exchanging with your colleagues in an international and open environment.







Examples of projects in which you can be involved with:




Data governance & strategy:

Identify and prioritize critical data assets and develop and maintain planning, oversight, and control procedures and policies.
Enable data-driven decisions through advanced analytics, visualization, quality data, and dedicated datasets
Structure and leverage our client’s data to improve and strengthen their business




Data management:

Establish the Data organizational framework (data governance, data quality, data traceability, data control)
Control the regulatory (GDPR) and security framework (cyber risk, reputation risk, etc.)




Data science & analytics:

Formalize the internal service offers: data visualization, segmentation, automation of business processes
Be involved in data science projects involving machine learning, data marketing, and customer insight.
Participate in statistical modeling: scoring, logistic regression, backtesting, stress testing




Are you the one?

You have a Master’s degree in any relevant field (Business, Economics, Law, Actuary, Data...)
You have at least 2 years in data strategy, data governance, data management, data analytics & data science.
Following technical skills is a plus: SAS, SQL, SAP, VBA, R, Power BI, Tableau, Python,..
Client & customer-oriented, you understand the needs and expectations of the stakeholders
You have strong curiosity, analysis, oral and written communication skills
Any additional business or project management certifications are a plus
You speak native French or Dutch and are fluent in English




We offer:

A great working environment where work-life balance, informal work vibe, and open communication are essentials
An attractive and competitive package (e.g. car, laptop, mobile phone, meal vouchers, training programs, eco cheques...)
A great opportunity for personal and professional growth: exciting assignments for well-known clients in the financial sector; a specific training program, tailored to your needs; sharing your knowledge by coaching your fellow colleagues, and the internal role that encourages intrapreneurship and collective intelligence!
A career path in line with your ambitions and experience. Your responsibilities will vary according to your grade (Consultant, Senior Consultant, Manager, Senior Manager, Principal, Associate Partner)
…and a lot of FUN!

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Company Description




We are an equal opportunities employer and place where everyone is welcome. We strongly encourage people from minority backgrounds, LGBTQIA+, parents, and individuals with disabilities to apply. If you need reasonable adjustments at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.




In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example - she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).




We were founded by Axel Springer in 2018 as a 100 percent owned company and combine the digital activities and participations in real estate, car and generalist classifieds in Germany 🇩🇪 (Immowelt), France 🇫🇷 (Meilleurs Agents, Groupe SeLoger, Logic-Immo, Car & Boat Media), Belgium 🇧🇪 (Immoweb), Spain 🇪🇸 (Housell) and Israel 🇮🇱 (Yad2), making us one of the world’s biggest digital classified players.




We also hold Axel Springer’s minority participation in companies such as Purplebricks, Homeday and Zumper. Our vision is to serve consumers in their important decisions in life and to simplify not only the search for a new property or car but to also provide additional services in adjacent markets.




This is an exciting time to join us in our ambition to become Europe’s leading PropTech business - helping us unlock everyone’s perfect place!




Business Intelligence at AVIV Group




The main goal of the Business Intelligence team is to provide helpful insights and analyze the data in the whole AVIV Group to help the leaders with the decision-making process. The Business Intelligence team is the main point of contact when it comes to monitoring and analyzing the AVIV Group core metrics, objectives and key results, financial and HR KPIs. In this role you will not only work closely with other teams of the Data Analytics & BI department, such as Product, Marketing and Strategy analytics, but also ensure that your stakeholders have all the required analysis and visualizations to be able to make data-driven decisions.




Job Description




What we are looking for




As a Business Analyst it is crucial that you have a good working knowledge of Tableau and Tableau Prep Builder
You are fully at ease working with Office tools (Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook); a knowledge of Google Suite will be an advantage
You already have experience in a similar position.
You are accurate in your work and have an analytical mind.
You are someone who can work independently, who is creative in looking for solutions and who likes to work on a project basis
You preferably have a good knowledge of English as well as Dutch and/or French.
You do not hesitate to ask for information and you are keen to learn as much as possible.




Qualifications




Who we are looking for




You have excellent oral and written communication skills. This will mean that you feel at ease making presentations to various audiences, including senior management.
You are strongly customer- and results-oriented.
You are a team player, but also excellent at working autonomously.
You have a sense of organisation and are systematic and rigorous.
You have a "can do" attitude and a sense of innovation (you think out of the box).
You have excellent analytical skills and can be critical with information.
You have a passion for IT and have an extensive knowledge of IT terminology.




Additional Information




What we offer you




We are one of the leading PropTech platforms in Europe. If you’ve ever rented or purchased a property then you may have used one of our classified portals. This is a great time to join us to help elevate our AVIV brand
You'll experience a good work-life balance, flexible working hours, and mobile working options.
You have the autonomy to work in a style which suits you to be the most productive
You are part of a great team with an exceptionally positive spirit that turns employee events into very special experiences
Job based in Belgium
