  • Een opportuniteit – Je krijgt de kans om een uitdagend domein binnen Colruyt Group mee uit te bouwen.
  • Ruimte voor jezelf – Bij Colruyt Group werken bijna 30.000 mensen. En toch zijn we geen nummers. Jij krijgt hier de ruimte om te zijn wie je bent, en de vrijheid om initiatief te nemen. Je komt in een relatief klein team terecht en hebt toch met heel veel verschillende andere teams en functies contact.
  • Persoonlijke groei – Bij Colruyt Group kan je jezelf ontplooien, op professioneel en persoonlijk vlak dankzij een breed aanbod opleidingen.
  • Aantrekkelijk loonpakket – Boven op een aantrekkelijk loon krijg je extralegale voordelen zoals maaltijdcheques en winstdeelname.

Title: Analyst/Associate, Infrastructure Sector
Description:
Analyst / Associate, Infrastructure Sector




Your work environment




We are looking for our next colleague to join our Brussels based Infrastructure Sector team within Wholesale Banking.




Our team is part of ING’s global Infrastructure franchise located in Brussels, London, Madrid, New York and Sydney. We cover primarily infrastructure funds, as well as infrastructure companies (e.g. airports, regulated utilities, ferries) and contractors active in infrastructure projects.




Our Brussels team acts as a centre of excellence, thus our geographical scope is the wider EMEA region, so you will work primarily on international transactions.




We aim to provide creative multi-product solutions through a broad range of services (from debt capital markets, to a.o. sustainability linked products), and our team is expert in delivering acquisition financing, traditional project finance, whole business securitisation and fund financing structures.




Our ambition is to leverage on ING’s key three pillars:




Our global reach, with local experts
We are sector experts
We are sustainability pioneers




Key words for the work are creativity, complexity and international focus which makes this environment an area particularly suited for candidates with strong analytical skills, tenacity, eye for detail and high commercial drive.




Your Key Responsibilities




Working in the front office, you will be involved in the origination, structuring, negotiation, execution and monitoring of transactions. Depending on experience, job level and background, the role includes a.o.:




Assist with pitching, origination and execution of new transactions
Run sensitivity analysis on complex financial models and occasionally develop our own models
Draft new business proposals, credit modifications and annual reviews
Perform client and credit administration primarily through timely, complete and correct data input and data management in the relevant support systems in line with internal procedures and guidelines
Participate in client and bank calls/meetings
Side projects such as internal reporting and business development




We look for




A colleague with a talent for taking it on and making it happen, enthusiasm for helping others to be successful and a knack for always being a step ahead.




As an Analyst/Associate within the Infrastructure sector team, you will also need:




Strong academic record, with relevant master’s degree in business economics, financial engineering or law
Interest for the Infrastructure sector and/or structured finance
A true team player with good communication skills
Entrepreneurial and commercial drive
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and in Dutch
Strong quantitative, financial and analytical skills
Strong eye for detail in all deliverables
Eager to learn and share knowledge with colleagues
Ability to work independently on various transactions/projects at the same time, often under pressure, and to prioritize resources accordingly




We offer you




A clear purpose, a unique offer and a range of benefits:




Personal growth & challenging work with endless opportunities to realise your ambitions
Informal, dynamic environment with innovative colleagues supporting your endeavours
Experience an international environment and collaborate with colleagues across the globe
On-the-job training to translate theory into practice, learning from highly experienced professionals
A flexible hybrid way of working, subject to team’s arrangements




We are committed to the principle of equal opportunity in employment. The Company is opposed to any form of less favourable treatment, whether through unfair, inconsistent direct or indirect discrimination, accorded to employees and applicants for employment on the grounds of sex, sexual orientation, marital or parental status, disability, race, religion or belief, age, creed, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin.
Show more Show less

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Data Engineer


BDO Advisory (Digital) verleent deskundig advies op het raakvlak tussen business en ICT. Dankzij een onderbouwde en pragmatische aanpak leveren we tastbare resultaten en groeien we op die manier uit tot een effectieve en betrouwbare partner van onze klanten.
Onze organisatie is in squads opgedeeld met verschillende technische domeinen om maximaal innovatie en autonomie te stimuleren.
Bij BDO Digital kom je terecht in een no-nonsens omgeving met veel aandacht voor innovatie, work-life balance en persoonlijke groei.


Om het Technologies team te versterken, zijn wij op zoek naar een ervaren Data Engineer.








De uitdaging


Als Data Engineer zal je deel uitmaken van het DMIII (Data Management, Integration, Insight & Intelligence) team. Een jong team met sterke focus op nieuwe technologieën en technieken (met focus op Cloud).


Je helpt klanten met het beheer van hun data en het verkrijgen van inzichten in deze gegevens. Zowel op strategisch vlak, als met het maken van de juiste technologiekeuzes en de implementatie.
Je krijgt de kans om mee de richting te bepalen en mee de strategische keuzes van het aanbod te bepalen
Je zal met verschillende tools aan de slag gaan zoals Snowflake, Matillion, PowerBI, Python, Databricks, Azure ML
Een aantal activtiteiten die kunnen behoren tot het takenpakket:
Extractie, centralisatie en modellering van data (data warehousing)
Rapportering en visualisatie van gegevens
Verdergaande analyses van datasets zoals statische analyses of het toepassen van machine learning algoritmes.
Opzetten van structuren en tools rond data governance, data kwaliteit en data privacy
Afhankelijk van jouw interesse, kan je je toespitsen op jouw voorkeur.







Het gewenste profiel


Je hebt een bachelor- of masterdiploma in IT, of je kan je skills omtrent Data Engineering duidelijk aantonen vanuit je uitgebreide ervaring.
Je beheerst vlot het Nederlands en het Engels; als je sterke skills hebt in het Frans, dan is dit zeker een plus.
Je kan mogelijke technische skills voorleggen: (of gelijkaardig):
Cloud platformen, bij voorkeur Microsoft Azure
Data modelleringstechnieken zoals Data Vault 2.0
Databases (SQL) en ETL/ELT.
Software zoals Snowflake, Matillion, PowerBI, Python
Data governance tools zoals Collibra
Ervaring als consultant is een grote plus, gezien je vaak in interactie zal zijn met klanten, waarbij de users vaak ook geen IT'ers zijn; je bent dus klantgericht en legt de nodige empathie, onderhandelingsvaardigheden en flexibiliteit aan de dag.





What's in it for you?


Binnen BDO Advisory (Digital) kom je terecht in een professionele organisatie met een pragmatische en persoonlijke aanpak. Menselijke waarden zijn belangrijk, evenals een gezonde work-life balance.


Kans om te werken bij en hoge kwaliteit neer te zetten bij klanten.
Je werkt in een hechte ploeg van zeer capabele collega's.
Continue leermogelijkheden (vb. on the job, kennisdeling van/met collega's en klanten, BDO Academy, …)
Ook de kans om mee te werken in de andere technische domeinen (RPA, Applicatie Integratie, ERP Implmentatie).
Deelnemen aan innovatieve projecten binnen BDO business lines zoals accounting, audit, tax, corporate finance om mee te werken aan de verdere digitalisatie van deze services, waarin data analyse een grote rol zal spelen.
Tot slot mag een competitief beloningspakket met uitgebreide extralegale voordelen niet ontbreken (en uiteraard een bedrijfswagen).

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Function:

As an experienced data scientist, you draw relevant insights from the huge amount of data Colruyt Group disposes of. You make statistical models and you give strategic advice to our different retail brands. The result of your work: an even better service tailored to our customers.

What will you do specifically?

Data science is part of Colruyt Group's Data & Analytics department department. This department takes the lead in the further professionalisation of all domains with regard to the efficient management and use of data in the decision processes. You will work in an environment where you can confer with colleagues who are specialised in data management, data security, business intelligence & reporting, GDPR, etc.
As a data scientist, you work with 30 complementary colleagues on a whole range of projects in which you come into contact with new techniques and technologies. We also encourage you to look for new methods and techniques with the team in order to increase the group's knowledge and skills. Apart from a wide range of in-house training courses, you will also have the opportunity to follow complementary training sessions. In this way, you continuously develop your business knowledge, your technical expertise and your social skills.
On the one hand, our team focuses on our internal customers, the business partners. We convert their requests into analytical projects which we tackle in multidisciplinary teams. This results in a direct and close collaboration with ETL, software development and the business partner.
On the other hand, we are also responsible for the identification of new analytics opportunities. We pro-actively look for new insights that create an added value for our partners. We don't just consider Colruyt Group, but we also follow external trends in the field of use cases regarding analytics and technological innovation.
Colruyt Group consists of many different entities. As a result, there is a huge variety and amount of data and use cases. The projects you will work on, will therefore range from customer segmentation over sales forecasts and store test analyses to operational efficiency of machines, predictive maintenance and optimal use of base material.




You will work in Halle and you can work from home up to three days a week.




Profile:

Education and experience – You have a solid foundation in trade and/or computer sciences, statistics, mathematics or engineering studies. You have at least 3 to 5 years relevant experience.
Knowledge of statistic modelling – You have excellent knowledge of statistic modelling and are able to implement this in Python. You have knowledge of SQL and data visualisation techniques.
Analytic ability – You succeed in translating data into insights and you are able to communicate them clearly and comprehensibly.
Languages – You speak English very fluently. Knowledge of Dutch and/or French is a plus..




We offer:

Stimulating work environment – You work in an incredibly fascinating and rich data environment, you get room for initiative and you have a broad view of the company.
Permanent learning opportunities – You learn new things every day and you also get the opportunity to develop your talents thanks to internal and external training courses. With time, you have real career opportunities.
Attractive salary package – You will earn a competitive salary with lots of fringe benefits such as a company car, profit-sharing and meal vouchers.

Title: Data Engineer - Financial Services
Description:
EY is the only major professional services firm with a dedicated financial services practice (EY FSO) integrated in the EMEIA region. An international team of over 16.000 professionals is working across borders for our clients in the financial sector: Banking, Insurance, Payment Institutions and Wealth & Asset Management, in all service lines: Consulting, Tax, Transactions and Assurance. As we consider our people as the heart of EY, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. So that, whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.




The Opportunity




EY Belgium Modern Data Platform team supports our clients in defining and rolling out the right data architecture, data platform and infrastructure that support their needs, implement and maintain automated data pipelines, and infuse data through business intelligence and analytics. We are currently looking for capable and motivated professionals to join our team as Data Engineer.




Key Responsibilities




As Data Engineer, you will :




Support in designing and rolling out the data architecture and infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources
Identify data source, design and implement data schema/models and integrate data that meet the requirements of the business stakeholders
Play an active role in the end-to-end delivery of AI solutions, from ideation, feasibility assessment, to data preparation and industrialization.
Work with business, IT and data stakeholders to support with data-related technical issues, their data infrastructure needs as well as to build the most flexible and scalable data platform.
With a strong focus on DataOps, design, develop and deploy scalable batch and/or real-time data pipelines.
Design, document, test and deploy ETL/ELT processes
Find the right tradeoffs between the performance, reliability, scalability, and cost of the data pipelines you implement
Monitor data processing efficiency and propose solutions for improvements.
Identify and investigate potential data quality issues and explore ways to improve data quality and reliability
Prepare Ad-Hoc queries for different business stakeholders
Integrate new data management technologies and software engineering tools into existing structures.
Be able to understand and use the wide variety of scripting languages and tools to integrate systems.
Have the discipline to create and maintain comprehensive project documentation.
Build and share knowledge with colleagues and coach junior profiles.




Skills And Attributes For Success




Master’s degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics or another relevant subject
2+ years of experience in big data related software development
Experience with data modeling, design patterns and building highly scalable and secured data platforms and infrastructures.
Practical experience with Python data exploration, analysis and engineering libraries.
Familiar with big data platforms like appliances (i.e.: Teradata), Hadoop, Spark
Advanced knowledge of data structures and algorithms, networking, operating systems and DataOps tools.
Ability to work with a wide variety of data types (i.e. structured and unstructured), extracting and integrating data from modern and legacy data platforms
Meaningful experience in extracting and loading data from multiple database technologies like RDBMS (MS SQL Server, Oracle, PostgreSQL), MPP (Snowflake) and NoSQL (MongoDB, Neo4J)
Experience and interest in Microsoft Azure Cloud platforms.
Implement pipelines using a combination of technologies, including SQL, Airflow, Python, Alteryx, Kafka, and cloud data tech stack
Commercial client-facing project experience is helpful
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and effectively with people at all levels in an organization
You love picking your brain on large datasets, and tackle each new problem with a can-do & pragmatic mindset
You have strong communication and presentation skills and love to take full ownership of your projects and help clients in overcoming their challenges.
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French, proficient business English




Can we dream for more?




You have a strong business understanding of the financial sector (Banking, Insurance or Capital markets)
You are proud to share relevant experience in coaching a team of Junior Data Engineers
You have already found your way through cloud computing services, such as Azure, AWS or GCP
You have a good overview of the (big—)data ecosystems and frameworks (Hadoop or other)
You have experience with lean/agile software development
You are familiar with NoSQL tools for exploiting unstructured information
You are not afraid to support of business development and pre-sales activities




What Working At EY Offers




You will be part of a leading global professional services firm.
You will be part of the EY family where everyone is willing to offer support and senior management is very accessible.
You will join a dynamic and growing team with a great mix of young and experienced professionals focusing on financial services.
You will get extensive trainings on technical matters, as well as soft skills and project management, and you will have access to new technologies and innovative equipment.
We are proud of our flexible working arrangements, and we will support you to build a successful career and deliver excellent client service, without sacrificing your personal priorities.
While our client-facing profession might require part-time working at client site and business traveling at times, we are committed to helping you achieve a lifestyle balance.

What Working At EY Offers


  • You will be part of a leading global professional services firm.

  • You will get extensive trainings on technical matters, as well as soft skills and project management, and you will have access to new technologies and innovative equipment.
  • We are proud of our flexible working arrangements, and we will support you to build a successful career and deliver excellent client service, without sacrificing your personal priorities.
  • While our client-facing profession might require part-time working at client site and business traveling at times, we are committed to helping you achieve a lifestyle balance.

Title: Tableau Developer
Description:
***** Tableau Developer - 6 Months initially - Hybrid*****




On behalf of one of our international clients based in Europe, RED Global is looking to hire a French Speaking Tableau Developer for a contractual position. It is a 6-months hybrid contract.




Requirements :

The new BDI department is urgently looking for a Medior French Speaking Tableau Developer to join their team. BDI is divided into 3 teams: Data reporting / Data integration / Data modelling and the consultant will join the data reporting team.

The consultant will be part of the data reporting team which consists of 4 team-members and a coordinator, all of them senior/expert level.




Technical profile requirements:

Good knowledge of BI Tableau tool is mandatory
Very good SQL knowledge is mandatory
Good database knowledge of Datamarts & Datawarehouse is a plus
Good practical experience in Tooling such as: Atlassian JIRA / Confluence is a plus
Knowledge of DBeaver is a plus
Knowledge of Agile methodology is a plus




Primary Tasks and responsibilities:

Analyse the functional and business requirements in order to create the report and/or dashboard
Insure the well understanding of all requirements.
Study and discuss the analysis with the coordinator and/or internal stakeholder(s)
Design, Build & Test & Support the Reports & Dashboards
Ensure quality, coherence and performance of the Reports & Dashboards.
Put in practice the improvement actions and good practices of software development
Participate in the daily Scrum meeting & other Agile ceremonies




Contract length: 6 months could be extended

Location: Hybrid in Brussels




For immediate consideration, please send me an updated CV to pfulwani@redglobal.com or of anyone you may know who might be interested in the above opportunity

Title: Data Intelligence BI Developer - Car sector
Description:
NTT Data Europe & LatAm is currently looking for a resourceful Medior-Senior BI Developer Data Intelligence for a private company in the car sector. This role is hybrid and will be performed both remotely and at the office.







Mission:



The Medior-Senior BI Developer understands the client's requests and needs, challenges them (what, why, who, when, where and how), and ensures to be critical, analytical and creative, he masters the different BI modeling concepts (Kimball, Inmon, Data Vault).



Furthermore, he is able to intervene throughout the decision-making chain (ETL, reporting, support), has a strong expertise in SQL (functions, performance, …), documents the applications for which he is responsible (e.g. user manuals, processes, etc.) and participates in the team's Agile way-of-life.



The Medior-Senior BI Developer has a blast in BI development (80% of development time and 20% of analysis on average), creates complex queries (Microsoft "on premise" environment and/or Microsoft AZURE), inserts data into a DataWarehouse (ETL) in DataVault modeling and creates Data Marts (Microsoft "on premise" and/or Microsoft Azure environment), and is able to test his achievements or those of the other members of the team.



He also creates BI reports in Microsoft PowerBI tools and support the Business at the level of use of Data and of reporting tools in compliance with our client's IT strategy Governance.



Soft skills:



Spirit of synthesis and a good sense of organization
Pro-active
Autonomous
Rigorous
Good communication
Quality of listening
Self-taught





Technical Skills:



Master's or equivalent level of knowledge by experience
Professional experience of minimum 3 years with
Data Modeling and BI Developer
BI Analyst (Business and functional)
Good knowledge of or attraction to Microsoft Azure components (data factory, databricks, etc.)

Azure Analysis services & Azure data factory are an asset



Good knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server
Knowledge of the following reporting tools:
PowerBI as a priority
Good knowledge of GIT





Language skills:



* Dutch/French: Expert



* English: Full professional proficiency







NTT DATA - a part of NTT Group - is a trusted global innovator of IT and business services headquartered in Tokyo. We help clients transform through consulting, industry solutions, business process services, IT modernization and managed services. NTT DATA enables clients, as well as society, to move confidently into the digital future. We are committed to our clients' long-term success and combine global reach with local client attention to serve them in over 50 countries. Visit us at nttdata.com

Title: System Engineer
Description:
As part of the development of one of our clients, we are looking for a system engineer with minimum 3 years’ experience with a good knowledge of network systems and Linux operating systems. This position will require French and Dutch proficiency.

Your Responsibilities:

Your tasks and responsibilities within this multidisciplinary team will be extremely varied, ranging from maintenance, installation and configuration of hardware and software to migration projects to new environments, testing and debugging, hardware and software updates and patches, infrastructure and data security...
You will follow up on incidents, failures and modifications in order to keep the environment operational. As second-line support, you will take turns participating in an on-call service.
As our team strives to work ever more efficiently and "state of the art", you will actively seek out new technologies and tools to achieve this goal. You will contribute to testing, documentation and implementation with a view to adding value to our operations.




Your Profile :

Good knowledge of network systems (Allied Telesis, Fortinet, …)
Good knowledge of Linux operating systems (CentOS – Redhat) including scripting (bash)
Good knowledge of VMware, vSphere, vCenter, vMotion
Must speak / understand Dutch and French
Experience with working in a production environment
Basic knowledge of network administration: router – switch – VPN - firewall

Our Offer :

You will be part of our AKKODIS-family as a permanent placement (or as freelancer) and will enjoy these benefits:

A good salary (based on years of experience) with a lot of extra-legal benefits like: company car, fuel card, meal-vouchers and eco-cheques, groups insurance and hospitalization insurance, 13th month, bonusses, ...
Get a chance to boost your career by participating on different long term projects at big and popular industrial partners.
There will be a Business Manager and HR Business Partner helping you through your career path. A detailed career road map is designed to help you plan the next steps in your career.
Receive a lot of trainings or even given the opportunity to give trainings yourself (while getting payed for it!). You can also be part of our competence club - a chance to network with 1000 other engineers and experts and share ideas and insights about the newest technology.
Get the opportunity to work with a dynamic team of engineers and to get to know them better through fun events such as AKKafés, networking events, scavenger hunts, annual Summer Party.




What about Akkodis :




Akkodis is a global leader in the engineering and R&D market that is leveraging the power of connected data to accelerate innovation and digital transformation.




With a shared passion for technology and talent, 50,000 engineers and digital experts deliver deep cross-sector expertise in 30 countries across North America, EMEA and APAC. Akkodis offers broad industry experience, and strong know-how in key technology sectors such as mobility, software & technology services, robotics, testing, simulations, data security, AI & data analytics. The combined IT and engineering expertise brings a unique end-to-end solution offering, with four service lines – Consulting, Solutions, Talents and Academy – to support clients in rethinking their product development and business processes, improve productivity, minimize time to market and shape a smarter and more sustainable tomorrow.




Akkodis is part of the Adecco Group.

Title: System Engineer
Description:
Als System engineer kom je in een Team terecht bij één van onze klanten waar je verantwoordelijk bent voor het volledig technisch beheren en documenteren van de totale of gedeeltelijke IT infrastructuur. 




Natuurlijk bekijken wij samen met jou welke klanten en opdrachten het beste bij jou passen als persoon en profiel zodat je elke dag met een goed gevoel naar je opdrachtgever vertrekt. 




Of je nu Specialist bent in Linux, UNIX of Windows, je eerder een Virtualization Engineer of Storage Specialist bent, wij bezorgen jou een uitdagend project waar jij al je talent in kwijt kan.

Daarbovenop verzorgen wij voor jou een traject waar jij je talenten nog verder in kan uitbouwen!








Jobgerelateerde competentie

Je hebt een diploma (Bachelor of Master) in de Informatica of gelijkwaardig door ervaring
Je hebt minstens 3 jaar ervaring in de rol van System Engineer
Je hebt diepgaande kennis van Linux, UNIX, Windows en/of andere Microsoft producten
Je hebt kennis van Hypervisors of storage of andere Server technologieën
Je bent analytisch ingesteld en communicatie is één van jouw sterktes
Je bent een gedreven iemand die elke uitdaging aangaat
Toekennen en ter beschikking stellen van software en netwerkinfrastructuur (toewijzing, nieuwe toewijzing)
Prestaties van het informatiesysteem analyseren
Maatregelen voorstellen voor de verbetering van de kwaliteit, de veiligheid en de productiviteit
Toegangsrechten bepalen en opvolgen naargelang de karakteristieken van de gebruikers of de diensten
Storingen, incidenten en onregelmatigheden identificeren
Een diagnose stellen en corrigerende maatregelen toepassen
De technische, economische, … informatie en de reglementering opvolgen en actualiseren
Technische beheerprocedures, gebruiks- en veiligheidsprocedures van de informatica infrastructuur opstellen
Vloeiende kennis van het Nederlands en Engels. Frans is een plus.
Show more Show less

Title: Senior BI Developer
Description:
The Services has an application landscape to manage the complete lifecycle from offer to contract closure for several financial products (leasings, financial renting, etc).







We are looking for a senior developer that helps us



To lead and resolve/execute incoming incidents and changes, hands-on support of day-to-day tasks (deep-dive if needed)
To guide our team towards improvements in collaboration, procedures, compliance (based on an already conducted assessment)

An assessment has been conducted, by a third party, on our environments, covering all below domains (e.g. stakeholder mgmt, demand mgmt, etc.) . Based on the findings of the document



a roadmap needs to be defined to remove impediments and mitigate existing risks
the resource is expected to define a funded reasoning for prioritization lead team resources and take ownership of the actions to be taken
successfully implement prioritized items


Qualifications



DUTCH AND ENGLISH IS MANDATORY



Oracle DB Informatica Powercenter SAP/BO Qliksense (optional
Skills and experience are as follows: fundamental comprehension of all areas of BI/DW from both technical and business perspectives
2 to 3 years of modeling
Exposure to DBA skills and practices
ETL experience Excellent SQL skills
Exposure to 2+ BI platforms and data integration tools
Proven experience in Jira/Confluence?
Proven experience ALL domains covered by our assessment (see diagram





soft skills to



define a target model and take the lead to roll out?
communicate with stakeholders from different backgrounds (IT and business)
report regularly and pro-actively to different stakeholders (mgmt, devops, testers, ...)
be able to identify opportunities and propose action plan based on pro's and con's of different options


Additional Information



Presence: part time physical presence (min 3d/week) on site



ENGLISH IS MANDATORY

Title: Functional /Technical Analyst
Description:
For more than 20 years, BuSI has been offering its clients recognized expertise.

You will certainly be able to evolve and grow within one of our competence centers: Application Development (Java, .Net, NoSQL,....) , Architecture, Analysis, Project Management, Governance.

The services to our clients, mainly active in the public sector but also in the Financial, Services, Energy,... sectors allow us to offer our consultants beautiful long-term assignments, on strategic and public utility projects with a lot of visibility.

Every day, 250 consultants contribute to BuSI's success. The potential of each one is at the heart of our activities and projects.







Context

As our teams are growing fast and strong, we are looking for Functional/Technical Analysts. Whether you're looking for an employee or freelance contract, we want you!







Your responsibilities

Your responsibilities as a Functional/Technical Analyst (employee or freelance) are

Translating customer/business needs into detailed functional analyses
Monitoring of technical analysts and developers
Estimate of the workload required to achieve functionality in collaboration with other stakeholders
Review and analysis of "requests for change".
Analysis of the impact of proposed solutions
Description of test scenarios, preparation of test data and organization of test execution in close cooperation with the Test Coordinator.
Documentation







Your required skills and knowledge

Minimum 3 years of experience as a Functional/Technical Analyst
Previous experience as a developer is welcome
Strong knowledge of UML
Experience in O.O. development (Java or .NET environment)
Knowledge of
Scrum/Agile
WebServices REST, SOAP, Open API
XSD, XML, YAML, XSLT, XPATH, XQUERY
SQL (queries,..)
Jira, Confluence
Waterfall methodology (Prince2, PMI,...) is a plus
BPMN is a plus
Work permit in Belgium
Mandatory: Languages: French and Dutch (at least a very good understanding of the second language) and English







Your profile

Customer-oriented;
Proactive;
Planning and organizational skills;
Communication skills ;
Listening skills;
Sense of responsibility;
Open-minded with a team spirit.




We offer you

As an employee, we offer an open-ended contract with a competitive salary (an IP ruling / copyright bringing a very interesting net salary)
And a wide range of extra-legal benefits:
A company car or the equivalent in salary
Telephone, internet, meal expenses
Laptop
20 legal days off + 12 days of RTT per year (working hours of 40 hours/week)
Group and hospitalization insurance
Busi strives to offer working conditions that allow a good work-life balance. Most assignments can be done partially remotely.
In addition, we give you the space you need to develop as a true expert in your field. The world of tools and technologies changes rapidly and you stay up-to-date.
Access to online platforms for trainings
This job advertisement is also aimed at freelancers

Title: Junior Tandem System Engineer
Description:
Division: GTS (Group Technology Services)

Role

As Junior Tandem System Engineer you will progressively:


Ensure HP Non-Stop Tandem platform is successfully integrated and operated within the company’s business environment.
Participate in, support and manage the deployment of applications within test, pre-production and production environments.
Provide second and third level support to Production Operations as well as to internal and external Business.
Installation and testing of new release / products like IBM MQ, Phyton, NonStop Webserver, Batch definition.
NonStop Security management.
Database (SQL/MP and SQL/MX) management.
Storage management.
System / Application performance analysis.
NonStop Network management.


Please note this role is based in Brussels or London and include Watch Duty On Call support outside business hours from 18:00 till 8:00, assigned on a rotational basis.

Required skills

You have:


A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a Master's degree in Mathematics, Civil Engineering or equivalent (preferred).
Basic knowledge of System Administration and Network (preferred).
Programming language skill.
Ideally a first job/traineeship experience in IT.


You are:


Fluent in English
Able to demonstrate your ability to learn ICT technologies.
Able to easily adapt to new circumstances / technologies / procedures.
Stress resistant and constructive whatever the context.
Able to comply with existing standards and acting with attention to detail
A true team player who demonstrates good interpersonal skills.
Able to summarize complex technical situations in simple terms.
Solution and client oriented.


Strong communication skills, a positive attitude, and a competitive, but team-oriented focus are key elements to be successful in this challenging environment.

What we offer


An excellent opportunity to practice and develop your talents in a highly professional international environment.
Working closely with inspiring, supportive and engaged colleagues from 80+ different countries, interacting with many stakeholders at all levels across the organization.
A learning and development focused environment with an emphasis on knowledge sharing, training, and reskilling.
We’re agile, we’re growing and so will you!
Show more Show less

  • Ensure HP Non-Stop Tandem platform is successfully integrated and operated within the company’s business environment.
  • Participate in, support and manage the deployment of applications within test, pre-production and production environments.
  • Provide second and third level support to Production Operations as well as to internal and external Business.
  • Installation and testing of new release / products like IBM MQ, Phyton, NonStop Webserver, Batch definition.
  • NonStop Security management.
  • Database (SQL/MP and SQL/MX) management.
  • Storage management.
  • System / Application performance analysis.
  • NonStop Network management.


Please note this role is based in Brussels or London and include Watch Duty On Call support outside business hours from 18:00 till 8:00, assigned on a rotational basis.

Required skills

You have:

  • A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a Master's degree in Mathematics, Civil Engineering or equivalent (preferred).
  • Basic knowledge of System Administration and Network (preferred).
  • Programming language skill.
  • Ideally a first job/traineeship experience in IT.


You are:

  • Fluent in English
  • Able to demonstrate your ability to learn ICT technologies.
  • Able to easily adapt to new circumstances / technologies / procedures.
  • Stress resistant and constructive whatever the context.
  • Able to comply with existing standards and acting with attention to detail
  • A true team player who demonstrates good interpersonal skills.
  • Able to summarize complex technical situations in simple terms.
  • Solution and client oriented.


Strong communication skills, a positive attitude, and a competitive, but team-oriented focus are key elements to be successful in this challenging environment.

What we offer
  • An excellent opportunity to practice and develop your talents in a highly professional international environment.
  • Working closely with inspiring, supportive and engaged colleagues from 80+ different countries, interacting with many stakeholders at all levels across the organization.
  • A learning and development focused environment with an emphasis on knowledge sharing, training, and reskilling.
  • We’re agile, we’re growing and so will you!

Title: Senior Data Engineer
Description:
One of my Key client, an international Financial Services brand work, that produce tailored solutions for customers in a fast moving market. Now they are looking for a Senior Data engineer to join their well-established data analytics teams on a very long term project. They value professionals input and do a lot for a great working culture!




Must have:

Azure Data Factory
Spark
Hadoop
Data Lake
Data Visualisation tools




Nice to have:

Extensive Hadoop Experience
Python







They currently use Azure for storage and pipelines but they have plans to move to a more cloud based environment in the next year, so lots of room for growth and development!




If you are interested in learning more about this opportunity, please apply directly or email to pia@interex-group.com.

Title: Business Intelligence Data Engineer (m/f/d) - remote in Europe
Description:
Would you like to work in an energizing and entrepreneurial environment where you will face new challenges each day? If you have an inspiring, committed and personable personality and you are passionate about learning and innovating how to deliver insights through large-scale data sets – then get in touch and become our new Business Intelligence Data Engineer! Be part of our committed BI-Team and apply your combination of intuition for business data and technical knowledge.




YOUR FIELD OF ACTIVITY.




Deliver and maintain ELT data pipelines with multiple data sources including APIs, databases,
Find creative solutions for a variety of data challenges facing our fast-growing data and business requirements,
Build processes and standards that build trust with data and provide consistent metrics across the organization,
Participate in decision-making meetings and project brainstorming with management.




ABOUT YOU




You have an open-minded, hands-on and self-organized attitude that is positive, enthusiastic and empathetic and fits to our self-conception,
You represent good problem-solving abilities and communication skills,
You have fluent English and strong communication skills,
You are self-motivated to keep up with the latest data engineering trends and tools,
You have excellent knowledge and hands-on experience with SQL and delivering data engineering projects,
You are experienced with Python code,Microsoft SQL Server and SQL Server Management Studio,
You have knowledge in working with REST and SOAP API,
You have knowledge of data modeling and experience with tools such as DBT, and/or Infrastructure-as-Code tools like Terraform,
You are familiar with cloud data-warehouse design, architecture and operations such as Bigquery,
You are experienced in building and delivering data systems in cloud platforms such as GCP.
Experience with DataOps, CI/CD, orchestration for data related projects,







WHAT WE OFFER.




Fridays off until 2023 as we experiment with a four-day week. Help us build the future of work where all of us to have more time to take care of our health and well-being!
Flexible trust working hours in a remote work environment, which we equip with state-of-the-art hardware ( MacBook or Lenovo), monitors, height-adjustable desks / portable solutions and ergonomic chairs
Your personal budget for remote office set-up
Co-Working Access,
Participation in an exciting and healthy growing company that offers you a lot of room for your personal development and your own impulses and ideas,
Transparent decision-making processes with our three founders as well as leads with a distinct start-up mentality,
Regular (virtual) team events for exchange and brainstorming, but also informal "e-get-togethers" to maintain contacts,
Memorable regional events, meaningful multi-day events, etc.
Generous time off policy - six weeks of PTO + bank holidays, volunteer days, and more!




HOW TO APPLY?




You find yourself in many points and think that we should talk? Then simply upload your CV, with details of your earliest possible start date and a rough salary range.Someone from the People & Culture Team is looking forward to getting to know you!

Title: Senior Data Engineer
Description:
Who are we?

Fednot is the Federation of Belgian Notaries. Our mission is to support the +1100 notary offices and the ~8.000 notary's employees with legal expertise, management advise, IT solutions, training and information for the general public, etc.

Fednot also develops and delivers software solutions and services to support the digital transformation process of the notary offices. The solutions covers all notary domains (real estate, enterprise, family, etc.) and are based on state-of-the art technologies.




Do you have a passion for what you do, do you go for commitment, think and act in a flexible way, and want to contribute to the success of our company? Then this could be your next step.




Senior Data Engineer (m/w/x)

(Permanent Position, Hybrid, Full-time, Brussels & Homeworking)




Fednot is looking for a Senior Data Engineer (Cloud) who will work in an agile team.

The Senior Data engineer helps make data more useful and accessible for consumers of data. To do so, the Senior Data Engineer must source, transform and analyze data from each system.




Your challenges

Designing and implementing evolution in Data lake and Datamart;
Designing and implementing evolution in batch and streaming data pipelines;
Development and testing of ETL code in various programming and scripting languages;
Exploring, visualizing and analyzing data;
Translating insights into reports and presentations.




Your profile

A Bachelor or equivalent level acquired through experience;
An experience of minimum 5 years in a similar IT-related job;
Fluent in either French or Dutch;
Fluent in IT related English;
A good communicator with internal and external contacts;
Knowledge of agile methodology.




Technical skills

Experience in

Java ( required)
SQL (required)
Python (added value)
Apache Kafka and Spark (added value)
Cloud projects (gcp, aws, azure) (added value)
Jira/Maven/Git/Docker/CICD tools (added value)




What we offer

A variety of challenging and interesting projects to work on, within a growing and economically stable sector;
Room for professional growth, the possibility to develop creativity and autonomy, an open atmosphere;
A competitive salary package, additional benefits (perquisite), insurance coverage, public transport, luncheon vouchers, a bonus system, the possibility to accrue additional leave, …
A good work-life balance with flexible timetables and telework.

Where are you going to work?

1000 Brussels & home office (hybrid! 40% at the office, 60% home)

Interested? Please apply before February 28th, 2023




If you apply with us, your CV and motivation letter, which include identification details, details related to the profession and academic curriculum, will be kept in our database for 3 years for reasons of justified interest (e.g. contacting us for a new job). These data will not be exchanged with third parties, unless there is a legal obligation to do so. You can always exercise all rights included in the GDPR in particular, right to access and information, right to data erasure, right to limitation of processing, right to rectification, right to objection and right to lodge a complaint with the supervising authority, by contacting info@privanot.be. We ensure that all your personal data are treated in accordance with the applicable privacy legislation.

Title: System Engineer
Description:
Werkgever details




Onze klant is een Service Provider gevestigd in de regio Heverlee. Ze vertegenwoordigen een nieuwe methode voor het aanschaffen van tools en processen voor netwerk- en systeembeheer. Omdat onze klant voortdurend in ontwikkeling is, hebben ze hun serviceportfolio uitgebreid naar Operations-automatisering en Azure Platform Ops.




Functieomschrijving




Onze klant gebruikt open source en scripttalen en tools voor hun ontwikkeling. Het grootste deel van de ontwikkeling gebeurt in Python, maar ze werken ook met andere talen zoals Java, Rust,… Je taken zijn

Automatisering van de monitoringoplossing
Analyse van de integraties tussen tools (Monitoring en Service Desk), GUI-integraties …
Ontwikkeling van de monitoring parameters, integraties tussen tools, GUI integraties …
Verbeteringen maken voor de monitoring infrastructuur
Technische documentatie schrijven/bijwerken over de implementatie van de monitoring ontwikkelingen
Automatiseringsscripts schrijven

Vereiste ervaring




Vloeiende Nederlands
Kennis van Linux
Basiskennis MySQL of MariaDB
Ervaring met Git,
Scripting en programmeer ervaring met Python of Rust of Java of Powershell …
Basisvaardigheden technisch schrijven




Aanbod

3 dagen thuiswerk mogelijk
Competitief salaris
Mobiliteitspakket of bedrijfswagen
Extralegale voordelen
Leermogelijkheden
Mooie omgeving
Klein team

Title: Big Data Developer
Description:
About TCS

Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is a global leader in IT services, digital, and business solutions that partners with its clients to simplify, strengthen and transform their businesses. We ensure the highest levels of certainty and satisfaction through a deep-set commitment to our clients, comprehensive industry expertise, and a global network of innovation and delivery centers.

TCS established its presence in Belgium in 1992 and works with leading Belgian organizations, including several BEL20 companies. TCS has been ranked #1 in customer satisfaction, among IT services providers in Belgium and Luxembourg in a survey by Whitelane Research and is recognized as a Top Employer in Belgium by the Top Employers Institute. For more information, visit us at www.tcs.com




Job Description:

Big data engineers interact with massive data processing systems and databases in large-scale computing environments.
They sort through the sweeping data to find relevant sets for analysis, which organizations then use to predict behavior.




Key Skills/Knowledge

should have experienced and practical knowledge of Scala, Java, Kafka, Flink
hands-on experience in big data stack like Hortonworks and technologies/languages like Hive, Python, ...
Profound knowledge of SQL (writing complex SQL queries, performance-tuning)
Knowledge of DWH data modelling (i.e. Kimball or Inman, datavault)




Preferable:

Knowing and experienced DEVOPS-practices.
Experience with working in a complex organization
Specific requirement for agile: practical experience with Scrum




Soft Skills:

Good analytical and problem-solving skills.
Quick self-starter, pro-active attitude
Team player always ready to share, train or provide support to others.
Autonomy, commitment and perseverance · Flexible, accurate & control minded.
Ability to work in a dynamic and multi-cultural environment
Ability to deliver results respecting deadlines




Education: Bachelor/Master or equivalent by experience.




Diversity, Inclusion & Wellbeing

At TCS, we believe in building and sustaining a culture of equity and belonging where everyone can thrive. Our diversity motto is ‘Inclusion without Exception’. We encourage applications from all sections of society. As an equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate on grounds of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, sex, pregnancy and maternity, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, gender identity, or any other basis as protected by applicable law. TCS is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to its employees and applicants for employment to ensure that individuals with disabilities enjoy equal access to all employment opportunities.




Privacy Note:https://ibegin.tcs.com/iBegin/privacy-notice

Title: Industrial IT Engineer (MES)
Description:
Are you passionate about technology and highly interested in software architecture? Are you eager to be working on large scale projects for a major player in the industry?




Keep reading, we are working several MES projects that would be perfect for you!




As an MES Engineer, you will re-enforce the team responsible to develop Manufacturing Execution System (MES) solutions.

You will be responsible for the initial analysis, solution design, on-site application and technical support of MES implementations. An MES Engineer’s responsibilities also include system monitoring, troubleshooting, problem resolution, development and change management. The position requires strong project management skills and coordination with the customer, as well as with a global support team.




You have degree in Engineering/Computer Science/Integrated Manufacturing disciplines
You have experience in the Industrial Automation or Information Technology industry is a solid plus
You have experience in database management and querying methods: Oracle/MS SQL Database.
Experience in a technical design & delivery environment
You have knowledge of programming languages like .NET, HTML, Java or XML
You want to work in an international/multi-cultural environment, and you have strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Your English is excellent, and a good knowledge of French or Dutch is a plus.




What's in it for you as an employee?

At Adiutum, we put our company at the service of our consultants by following three objectives: well-being, training and development.

We provide an experience that is focused on professional fulfilment because our goal is to build long-term relationships with our consultants. This is why we offer all our employees contractual stability, competitive salary package along with extra-legal advantages, personalised career guidance as well as monitoring, training and continuous development opportunities adapted to each individual. We also offer great intellectual flexibility in terms of activity sectors, assignments and technologies, helping you build a stable and rewarding career that meets your goals.

Title: Senior Analyst, Analytics & Insights
Description:
We're transforming the grocery industry

At Instacart, we invite the world to share love through food because we believe everyone should have access to the food they love and more time to enjoy it together. Where others see a simple need for grocery delivery, we see exciting complexity and endless opportunity to serve the varied needs of our community. We work to deliver an essential service that customers rely on to get their groceries and household goods, while also offering safe and flexible earnings opportunities to Instacart Personal Shoppers.

Instacart has become a lifeline for millions of people, and we’re building the team to help push our shopping cart forward. If you’re ready to do the best work of your life, come join our table.

Instacart is a Flex First team

There’s no one-size fits all approach to how we do our best work. Our employees have the flexibility to choose where they do their best work—whether it’s from home, an office, or your favorite coffee shop—while staying connected and building community through regular in-person events. Learn more about our flexible approach to where we work.

Overview

Instacart’s Analytics & Insights Team sits within Business Development, at the intersection of Instacart’s unparalleled grocery industry data and our most important grocery retail partners. Our grocery partnerships are at the core of our business, and this role is focused on leveraging data and analytics to influence business decision making, understand customer behavior, and drive growth of key company goals.

This Senior Analyst will strive to understand the dynamics of the marketplace through descriptive analysis, supporting the team in tackling ambiguous problems using data, and providing the both internal and external teams with the tools to answer “how did the business perform?” and “why did it perform that way?” You will be a subject matter expert on Instacart’s data and tools in order to efficiently answer key business questions and build sustainable solutions to enable stakeholders to progressively answer more and more of these questions on their own.

About The Job

Support Instacart’s largest retail partners in helping them make data-driven decisions
Work closely with internal and external stakeholders to understand their business and develop analysis, dashboards, and reporting to address their needs
Support internal teams with data that will help them best serve their accounts and strengthen the partnership across several key areas:
Identify opportunities for optimization and growth through the analysis of performance relative to peer benchmarks
Develop data-driven business cases to help expand Instacart’s retail partnerships
Monitor operational performance to ensure consistently excellent service for Instacart’s end customers
Help prepare for weekly, monthly and quarterly business reviews
Become a subject matter expert in Instacart’s data and tools:
Immerse yourself in Instacart’s vast database and extract relevant datasets using SQL
Develop low-touch, self-serve reporting for both internal and external teams
Understand the data needs of both internal and external teams and, where appropriate, get those requirements on the roadmap for the scalable solutions being developed by other people on our team

About You

3+ years work experience in a quantitative role. This is a great opportunity for those with experience in Consulting, Banking, Analytics, or similar roles. Experience with retail and e-commerce is a plus
Advanced SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools experience required
Flexible and adaptable; collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to understand their goals and tailor your approach accordingly
Resourceful; ability to find answers to tough questions (especially data-related) by tracking down the right data and stakeholders
Thinking sustainably and building for scale; develop long-term solutions to recurring problems
Strong analytical skills; ability to logically break down complex problems and identify potential pitfalls
Ability to effectively manage multiple key stakeholder relationships, both internal and external, and provide guidance on more efficient approaches as needed

Accommodations & Accessibility

At Instacart, we strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you need assistance submitting an application through our career site due to a disability, please submit an Accommodations Request Form and someone from our team will reach out soon to see how we may be able to assist.

Where others see a simple need for grocery delivery, we see exciting complexity and endless opportunity to serve the varied needs of our community. We work to deliver an essential service that customers rely on to get their groceries and household goods, while also offering safe and flexible earnings opportunities to Instacart Personal Shoppers.

Instacart has become a lifeline for millions of people, and we’re building the team to help push our shopping cart forward. If you’re ready to do the best work of your life, come join our table.

Instacart is a Flex First team

There’s no one-size fits all approach to how we do our best work. Our employees have the flexibility to choose where they do their best work—whether it’s from home, an office, or your favorite coffee shop—while staying connected and building community through regular in-person events. Learn more about our flexible approach to where we work.

Overview

Instacart’s Analytics & Insights Team sits within Business Development, at the intersection of Instacart’s unparalleled grocery industry data and our most important grocery retail partners. Our grocery partnerships are at the core of our business, and this role is focused on leveraging data and analytics to influence business decision making, understand customer behavior, and drive growth of key company goals.

This Senior Analyst will strive to understand the dynamics of the marketplace through descriptive analysis, supporting the team in tackling ambiguous problems using data, and providing the both internal and external teams with the tools to answer “how did the business perform?” and “why did it perform that way?” You will be a subject matter expert on Instacart’s data and tools in order to efficiently answer key business questions and build sustainable solutions to enable stakeholders to progressively answer more and more of these questions on their own.

About The Job
  • Support Instacart’s largest retail partners in helping them make data-driven decisions
  • Work closely with internal and external stakeholders to understand their business and develop analysis, dashboards, and reporting to address their needs
  • Support internal teams with data that will help them best serve their accounts and strengthen the partnership across several key areas:
    • Identify opportunities for optimization and growth through the analysis of performance relative to peer benchmarks
    • Develop data-driven business cases to help expand Instacart’s retail partnerships
    • Monitor operational performance to ensure consistently excellent service for Instacart’s end customers
    • Help prepare for weekly, monthly and quarterly business reviews
  • Become a subject matter expert in Instacart’s data and tools:
    • Immerse yourself in Instacart’s vast database and extract relevant datasets using SQL
    • Develop low-touch, self-serve reporting for both internal and external teams
  • Understand the data needs of both internal and external teams and, where appropriate, get those requirements on the roadmap for the scalable solutions being developed by other people on our team
About You
  • 3+ years work experience in a quantitative role. This is a great opportunity for those with experience in Consulting, Banking, Analytics, or similar roles. Experience with retail and e-commerce is a plus
  • Advanced SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools experience required
  • Flexible and adaptable; collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to understand their goals and tailor your approach accordingly
  • Resourceful; ability to find answers to tough questions (especially data-related) by tracking down the right data and stakeholders
  • Thinking sustainably and building for scale; develop long-term solutions to recurring problems
  • Strong analytical skills; ability to logically break down complex problems and identify potential pitfalls
  • Ability to effectively manage multiple key stakeholder relationships, both internal and external, and provide guidance on more efficient approaches as needed
Accommodations & Accessibility

At Instacart, we strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you need assistance submitting an application through our career site due to a disability, please submit an Accommodations Request Form and someone from our team will reach out soon to see how we may be able to assist.

Title: Senior Analyst, Business Intelligence
Description:
We're transforming the grocery industry

At Instacart, we invite the world to share love through food because we believe everyone should have access to the food they love and more time to enjoy it together. Where others see a simple need for grocery delivery, we see exciting complexity and endless opportunity to serve the varied needs of our community. We work to deliver an essential service that customers rely on to get their groceries and household goods, while also offering safe and flexible earnings opportunities to Instacart Personal Shoppers.

Instacart has become a lifeline for millions of people, and we’re building the team to help push our shopping cart forward. If you’re ready to do the best work of your life, come join our table.

Instacart is a Flex First team

There’s no one-size fits all approach to how we do our best work. Our employees have the flexibility to choose where they do their best work—whether it’s from home, an office, or your favorite coffee shop—while staying connected and building community through regular in-person events. Learn more about our flexible approach to where we work.

Overview

Instacart’s Analytics & Insights Team sits within Business Development, at the intersection of Instacart’s rich grocery industry data and our grocery retail partners. Our grocery partnerships are at the core of Instacart’s business model, and our retail partners' success is of paramount importance to us. This role is focused on building industry leading market intelligence reporting and analytics to help Instacart and its retail partners make better strategic and tactical business decisions. This is a highly impactful role that will engage in building solutions with visibility to the Instacart Executive team as well as to leading largest North American retailers.

As this Senior Analyst you will be responsible for a wide range of tasks such as defining data requirements, running descriptive analysis, designing and building dashboards, and preparing in-depth “so-what” analysis and business recommendations. You will be able to build high-level and scalable solutions as well as have the ability to dive deeper into the data to uncover actionable insights.

About The Job

Serve as a Subject Matter Expert on the grocery e-commerce industry, developing market intelligence reports by leveraging internal and 3rd party data
Be responsible for the development, maintenance, and documentation of market intelligence metrics, including the understanding and structuring of 3rd party data, creation of new data models and analytics layers, and construction of complex yet concise dashboards
Work closely with cross-functional teams to contribute to the development of periodic market intelligence reports by providing relevant and compelling insights on market and competitive trends
Work closely with the Business Development team to understand their requirements and create compelling visual dashboards, reports, and presentations
Lead data investigations to better understand retailer performance in relation to market trends
Adhere to best practices in reporting and analysis, including data integrity, analysis, validation, and documentation

About You

3+ years of experience in an analytics and business intelligence role
Strong analytical skills and ability to leverage data to identify trends and influence business decisions
Advanced proficiency in SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools, particularly Tableau
Ability to quickly respond to problems independently, consider all stakeholder needs, and provide clear, concise answers to complex data
Excellent communication skills and ability to manage multiple stakeholder groups
Experience with dbt or other data transformation tools is a plus
Bachelor's degree or equivalent is required

Accommodations & Accessibility

At Instacart, we strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you need assistance submitting an application through our career site due to a disability, please submit an Accommodations Request Form and someone from our team will reach out soon to see how we may be able to assist.

Title: Staff Cloud Developer
Description:
At Kinaxis, who we are is grounded in our common belief that people matter. Each one of us plays an important part in accomplishing our work, building our culture and making a global impact.

Every day, we’re empowered to work together to help our customers make fast, confident planning decisions. This is how we create a better planet – for each other, for our customers and for generations to come. Our cloud-based platform RapidResponse ensures that the products we need – everything from medicine and cars, to day-to-day items like toothpaste – make it to market and into our hands when we need them with minimal ecological footprint.

We make the world better, and you can too.

Staff Cloud Developer, Platform Engineering

Job location: Ottawa-Hybrid, Other Canadian locations- Remote

Additional requirements: Candidates must meet Controlled Goods Program Requirements.

About The Team

Imperative Orchestration, Declarative Automation - The Platform Engineering Team is responsible for building and running a cloud platform that enables delivery teams to self-service deployments with reduced lead time and complexity. We also provide cloud services and tools that enable internal development teams to build, test and deploy their applications using modern platform tooling like Git CI/CD pipelines, Terraform and Kubernetes delivery via ArgoCD. These same tools we leverage to ensure our customer environments are automated and continuously up to date. We are passionate about code and the power of automation to simplify complex processes.

As a Staff Cloud Developer in platform engineering, you will be a part of our team that provides the infrastructure, core capabilities and expertise to enable our product teams to deliver at pace and build a platform for hosting Kinaxis SaaS offerings. We have a strong engineering culture, focused on steady, correct delivery, with a cloud-first approach. We are rapidly growing, supercharging the team that powers our developer & application platform.

What You Will Do

Apply software engineering principles to application and operations challenges with a focus on automation and self-healing.
Collaborate with teams across the enterprise to uncover pain points and formulate ways to accelerate delivery.
Adopt existing Reference Architectures and their implementations; contribute to the design of new Reference Architectures.
Deliver cloud reference architectures to be used by teams across the enterprise as they work to modernize existing technologies and build new capabilities to deliver to Customers.
Provide an exceptional experience to our development and operations teams, with a focus on self-service using modern approaches.
Investigate new system solutions to enhance application delivery experiences through innovative experiments or Proof of Concept.
Build and manage, stable & secure cloud automation using cloud orchestration capabilities, scripting languages and APIs to design, code, test, implement and support Infrastructure as Code (IaC).
Lead team members in achieving professional excellence utilizing industry best practices.
Advise and maintain a feedback loop with development and operations teams to ensure deliveries are in accordance with needs and expectations.
Function as a go-to tech lead for pinpointing challenges and finding creative solutions.
Prioritize projects/tasks according to company needs and expectations.
Lead team code reviews and design reviews.

What We Are Looking For

Bachelor’s/Master's degree in Engineering with specialization in Computer Science or related discipline or demonstrated equivalent experience.
8 years of experience with architecture and deployment of Cloud Services.
5 years of experience with Infrastructure and Platform engineering for high availability and scalable architectures in the cloud.
5 years of experience with public cloud platforms (both console and API) like GCP, Azure or AWS
Strong knowledge of system design to manage operational and reliability trade-offs.
Extensive experience developing in Go, Python and Shell/Bash.
Proven practical experience in building and managing:
Infrastructure as Code (Terraform)
Configuration management tools (Ansible)
CI/CD solutions (Git, GitOps, Argo CD)
Containers and orchestrators (Docker, Kubernetes, Helm)
System monitoring and centralized logging platforms (Datadog, Prometheus, ELK)
Practical understanding of agile methodologies and Scrum.
Ability to share knowledge with others in the company.
In-depth and proactive communication and documentation skills.
Initiative and ability to work independently, and as part of a team.
Ability to use a wide variety of open-source technologies.

What we have to offer

Challenging Work - We love solving highly complex problems. And as the global leaders in our industry, we never stop innovating—our work is never “done. That’s because across our teams and in all roles, every employee is empowered to bring their best ideas forward and to jump in and solve the problems they’re passionate about.
Great People - We take our work seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously! It’s in our DNA to celebrate, laugh, and have fun. We are stronger, together, when we are open, honest, and above all, real. Every person is valued here and plays an important role in our shared success.
Global Impact - As a global team spanning continents, boundaries, and cultures, every day we are inspired by the impact our work has on our colleagues, our customers, our communities, and the world at large.
Diversity, Equity and Inclusion - Diversity, equity and inclusion are more than words to us. They are the guiding principles for building a culture where we celebrate each others’ differences, continuously strive for equality and recognize that inclusion makes us stronger as individuals, a company and a global citizen.

For more information, visit the Kinaxis web site at www.kinaxis.com or the company’s blog at http://blog.kinaxis.com/ .

Kinaxis strongly encourages diverse candidates to apply to our welcoming community. We strive to make our website and application process accessible to any and all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact Human Resources at accommodations@kinaxis.com . This contact information is for accessibility requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.

  • Practical understanding of agile methodologies and Scrum.

  • Great People - We take our work seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously! It’s in our DNA to celebrate, laugh, and have fun. We are stronger, together, when we are open, honest, and above all, real. Every person is valued here and plays an important role in our shared success.
  • Global Impact - As a global team spanning continents, boundaries, and cultures, every day we are inspired by the impact our work has on our colleagues, our customers, our communities, and the world at large.
  • Diversity, Equity and Inclusion - Diversity, equity and inclusion are more than words to us. They are the guiding principles for building a culture where we celebrate each others’ differences, continuously strive for equality and recognize that inclusion makes us stronger as individuals, a company and a global citizen.

Title: Principal Performance Engineer
Description:
Mimecast is looking for an experienced Principal Performance Engineer who will be responsible for working with the Architecture and Engineering teams to deliver performance improvement across our whole platform.




The ideal candidate will be someone who possesses excellent problem-solving skills, and excellent understanding of how complex systems interact, an excellent communicator with a strong continuous improvement mindset.




Objective




Work with fellow architects, engineering leads and product managers to improve the performance, scalability and resilience of Mimecast Cloud-based systems. You will be hands on helping to improve the design, testing and monitoring of our applications and infrastructure.




Requirements




10+ years of Performance Engineering/Testing/Software development; BS/MS or related/comparable
Expertise with Java or similar languages
Experience with Performance Engineering tools – JMeter, LoadRunner, JProfiler, APM etc
Experience of high volume, scalable, distributed systems
Provide vision and leadership enabling teams to own performance engineering in their areas
Ensure that non-functional requirements are well defined and understood by the responsible teams
Design and implement performance & resilience tests across Mimecast services to increase understanding of how our services perform under positive and negative conditions
Excellent verbal and written communication
Document and communicate test results and identify performance & resilience issues
Keep abreast of the latest open-source and commercial tools to provide improved monitoring and testing




Desirable




Experience of rolling out an automated performance test suite across an organization
Experience commercial or open-source chaos testing tools (e.g. Gremlin, ChaosMonkey etc)
Experience with APM/distributed tracing tools, either open-source (e.g. Jaeger) or commercial (e.g. Dynatrace/Datadog)
Working with PostgreSQL, Redis, or similar
Detailed knowledge of TLS, TCP/IP, SMTP
Experience with container/orchestration technology




Character




Hands-on problem solving with a willingness to do whatever it takes to complete an objective
The ability to identify when to escalate or look for help on an issue
The drive and confidence to own a task from start to finish
The discipline to manage their own time and priorities, without the need for micro-management
The flexibility to adapt to a constantly changing landscape
A passion for technology beyond what is required to perform their daily tasks




Why Mimecast?




We’re fast thinking. We go big to reach our cyberattack-disrupting goals. And we do what we need to protect the world of business from getting important (and potentially compromising) data stolen. We never leave anyone behind. We deliver quickly – and outstandingly. We’re big on honesty because it makes us better. We’re empowered by our mission. And if cybercriminals have a good day, we work twice as hard to make the rest of their days a nightmare. That’s The Mimecast Way.




And the Mimecast way is also a hybrid-working way. We empower our people to balance their time between home and the office in a way that works best for them, their team, and our stakeholders.




Become a Mimecaster and put corporate data under your protection. Fill our teams with respect. And bring cybercrime-obstructing energy to your work. Be passionate. Be powerful. Be alive with purpose.




DEI Statement




Cybersecurity is a community effort. That’s why we’re committed to building an inclusive, diverse community that celebrates and welcomes everyone – unless they’re a cybercriminal, of course.




We’re proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer, and we’d encourage you to join us whatever your background. We particularly welcome applicants from traditionally underrepresented groups.




We consider everyone equally: your race, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, ability, marital status, nationality, or any other protected characteristic won’t affect your application.




Due to certain obligations to our customers, an offer of employment will be subject to your successful completion of applicable background checks, conducted in accordance with local law.




In an effort to protect the health and resilience of our global community, Mimecast requires all individuals to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 and/or receive a negative test before entry into our offices.
