Title: Werkstudent Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
VINOS steht für die Welt der spanischen Weine. Wein ist für uns mehr als ein Produkt - Wein ist für uns Leidenschaft - und das mittlerweile seit 25 Jahren. Im Bereich E-Commerce und in unseren 9 Filialen haben wir uns durch unsere Expertise und unseren umfassenden Service einen Namen gemacht. Wir sind "der" Fachhändler für spanische Weine und immer wieder auf der Suche nach neuen spanischen Geheimtipps.

Was uns ausmacht? Wir sind ein kreatives und dynamisches Team mit Sitz im Herzen von Berlin-Charlottenburg, das aus über 180 weinverrückten Kolleginnen und Kollegen besteht.

Was wir teilen? Die Begeisterung für unseren Job und die Freude, unseren Kundinnen und Kunden das Beste aus der spanischen Weinwelt zu bieten.

Wir suchen ab sofort einen Werkstudenten (m/w/d) im Bereich Datenanalyse.

Aufgaben

Du führst statistische Analysen durch, um strategische Fragestellungen zu beantworten
Dafür wertest Dualle relevanten Daten aus und erstellst verschiedene Reports für unterschiedliche Abteilungen und für die Geschäftsführung
Die Ergebnisse bereitest Du zur Präsentation auf und interpretierst sie zielgerichtet
Du unterstützt bei der Optimierung und Automatisierung wiederkehrender Prozesse

Profil

Du bist Student (m/w/d) der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, (Wirtschafts-)Mathematik, Statistik oder Betriebswirtschaft mit Schwerpunkt im Bereich Datenbanken, Data Science oder eines vergleichbaren Studienfachs
Du hast sehr gute Kenntnisse im Umgang mit Excel
Erfahrungen mit PowerBI, Tableau o.ä. BI-Tools sind von Vorteil
Idealerweise hast Du bereits Kenntnisse in Statistik, Data Mining oder Datenbanken und bringst Erfahrungen im Bereich Datenanalysen mit
Wichtig ist uns ein ausgeprägtes strategisches, analytisches und konzeptionelles Denkvermögen
Außerdem erwarten wir eine eigenverantwortliche und strukturierte, zuverlässige Arbeitsweise
Du verfügst über sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift

Wir bieten

Eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten mit individuellen Gestaltungsmöglichkeiten
Ein kreatives Arbeitsumfeld über den Dächern von Berlin-Charlottenburg
Flache Hierarchien und kurze Entscheidungswege
Eine offene Unternehmenskultur mit Teamevents und spannenden Weinerlebnissen
Flexible Arbeitszeiten und Mobile Office
Eine Gratisflasche Wein mit jeder Gehaltsabrechnung und viele weitere Benefits
Dein Hund ist bei uns willkommen
Show more Show less

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Wir sind die Positive Thinking Company. Wir suchen die Talente von Morgen, zur Verstärkung unserer Expert:innen. Schließ dich uns an, entfalte Deine Fähigkeiten und Talente und stecke unsere Community mit Deiner Begeisterung und Deinen Ideen an.

Was uns wichtig ist? - Die 3 W’s: Wissensaustausch, Weiterbildungen und Weiterentwicklung.

Interessiert? Dann wird’s jetzt spannend: Wir sind auf einer großartigen Reise, um die Welt täglich ein Stück zu verbessern. Zusammen mit unseren großartigen Positive Thinkern stellen wir uns jeder Herausforderung auf diesem Weg mit Kreativität und Entschlossenheit. Die Projekte, die wir angehen, und die Aufgaben, die wir lösen, sind Gelegenheiten, sich weiterzuentwickeln, Neues zu lernen und unsere Zusammenarbeit zu stärken. Bist du bereit, über dich hinauszuwachsen? Dann werde Teil unserer Story!

Aufgaben

Deine Leidenschaft

Analyse fachlicher Anforderungen und Ableitungen analytischer Zielsetzungen für Kunden
Zusammenhänge komplexer Geschäftsdaten erzeugen und diese in performanten Reports visualisieren
Self-Service Datenanalysen gestalten sowie die Datenvorverarbeitung
Konsolidierung von Daten zur Ableitung angemessener Handlungsempfehlungen


Dieses Wissen bietet unseren Kund:innen echten Mehrwert. Du bist das Bindeglied zwischen IT und Business. Du konzipierst. Du realisierst. Du treibst voran.

Qualifikation

Dein Talent

Deutsch-Kenntnisse auf C1 Niveau - Beherrschung der Sprache (German Fluency is a must)
Masterabschluss, vorzugsweise in (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen oder einer vergleichbaren Studienrichtung
Ca. 3 Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich Data Analytics
Technologieerfahrung: Tableau, Qlik, Power BI, Cognos BI, Tools wie Alteryx oder Yellowfin
Erfahrung in R Shiny, KNIME oder Visual Analytics ist von Vorteil
Reisebereitschaft innerhalb der DACH Region


Benefits

Wir bieten Dir eine Kultur, die von unseren Führungsleitsätzen angetrieben wird: Unternehmerisch, ergebnisorientiert, Eigenverantwortung fördernd und sich gegenseitig zum

Erfolg verhelfend. Wir schaffen Transparenz über Unternehmensziele, Zusammenarbeit und Unterstützung durch ein internationales Team auf Augenhöhe. Wir leben Austausch, Teamgeist und einen respektvollen Umgang miteinander. Das verbindet uns hierarchieübergreifend – auch im Home-Office. So erhielten wir in 2022 die kununu Auszeichnung „TOP Company“.

Das erwartet Dich bei uns:

Onboarding: Du bist ab dem ersten Tag intern vernetzt: Welcome Day, Hello Drink, Mentoring-Programm
Entwicklung: Entwicklung ist bei uns individuell auf Deine Stärken ausgerichtet:


Regelmäßige Feedbackgespräche, Karrierepfade, Career Committees, Online

Trainingskatalog, Internationales Arbeiten mit unterschiedlichen Kulturen
Work-Life Balance: Raum für Deine persönliche Lebensplanung (Sabbatical, Remote Working aus dem Ausland, hochflexible Arbeitsmodelle, Elternzeitprogramme, 30 Tage Urlaub, Feiertagskalender Baden-Württemberg)
Events: Fachlich und mit Spaßfaktor (Summer-Tech-Event, lokale Afterworks, Sportevents, Teamevents, Weihnachtsfeiern)
Netzwerken: Connecte Dich mit Deinen Kolleg:innen: Communities, Lunch Breaks, interne Know-How Sessions
Fehlerkultur: Mache Fehler und teste Dich aus: Wir geben Dir den Freiraum neuesten Technologien zu arbeiten
Prämien: Eine Vielzahl an Prämien für Dein zusätzliches Engagement
Weitere Vorteile: Corporate Benefits, Jobfahrrad, betriebliches Gesundheitsmanagement


Check unsere PTC Spotify Playlist aus und mache dir einen ersten musikalischen Eindruck von unserem Team: https://open.spotify.com/playlist/44kgWZRt5jmmgppH0qGszg?si=L312ch\_9SMKsCKBcN-EB\_A

Aber genug von uns, jetzt bist Du dran - Wir freuen uns darauf Dich kennenzulernen!

Title: Growth Data Analyst (m/f/x)
Description:
At HelloFresh, we want to change the way people eat forever by offering our customers high quality food and recipes for different meal occasions. Over the past 10 years, we've seen this mission spread around the world and beyond our wildest dreams. Now, we are a global food solutions group and the world's leading meal kit company, active in 18 countries across 3 continents. So, how did we do it? Our weekly boxes full of exciting recipes and fresh ingredients have blossomed into a community of customers looking for delicious, healthy and sustainable options. The HelloFresh Group now includes our core brand, HelloFresh, as well as: Green Chef, EveryPlate, Chefs Plate, Factor_, and Youfoodz.

The role

As a Growth Data Analyst in the Growth Analytics team, you will join the wider International Marketing Analytics which acts as a key consultant for the International part of HelloFresh business. Your main focus will be on supporting your Growth stakeholders in their decision making, and you will be their key contact person regarding data and analytics questions. Your experience with Growth analytics and related technologies, together with your excellent communication, stakeholder management and organizational skills will have a big impact on the company’s performance.

Above all, we are looking for people who will make HelloFresh better. We believe there are many different ways of developing skills and we love diverse experiences! So even if you don’t “tick all the boxes” but think you’d thrive in this role, we would really like to learn more about you.

What You’ll Do

You will provide cracking insights to optimize marketing campaigns and channel targeting and efficiency
You will work closely with stakeholders from Growth channels, cross-functions and translate their business questions into structured and meaningful analytics - combining business and technical understanding
Your work will span across creating ad-hoc insights, Lift Tests, AB test analyses, reporting & visualization
You will be utilising various databases and querying/programming languages to access, manipulate and present the data needed
You will discuss the results of your work to stakeholders of various seniority
You will not only take responsibility of own projects, but also be a team player to collaborate and share knowledge with other analysts

What You’ll Bring

3+ years of experience in Data Analytics/ Business Intelligence/Business Analytics/Marketing Analytics/Data Science
1+ years of experience in marketing related domains (special focus on campaign and channel management)
A degree in Analytics, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or similar quantitative discipline
Preferred experience in working with web analytics (Google Analytics, Meta AA, ADH etc.)
Preferably experience with growth marketing analytics (campaign analytics, channel efficiency, Lift Test, AB testing)
Expertise in SQL & Python with excitement to learn more on the technical side!
Expertise in Tableau paired with understanding of data structures and warehousing
Experience in performing analysis with large datasets and knowing what the common pitfalls are
Analytical and critical thinking combined with good presentation and communication skills
Strong problems solving skills
Hands-on & can-do attitude
Ability to work independently

What We Offer

Healthy discount on weekly HelloFresh boxes
Annual learning and development budget to attend conferences or purchase educational resources plus access to the HelloFresh Academy
Budget for home office supplies
Monthly transportation budget through Rydes app
A diverse and vibrant international environment of 70+ different nationalities
Additional perks include: Free crash course in German, compensation for advanced external German classes, discounts for John Reed gyms & Urban Sports Club, summer & winter parties, discount on our Convini vending machines
The chance to have a significant impact on one of the fastest-growing technology companies in Europe in an exciting growth phase

Are you up for the challenge?

Please submit your complete application below including your salary expectations and earliest starting date.

After submitting an application our team will review this and get back to you within 5 business days.

About HelloFresh

We believe that sharing a meal brings people of all identities, backgrounds, and cultures together. We are committed to celebrating all dimensions of diversity in the workplace equally and ensuring that everyone feels a sense of inclusion and belonging. We also aim to extend this commitment to the partners we work with and the communities we serve. We are constantly listening, learning, and evolving to deliver on these principles. We are proud of our collaborative culture. Our diverse employee population enables us to connect with our customers and turn their feedback into meaningful action - from developing new recipes to constantly improving our process of getting dinner to our customers’ homes. Our culture attracts top talent with shared values and forms the foundation for a great place to work!

At HelloFresh, we embrace diversity and inclusion. We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of an individual's race, national origin, color, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, marital status or any other protected characteristic under applicable law, whether actual or perceived. As part of the Company’s commitment to equal employment opportunity, we provide reasonable accommodations, up to the point of undue hardship, to candidates at any stage, including to individuals with disabilities.

We want to adapt our processes and create a safe space that welcomes everyone so please let us know how we can accommodate our process. In case you have any accessibility requirements you can share that with us in the application form.

To learn more about what it's like working inside HelloFresh, follow us on Instagram and LinkedIn

We also aim to extend this commitment to the partners we work with and the communities we serve. We are constantly listening, learning, and evolving to deliver on these principles. We are proud of our collaborative culture. Our diverse employee population enables us to connect with our customers and turn their feedback into meaningful action - from developing new recipes to constantly improving our process of getting dinner to our customers’ homes. Our culture attracts top talent with shared values and forms the foundation for a great place to work!

At HelloFresh, we embrace diversity and inclusion. We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of an individual's race, national origin, color, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, marital status or any other protected characteristic under applicable law, whether actual or perceived. As part of the Company’s commitment to equal employment opportunity, we provide reasonable accommodations, up to the point of undue hardship, to candidates at any stage, including to individuals with disabilities.

We want to adapt our processes and create a safe space that welcomes everyone so please let us know how we can accommodate our process. In case you have any accessibility requirements you can share that with us in the application form.

To learn more about what it's like working inside HelloFresh, follow us on Instagram and LinkedIn

9994

Title: Business Intelligence/Data Analyst Working Student (f/m/d)
Description:
IMAGO is one of the leading image & video providers for media, brands & sports, based in Berlin.

Over 10.000 national & international top clients use a variety of our media, from news videos to stock photos, for their editorial & commercial productions. Spanning two close-by offices and 70 employees, IMAGO operates with flat hierarchies.

We are looking for a motivated and open-minded Business Intelligence Working Student.

The position is available immediately for our team in Berlin.

Tasks

Further development of our Data Warehouse through data integration and -enhancement processes (ETL)
Conceptualization and development of data visualizations via Tableau
Support of our C-level & other departments with ad-hoc analyses for data-driven decision-making
Optimization and automation of business operations


Requirements

First experience with SQL and ability to learn quickly
Very good English skills - German language skills are a big plus but optional
At least 20h available hours/week
You like to work independently with the support of our team
An analytical and solution-oriented mindset


Benefits

A multi-disciplinary team passionate to develop new international sales channels
Insights into a leading medium-sized company as well as the international media industry
projects with a lot of responsibility and direct exchange with management & other teams
Flat hierarchies, creative freedom and short decision-making processes
Remuneration and benefits in line with market conditions
In case required, hybrid possible


Our team is all about the development of IMAGO and the ability to learn and grow everyday.

Have we caught your interest?

Then please do not hesitate to apply with your CV and all relevant application documents.

We are looking forward to your application.

Title: (Senior) Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Team

The Data Analytics team brings together the theory and practice to identify and communicate data-driven insights that allow stakeholders and other executives at Raisin to make more informed decisions. Team’s responsibilities include reporting (define and set-up consistent business KPIs), deep-dive analysis and predictive analytics amongst many. In summary, team is responsible for:

Providing and maintaining Looker as a platform
Providing analytics as a service


We are looking for a Data Analyst who is deeply passionate about data driven decisions, transforming raw data into clear actionable business insights and who is constantly driving themselves and the team towards meeting the next challenge.

Your Responsibilities

Following the end-to-end analytical cycle of defining the problem to data preparation to data analysis to quality check measures to results presentation to measuring success/ results.
Analyzing large, complex data sets representing the behavior of customers to address strategic and operational business questions.
Provide actionable recommendations and conclusions from data to shape features, economies and possible future product/ CRM/ Marketing, etc. roadmaps. Deriving value by identifying key business findings and insights through analysis or reporting.
Analyzing and assisting senior analysts with value-adding projects where effective data analysis is central. Assisting co-workers in analytical tasks and helping to explain the structure of the data.
Supporting business stakeholders with ad-hoc questions on internal performance, external partner/business development efforts.
Build automated dashboards and reports to facilitate company-wide awareness and understanding of key business metrics customer’s experience - key for teams to make informed quantitative decisions.
Looker specific: Defining new tables in LookML along with measures and dimensions. Maintaining quality of code in LookML by performing regular clean-ups of unused views and explores.


Your Profile

Bachelors or master’s in Economics, Statistics, Finance (mathematics focus), Mathematics, Business - Any other relevant quantitative fields.
Work experience in data analysis (descriptive/ reporting, inquisitive or predictive analytics) and/ or BI.
Strong SQL skills with experience in querying large, complex data sets: Snowflake preferred. Experience in working with version controls like Git
High level of analytical and problem-solving skills with strong attention to details.
Ability to turn complex concepts into actionable recommendations.
Basic experience in analytical tools and technologies such as R, Python.
Experience in reporting and data visualization tools such as Looker, Tableau, Power BI.
Experience in solving data science related problems or building and applying machine learning algorithms: advantage.
Good communication and organizational skills.
Eagerness and hunger to learn and grow.


Join our mission, join our team - and grow with us!

At Raisin, we care about each other and it is one of our top priorities to foster an open and caring environment in which everyone feels welcome and comfortable. Our culture is strongly driven by our ambitious team, which, connects more than 40 different nationalities.

You'll find us in our modern and open office in the trendy Kreuzberg district with a view of the Spree River, ideally connected to public transportation and surrounded by a variety of restaurants and shopping opportunities.

As part of our team, you will benefit from:

Personal training budget of 1,700 € and four full training days per year.

Free choice of hardware.

Hungry all the time? Snacks, daily fresh fruit as well as drinks provided at the office.

Flexible working hours, home office and 28 vacation days.

Enjoy more than 50+ different sports with Urban Sports Club: We subsidize your membership with more than €20 per month.

A company pension scheme (Betriebliche Altersvorsorge), which we support with 20%.

Enjoy yearly company retreats to exciting European cities and other team events, such as Lunch & Learn, Tech Lunch, Female Empowerment Forum, CEO Talks as well as our yearly Summer- and Christmas Party.

Do you miss being in the office? The corporate ticket gets you there, which we subsidize with €25 per month (BVG Firmenticket for Berlin and HVV ProfiTicket for HH).

You are moving from another country or city to join us? We will support your relocation.

Title: (Junior) Data Analyst – Social Media (w/m/d)
Description:
Daten über das Social Media Verhalten deiner Zielgruppe faszinieren dich? Du liebst es, aus einer großen, ungeordneten Menge an Zahlen, konkrete Schlüsse zu ziehen und dein gewonnenes Wissen für andere verständlich zu machen? Du bist außerdem detailverliebt und hast Lust neue Prozesse mitzugestalten?

Dann suchen wir dich als (Junior) Data Analyst (m/w/d).

Bewirb Dich! Auch wenn das Profil auf den ersten Blick nicht zu 100% passt.

Aufgaben

Auswertung und Analyse von Performance-Daten auf allen relevanten Social-Media-Kanälen
Nutzung von Analyse-Tools (Google Analytics, Emplifi, Sprinklr, Talkwalker, etc.)
Ableiten und Präsentieren von relevanten Erkenntnissen und Empfehlungen
Optimierung/Automatisierung von Datenverarbeitung und Prozessen
Visuelle Datenaufbereitung & Dashboarding (u.a. mit Google Data Studio)
Unterstützung von interdisziplinären Projektteams


Qualifikation

Ein bis zwei Jahre Berufserfahrung in einem relevanten Berufsfeld
Ein Gespür für Zahlen
Erste Kenntnisse im Bereich Social Media Analytics
Kompetenz im Umgang mit den aktuell relevanten Social-Media-Netzwerken
Interesse am Automobilsektor und der Mobilitätswende
Sicherer Umgang mit MS Office und eine unbändige Excel-Leidenschaft
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse


Benefits

Hybrides Arbeiten mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten, regelmäßigen Teamevents und der Möglichkeit in unser Office in Berlin Kreuzberg zu kommen
30 Urlaubstage für alle Mitarbeiter:innen
Unbefristeter Vertrag nach 6-monatiger Probezeit
Raum zur Entfaltung und zum eigenverantwortlichen Arbeiten in deiner neuen Rolle
Jährliches Weiterbildungsbudget mit individuellen Gestaltungsspielraum ­­


Wer wir sind

Seit 2008 Kreativagentur und Unternehmensberatung mit über 250 sehr guten Leuten in Berlin und New York.

Autonomie, Vertrauen und Gestaltungsspielraum sind unsere Vision der modernen Arbeitswelt von morgen.
Wir unterstützen uns gegenseitig und glauben an die kulturstiftende Wirkung von regelmäßigen Teamevents zur beruflichen und persönlichen Weiterentwicklung.
Diversity, Gleichberechtigung sowie eine gesunde Work-Life Balance gehören zu unseren wichtigsten Werten.
Unser transparenter Feedbackprozess trägt bei uns zu einer offenen und wertschätzenden Kommunikationskultur bei.
Wir wollen zu deinem Leben passen. Zur Unterstützung in jeder Lebensphase bieten wir den vollen Work-Life-Care-Service des Fürstenberg Instituts an.


Wir freuen uns über deine digitale Bewerbung unter Angabe deines optimalen Einstiegstermins per Mail.

Title: Business Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Timeless is a platform where you can buy limited shares of exclusive assets, such as rare sneakers, watches and luxury cars, and profit from their performance. Help us grow and develop this great product for the 21st century. Invest in #thingsyoulove

Tasks

You work closely with our Product & Design teams to bring a data-driven approach to product and app development
You dive deep into our data, analysing it and translating it into business intelligence solutions such as dashboards and reports), delivering business trends and actionable insights to stakeholders.
You conceptualise, set up and conduct experiments that deliver data insights and support us in making data-driven business decisions
You offer a deep understanding of user behaviour and support event and conversion tracking, making it possible to fine-tune user engagement and quantify the end-to-end user journey
You coordinate with data engineering, DevOps and app-development teams to build and setups tools that deliver analytical insights for analytics & insights
You champion data across our organisation and drive stakeholders to make data-driven decisions


Requirements

You completed your Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Economics, Physics, Maths, Statistics, Empirical Social Science, Natural Science, Computer Science, or Business/Data Analytics
At least 3 years of experience in a data analyst or similar quantitative role, ideally in B2C product (or even better, in fintech context)
You have excellent oral and written communication, as well as presentation skills
You have an analytical mindset and the ability to apply scientific thinking to solve business problems with data and analytics
You are able to bring data insights to life and tell a story with data and your analysis
You are proficient in SQL, R and Python and have hands-on experience with data tools.
Have worked with product analytics tools and have in-depth knowledge on their integration in digital products (mobile apps)


Benefits

30 days vacation and monthly health promotion initiatives (weekly yoga sessions etc.)
Team spirit: No divas and flat hierarchies! An engaging team, working together on a product we all love
Grow together: We are growing and you will grow with us! How? With a


challenging environment and an international team that will support you

in everything
Personal Development: A dedicated personal development budget (1800€/year) for trainings, workshops and courses
The #newnormal: flexible working hours and a hybrid (or full-time) work setup that can be adapted to your personal needs
Remote support: initiatives to support you working remotely, including


providing you with what you need to improve your home office

environment, as well as weekly team games
Startup perks: Regular virtual team events and surprise packages delivered straight to your home address!
Visa Sponsorship: If you need to relocate, we offer visa sponsorship and will support you throughout the process!
No one knows what you need in order to work at your best better than yourself. Let us know and we’ll try and make it happen!


At Timeless Investments, it goes without saying that all applicants receive equal opportunity – regardless of gender, nationality, religion, language, origin, age, appearance, culture, body, social or economic status, or sexual orientation. We embrace diversity and aspire to grow together while creating an inclusive work environment in which diversity and uniqueness are celebrated.

Title: Data Analyst/Specialist Finance (w/m/d)
Description:
Über uns

ONOMOTION ist ein europäisches Technologieunternehmen mit Sitz in Berlin. Das Ziel des Unternehmens ist es, die Lebensqualität in Städten zu verbessern, indem es die urbane Logistik neu denkt. Es verbindet die Themen Mikromobilität, Containerisierung, Physisches Internet und künstliche Intelligenz, um die Citylogistik deutlich effizienter und nachhaltiger zu gestalten. Das E-Cargobike, die ONO, ist in vielen deutschen Städten bei den Kund:innen im Einsatz. ONOMOTION hat aktuell 90 Mitarbeiter:innen.

Aufgaben

Deine Aufgaben - Tu was Du liebst

Durch Deinen Beitrag werden wir effizienter und transparenter in der Umsetzung unserer Unternehmensstrategie
Du extrahierst, strukturierst und analysierst unternehmensweit Daten und unterstützt uns damit maßgeblich, die richtigen Entscheidungen zu treffen
In Zusammenarbeit mit den Gründern, dem CFO und den Fachbereichsleitungen entwickelst Du die Datenstrukturen und -systeme sowohl im Financebereich als auch in angegliederten Systemen
Du führst zentrale Erfolgsmetriken ein und verantwortest den Unternehmensplanungsprozess
Du erstellst und optimierst Reports für wertschaffende Analysen zur Unternehmenssteuerung und kannst daraus Entwicklungspotentiale ableiten
Du bist die Sparringperson, an die sich alle gern wenden


Qualifikation

Dein Profil - Sind wir ein Match?

Du hast eine erfolgreich abgeschlossene betriebswirtschaftliche Ausbildung mit Schwerpunkt Controlling, Business Intelligence, Datenverarbeitung o.ä. und/oder ein entsprechendes Studium (bspw. Wirtschaftsinformatik, BWL mit quantitativem Schwerpunkt, Data Science)
Du konntest bereits erste Berufserfahrung in den Bereichen Controlling, Finanzen oder in der Beratung/Wirschaftsprüfung sammeln
Du hast eine große Affinität zu Datenstrukturen und -analysen
Neben sehr guten Kommunikationsfähigkeiten in deutscher und englischer Sprache bringst Du eine schnelle Auffassungsgabe, hohes Qualitätsbewusstsein sowie unternehmerisches Denken und Handeln mit
Flexibilität, Engagement und ausgeprägte Teamfähigkeit runden Dein Profil ab
Idealerweise bringst Du Begeisterung für nachhaltige Mobilität mit


Benefits

Was Dich bei ONOMOTION erwartet:

Ein innovatives Produkt, das die urbane Mobilität nachhaltig verändern wird und die Möglichkeit, eine Vision Wirklichkeit werden zu lassen
Familienfreundliche Arbeitsbedingungen: Flexible Arbeitszeiten, Möglichkeit zu Home Office
Auf Dich wartet eine verantwortungsvolle Aufgabe mit einer zielgerichteten und umfassenden Einarbeitung
Hervorragende Gestaltungs- und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten
Spannende Teamevents, Weihnachtspartys und gemeinsam gefeierte Erfolge stärken unseren Teamgeist
Moderne Büroflächen an unserem neuen Standort am Humboldthain in Berlin


Du fühlst Dich angesprochen? Dann schicke uns Deine vollständigen

Bewerbungsunterlagen (Motivationsschreiben & Lebenslauf).
Show more Show less

Benefits

Was Dich bei ONOMOTION erwartet:
  • Ein innovatives Produkt, das die urbane Mobilität nachhaltig verändern wird und die Möglichkeit, eine Vision Wirklichkeit werden zu lassen
  • Familienfreundliche Arbeitsbedingungen: Flexible Arbeitszeiten, Möglichkeit zu Home Office
  • Auf Dich wartet eine verantwortungsvolle Aufgabe mit einer zielgerichteten und umfassenden Einarbeitung
  • Hervorragende Gestaltungs- und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten
  • Spannende Teamevents, Weihnachtspartys und gemeinsam gefeierte Erfolge stärken unseren Teamgeist
  • Moderne Büroflächen an unserem neuen Standort am Humboldthain in Berlin

Du fühlst Dich angesprochen? Dann schicke uns Deine vollständigen

Bewerbungsunterlagen (Motivationsschreiben & Lebenslauf).

Title: Data Analyst, Business and Product Analytics
Description:
Smartly.io is looking for a customer success and product analytics focused Data Analyst to join our Analytics and Business Intelligence team! Our centralized analytics team works with different parts of the organization, spanning from Product Management and Design to Customer Success, Marketing and Financial Planning and Analysis.




You will work with different types of data, ranging from sales and revenue data to in-app user interactions. Our goal is to develop a unified view of crucial business and product metrics, such as engagement, revenue development, and key action monitoring. We operate in a rapidly evolving business environment, working with the world's most advanced advertisers. This means that our business is constantly changing and we need reliable ways to estimate where we are and where we are going in terms of our customer metrics.




You will work as a part of a wider analytics and business intelligence team that automates operations by creating internal BI tools, dashboards and internal data warehouses. Your primary stakeholders will be our Customer Success and Product Management organizatios.




As a Data Analyst at Smartly.io, you will:




Work closely with our Customer Success Operations, Product Management and Product Design teams to build and optimize our customer experience with data.
Build, develop and maintain reporting of key product adoption metrics
Develop an understanding of our product data and help develop our tracking of key features.
Have end-to-end ownership of data: define data requirements and dive deep into data sets to provide actionable insights.
Develop an in-depth understanding of what drives our customer and product success
Be an important part of our higher level data driven decision making process as well as day-to-day business operations





What we are looking for:




Skills in writing complex analytical SQL queries (we use Snowflake and PostgreSQL as our warehouses)
Proficiency in one or more BI and visualization tools like Looker, Periscope, Tableau or Power BI (we use Tableau and Redash at Smartly.io)
Strong communication and presentation skills, you can turn data into stories and actionable insights
Experience with business & product analytics or a strong interest in the field
Basic understanding of data warehousing
Basic knowledge of typical key business KPIs for SaaS companies
Basic understanding of financial processes, including forecasting, target setting, and budgeting





Meet Smartly.io




Smartly.io combines the power of media automation, creative agility, and advertising intelligence in a next generation digital advertising platform.




We serve marketers across the largest media platforms, including Facebook, Instagram, Snap, Pinterest, TikTok, and Google. We manage about $4B in ad spend and help 700+ brands worldwide, including eBay, Uber, and TechStyle. Our technology and outstanding customer service help brands to reach and engage their audiences, and scale their results.




We offer growth-minded people opportunities to make an impact in a fast-paced, collaborative and inclusive environment built on a culture of trust, transparency, and feedback. You’ll work with a team of 650+ Smartlies, representing 60+ nationalities. We operate in 13 countries across 24 locations.




At Smartly.io, you can enjoy the freedom to harmonize work and personal life. On top of flexible hours, we offer a hybrid workplace where Smartlies can choose to work at the office, from home, or a bit of both. As a global, hybrid organization, we are mindful to collaborate in ways that allow everyone, everywhere to be productive and feel included.




Join our global team to reshape the future of digital marketing!




Learn more at smartly.io/careers and smartly.io/careers/life-at-smartly.

Title: Data Analyst/Manager - Last Mile Planning (m/f/d)
Description:
Company Description




We are Flink - your online supermarket revolutionizing the way you do your grocery shopping. With a wide selection of over 2,400 high-quality products, we aim to deliver to your door in minutes. We put our customers first and ensure all products delivered are fresh and nutritious. Additionally, we can customize our national assortment to be able to offer you unique local products in every city. Our delivery hubs are located in densely populated inner-city locations and we strive to be sustainable by delivering on electric bikes and using packaging that can be recycled.




In your role as Planning Manager, you will be responsible for our fleet shift planning and scheduling optimization initiatives, ensuring rider supply meets demand as efficiently as possible - which will be a key driver for unit economics and sustainable growth.




Job Description




You will oversee our set of workforce management solutions, including our scheduling tool as well as internally developed data products, such as our Forecasting and Scheduling Optimization models. In this effort, you will be the main point of contact between Ops and Data Science teams
You will conceptualize and coordinate the implementation of a variety of workforce management initiatives, whether they are related to Product, reporting or process changes
You will empower local operations teams with reports, dashboards and ad-hoc analysis
You will conduct regular performance reviews with local operations teams, understand issues and concerns regarding suggested/actual scheduling, and align together on action plans




Qualifications




Bachelor or Masters degree in Mathematics, Statistics, IT, Finance or similar area
You have at least 2 years of work experience in a quantitative field - e.g. consulting, operations (capacity planning experience is a plus)
Very good working knowledge of SQL
Previous experience working with R, or Python and common data libraries
Experience with Python, unstructured data, machine learning techniques are advantageous
Good knowledge of MS Office, specially Excel




Additional Information




A €1000 annual L&D budget as well as individual coaching options to ensure you have plenty of opportunities to learn, grow and achieve your goals
26 days of vacation, +1 day every year up to a maximum of 30 days
A mobility budget of 30 EUR per month with RYDES, which you can use individually for Uber, BVG and many other providers
A cool discount on your Urban Sports Club membership
Attractive company pension options
Unlimited access to an e-learning and development platform, MyAcademy, including online German courses
Online discounts with Corporate Benefits and Future Bens
A cool discount off your personal Flink orders; be the first to test out new products!
A modern and dog-friendly office in the heart of Berlin - lots of delicious lunch spots available within short walking distance




We pride ourselves in being an inclusive and equal opportunities employer with a diverse and multicultural team. It is our commitment that every applicant will be evaluated according to their skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (m/f/x)
Description:
About Homeday And The Job Mission

Homeday aims to improve the way people buy and sell real estate, making the entire process simple, transparent and more efficient. Together we have already saved our customers millions in commission. We are looking for people with a creative urge. People with an eye for the big picture - and the little detail that makes the difference. People who want to leave a lasting impression in a dynamic environment.

Stakeholder - Gabriela Georgieva (Teamlead Data & Analytics)
Recruiter - Kaylie Dahm (LinkedIn)
Contract - Fulltime, unlimited
Remote Policy - Work flexibly throughout Germany. Your team decides when and how often you meet at the office
Location - Germany


Where your expertise is needed

Consult marketing team and bolster actions by bringing data-driven insight, developing prediction models and building dashboards.
Set up models to track, attribute and optimize ROI on channels - including offline campaigns.
Help our product development team in streamlining Homedays customer acquisition tools by setting up A/B tests, investigating acquisition flows and user journey.
Conduct quantitative researches and derive recommended actions for specific business questions to help our management making the right decisions in marketing domain.
Explore the data proactively to find insights that bring the business forward and support developing KPIs and targets.
Control and proactively contribute to data quality in the marketing domain.
Train your colleagues to use data solutions at their daily work and be an ambassador of data-driven decision making.


What We Are Looking For

Experience: You have at least one year experience in performance marketing domain as analyst or conversion optimization manager, experienced with both digital and offline marketing data analysis. You are experienced at performing quantitative analysis and making their results actionable.
Value creation mindset: You combine curiosity with critical thinking and have the ability to listen carefully and presenting your thoughts clearly.
Tools & Software: Your are an expert at Google Analytics and highly skilled with spreadsheet tools. You also bring experience with Tableau (or similar data analysis tools).
Coding skills: You are proficient with SQL. Additionally you have skills in Python, R, JS or HTML.
Knowledge: You bring a knowledge of statistical analysis methods and ability to apply them.
Language: You are fluent in English. Business proficiency in German is a plus.


What We Offer

Work-Life-Balance - You can work up to 80% of your time from home
Advancement - You have the opportunity to take responsibility from the beginning.
Innovation - You work on products that revolutionize a conservative market.
PropTech Company - You work in a friendly atmosphere with the optimal mix of established company and dynamic startup.
Product Engineering Week - Once a trimester you’ll have the chance to work on anything you want for a week. It’s the perfect opportunity for you to learn and test new technologies or ideas of your choice.
Team - We are an open, motivated team and know how to have a good time too.__
Show more Show less

Title: Data Analyst / Data Product Manager
HTML:
Data Analyst / Data Product Manager (m/w/d)

Lot Internet GmbH – 14473 Potsdam

 

Lust „Big Data“ mit Leben zu füllen? Den Umgang mit großen Datenmengen zu revolutionieren? Dann bist Du bei uns genau richtig!

Gegründet 2011 mit Firmensitz in Potsdam hat sich die Lot Internet GmbH auf das Erfassen und Analysieren strukturierter Daten aus dem Internet spezialisiert.

Als Data Analyst / Data Product Manager liegt Dein Schwerpunkt in der Nutzbarmachung von heterogenen Online-Datenquellen durch die Entwicklung von effizienten Daten-Services. Du berätst und unterstützt unsere Kunden bei der digitalen Transformation und hilfst diesen, durch Daten einen echten Mehrwert zu generieren.

Ziel ist die Erkennung von Zusammenhängen und Mustern in den Datenwelten, sowie die Schaffung von Transparenz im Marktgeschehen. Der Branchenschwerpunkt liegt dabei im Bereich Automotiv, wo große Konzerne unsere Kunden sind.


Deine Aufgaben

●     Erstellung von ganzheitlichen Analysen, basierend auf Datenbankabfragen;

●     Interpretation und Bewertung von Datenanalysen und Kennzahlen;

●     Konzeption von Online-Applikationen zur Datenanalyse;

●     Verantwortlich für die Datenqualitätssicherung, u.a. durch fortlaufende Optimierung von Datenverarbeitungsprozessen;

●     Strategische Beratung unserer Kunden bei Big Data-Analysen;

●     Fachlicher Key Account Manager;

●     Produkt- und Projektmanagement bei unseren Daten-Services;

●     Steuerung von Entwicklern zur Datenerfassung und -aufbereitung;

●     Unterstützung des Managements im Bereich Business Development.

 

Dein Profil

●     Abgeschlossenes Studium der Mathematik, Informatik, Physik, Ingenieurwissenschaften oder einschlägige Berufserfahrung;

●     Strukturiertes, reflektiertes und analytisches Denken

●     Sicherer Umgang mit Methoden zur Analyse und zur Aufbereitung von Daten;

●     Erfahrung mit relationalen Datenbanken (z.B. PostgreSQL);

●     Erfahrungen im Projektmanagement, idealerweise auch im Produktmanagement;

●     Sicheres und kompetentes Auftreten bei unseren Kunden;

●     Sehr gute Präsentations- und Kommunikationsfähigkeiten in Deutsch und Englisch;

●     Zielorientierte, sorgfältige und eigenständige Arbeitsweise.

 

Wir bieten

●     Eine umfassende und praxisorientierte Einarbeitung;

●     Ein familienfreundliches Unternehmen mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten und drei Tage Home-Office;

●     Flache Hierarchien für ein effizientes und zielorientiertes arbeiten;

●     Ein motiviertes und kollegiales Team;

●     Ein Umfeld mit Respekt vor dem Kunden und zwischen den Kollegen;

●     Offene, kooperative und vertrauensvolle Unternehmenskultur;

●     Fachliche als auch persönliche Weiterentwicklung im Job durch vielfältige Trainingsangebote und Coaching;

●     Einen verkehrsgünstig gelegenen Arbeitsplatz im Zentrum von Potsdam.

Title: Data Analyst, Marketing & Communications
Description:
As stewards of the Polkadot and Substrate ecosystem, Parity is laying the foundation for a better web which respects the freedom and data of individuals and empowers developers to create better services through decentralised technology. The internet is too important to billions of people for it to be at the mercy of a few powerful companies.

Like Polkadot, Parity was built on a foundation of being decentralised and open, which trickles down to how we work. We're a distributed organisation and have been from the beginning. Being distributed isn't just a way of doing business—it's a mentality that is at the core of our culture. We have a flat structure that pushes power to the edges and empowers our people to take ownership of their role, authority coupled with responsibilities.

As the Polkadot ecosystem grows, so does the data associated with it. We are looking for a data analytics professional to perform analytics on all our marketing activities, drive the definition of metrics and implement reporting structures within the Marketing & Communications (Marcomms) department at Parity Technologies.

This is a great opportunity for someone who is passionate about marketing, Web3 and open source blockchain development to spearhead some cutting edge analytics within the Blockchain industry. Also the ability to play a pivotal role in the formation of the data platform and culture at a rapidly growing open-source technology startup.

Key Responsibilities

Lead metric definition and measurement for the department, including supporting the KPI and OKR framework and processes
Work directly with a variety of stakeholders and multiple data sets to derive sophisticated data solutions and dashboards
Create and maintain dashboards to visualize the performance (ROI, attribution etc) of different marketing activities (social media, paid advertising, website traffic, CRM, organic content etc.)
Support the mapping of existing business processes into reporting structures.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) on marketing data and open-source blockchain development data within and outside the ecosystem.
Coordinate with the data engineering team to turn the results of this EDA into user-friendly, consumable and automated dashboards.
Coordinate with other departments within Parity to help ensure organizational-wide visibility of Ecosystem Development data.


Qualification and Skills

3+ years of work experience in data analytics.
Strong proficiency in Python,SQL and dashboarding tools.
Experience defining metrics, implementing reporting structures, building and automating dashboards.
Professional experience with marketing data (paid ads, website traffic, CRM etc.) workflows and activities
Knowledge and practical application of statistical techniques in a professional setting.
Familiarity with connecting and harnessing data from a number of different sources.
Ability to work autonomously, be proactive, prioritise, communicate, and function in a small team.
Strong program management skills and able to address multiple projects in parallel managing competing interests and aligning various parties on a common goal.
Ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.


Nice-to-haves

Understanding of blockchain technologies and ecosystems.
Experience with GCP.
Knowledge of GDPR.


Benefits

Working at Parity means focusing on the stuff that counts: building the most cutting-edge technology for the future web. Our teams enjoy a high degree of trust, freedom and autonomy to achieve that goal.
You will gain a keen understanding of blockchain technology and business development and have a skill set transferable to many jobs.
Because we value initiative and learning, we've defined a generous personal budget to attend conferences or skills courses of your choosing. We think you know what's best for you!
Parity is a diverse company with people from various countries, and we will support you with German or English language courses where needed.
Not all of us who collaborate work in the same place. Bringing the team together is something we value a lot, so we regularly go on team retreats.


To see how we use your data, please see our Applicant Notice: https://www.parity.io/applicant-notice/
Show more Show less

Title: Senior Data Analyst (F/M/X)
Description:
We are omni:us (https://omnius.com/company/) - Our clear vision is to support insurers to transform the way they handle claims with the help of AI. We see ourselves as authorities in artificial intelligence and deep insurance expertise. We are a team of leading engineers and insurance experts led by serial entrepreneurs with strong business to business & corporate experience. Our investors & network bring together deep technology, insurance and solution expertise. Together we tackle the insurer's biggest and most interesting challenges.

Founded in 2015, omni:us now employs more than 65 people from 20 different nations. We’re headquartered in Berlin with representations in the UK, France and the United States. As we want to continue delivering amazing work while having fun at the same time, we're looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our venture!

What will keep you challenged?

Understanding the context/content of insurance project data and choosing the optimal strategies to solve a project from a data perspective
Data processing, data structuring and clear guidelines/documentation for external annotation providers Management of annotation teams and annotation tasks
Management and maintenance of datasets
Continuous process assessment and automation of task
Build internal knowledge and expertise for the establishment of a strong in-house annotation team in the medium term Train and evaluate machine learning models


Requirements

3+ years data analyst experience with exposure to business documents (e.g. contracts, invoices, letters, spreadsheets, forms, medical reports etc.)
Proficiency in data analysis and manipulation tools i.e. scripting (Python/BASH)
Project management skills, including negotiation and customer communication skills
Demonstrated experience of structured decision making
Technical ability to automate tasks and improve processes
Native or fluent German and English (French and other European languages is a plus)
Experience in the insurance industry/background in computer science a strong plus
Understanding of machine learning concepts and workflows


Benefits

A modern technology stack – Kubernetes, Docker, CircleCI, Microservices, Azure/AWS, Distributed Computing, Java, Python
A highly motivated, fully committed team who is eager to change the insurance space and appreciates support, guidance and teamwork
A real challenge – full ownership of the product
True flexibility – unlimited home office/remote work
Other benefits include: 27 vacation days, transportation pass discounts, Urban Sports Club membership, company/team outings, chef-prepared lunches at our Moabit office, and more


omni:us is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to maintaining an inclusive environment where unique perspectives contribute to groundbreaking solutions. omni:us welcomes people regardless of race, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, political and religious affiliation, socio-economic background, cultural background, geographic location, physical or mental disabilities, abilities, relationship status, age, education and any other category protected by law. People from underrepresented communities are strongly encouraged to apply.
Show more Show less
HTML:
We are omni:us (https://omnius.com/company/) - Our clear vision is to support insurers to transform the way they handle claims with the help of AI. We see ourselves as authorities in artificial intelligence and deep insurance expertise. We are a team of leading engineers and insurance experts led by serial entrepreneurs with strong business to business & corporate experience. Our investors & network bring together deep technology, insurance and solution expertise. Together we tackle the insurer's biggest and most interesting challenges.

Founded in 2015, omni:us now employs more than 65 people from 20 different nations. We’re headquartered in Berlin with representations in the UK, France and the United States. As we want to continue delivering amazing work while having fun at the same time, we're looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our venture!

What will keep you challenged?
  • Understanding the context/content of insurance project data and choosing the optimal strategies to solve a project from a data perspective
  • Data processing, data structuring and clear guidelines/documentation for external annotation providers Management of annotation teams and annotation tasks
  • Management and maintenance of datasets
  • Continuous process assessment and automation of task
  • Build internal knowledge and expertise for the establishment of a strong in-house annotation team in the medium term Train and evaluate machine learning models

Requirements
  • 3+ years data analyst experience with exposure to business documents (e.g. contracts, invoices, letters, spreadsheets, forms, medical reports etc.)
  • Proficiency in data analysis and manipulation tools i.e. scripting (Python/BASH)
  • Project management skills, including negotiation and customer communication skills
  • Demonstrated experience of structured decision making
  • Technical ability to automate tasks and improve processes
  • Native or fluent German and English (French and other European languages is a plus)
  • Experience in the insurance industry/background in computer science a strong plus
  • Understanding of machine learning concepts and workflows

Benefits
  • A modern technology stack – Kubernetes, Docker, CircleCI, Microservices, Azure/AWS, Distributed Computing, Java, Python
  • A highly motivated, fully committed team who is eager to change the insurance space and appreciates support, guidance and teamwork
  • A real challenge – full ownership of the product
  • True flexibility – unlimited home office/remote work
  • Other benefits include: 27 vacation days, transportation pass discounts, Urban Sports Club membership, company/team outings, chef-prepared lunches at our Moabit office, and more

omni:us is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to maintaining an inclusive environment where unique perspectives contribute to groundbreaking solutions. omni:us welcomes people regardless of race, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, political and religious affiliation, socio-economic background, cultural background, geographic location, physical or mental disabilities, abilities, relationship status, age, education and any other category protected by law. People from underrepresented communities are strongly encouraged to apply.

Title: (Senior) Data Analyst - Growth (f/m/x)
Description:
Description

We at elopage believe that everyone can turn their passion into a career! With our cloud-based SaaS platform solution elopage.com, we offer everyone the opportunity to create and sell digital products and online courses quickly and easily. More than 55,000 elopagers already trust in our expertise!

Our story started in 2015. For the first 5 years of our existence, we grew organically and became a profitable company with around 60 employees. Then, in September 2021, we raised $38 million in series A funding, led by Target Global and with participation from Partech Ventures and Avid Ventures. Since then we have more than doubled in size and are currently employing 150 people.

Our Values

We perform like entrepreneurs - we start with yes, we act like owners, and we trust you to know the how.
Explore & overcome - we always want to understand the why and we never quit.
Always reimagining towards tomorrow - change is constant and failure an opportunity to learn.
One tribe - together we can achieve more than we can on our own. Our people are our most important asset and we support you to get the best out of yourself.


Diversity & Inclusion

At elopage we are all different and that’s our greatest strength. We draw on the differences in who we are, what we’ve experienced, and how we think. We drive inclusion, internally and externally, as we want to make growth available for everyone. We do not tolerate discrimination based on racial identities, religious beliefs, colour, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you unique.

Responsibilities

Data is a critical part of our Growth department. With the analyses and insights that you will create, the Growth department will be able to make decisions that have the highest business impact. As a Data Analyst - Growth, you will play a key role in developing and executing the data strategy for the Growth department within Elopage. You will be part of the central Data team and will work closely together with the different stakeholders across the Growth department, delivering end-to-end data projects based on priorities.

Work collaboratively with the CGO, VPs/Heads of Sales, Marketing, CRM and Customer Support, to define and track meaningful KPIs, assess opportunities, prioritize tasks with the highest business impact and proactively find trends / insights that change the focus of the business units.
Work on a wide variety of projects within our Growth department, for example provide insights to optimize marketing campaigns, improve efficiency of our Sales teams, Revenue Operations optimization, increase Customer Lifetime Value, predict churn, increase the customer satisfaction score, and more.
Create and maintain dashboards for the different functions within the Growth department.
Use quantitative analyses to deep-dive into the full customer journey: from acquiring and activating leads to retaining and upselling existing customers.
Join and present in business decision meetings as the advocate of the Data team to uphold data-driven thinking.
Mentor other team members and proactively improve the Data team by introducing new techniques and technologies.
Contribute to the development of our data warehouse, which helps our entire company using uniform metrics, getting better insights and having easier access to data.


Requirements

Strong quantitative background and 3+ years of relevant experience as data / business analyst.
Good understanding of and experience with several Marketing-, Sales and Rev Ops analytics tools and processes, e.g. Web / App tracking tools like Google Analytics & Google Tag Manager, CRM systems like Salesforce, Marketing attribution, Campaign optimization & ROI measurement, Customer Lifetime Value tracking & prediction etc.
Great knowledge of SQL, data relationships and DWH ecosystem concepts.
Flexibility and adaptability to work in a fast-paced startup.
Experience in using data visualization tools, e.g. Metabase, Looker Studio, Looker, Tableau etc.
Excellent commercial awareness and being able to prioritize work with the highest business impact.
Strong communication and project management skills. Capable of sharing complex insights in a clear and simple language and managing different stakeholders; business/product owners, engineers and management.
Python or R for analytics & statistics is a plus.
A background in SaaS / experience with SaaS metrics is a plus.
Speak and read English fluently. German is a plus.


Benefits

Paid Time Off - 30 vacation days
Personal Training & Development
Responsibility and trust from day 1
Individual coaching and further training to support you in your development
A free BVG ticket
Employee discounts at numerous companies (e.g. at the gym or in online stores)
Pension Program with company match
A Culture of equity and Inclusion where you are appreciated for the person you are

  • Pension Program with company match
  • A Culture of equity and Inclusion where you are appreciated for the person you are

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Pitch is the collaborative presentation platform for modern teams. With a focus on real-time collaboration, smart workflows, and intuitive design features, we make it fast and delightful for teams to create and deliver beautiful presentations. Our presentation and template galleries give everyone the ability to publish their own standout work, learn from one another, and find the creative spark for their next presentation. Tens of thousands of teams have made the switch to Pitch, including top brands like Intercom, Superhuman, and Notion. We've raised over $135 million to date, and have been recognized by FT-backed Sifted as Europe's Top B2B Soonicorn in 2022. And we're just getting started.

We built Pitch for people who are thirsting for a better way to design, collaborate on, and share presentations. In order to improve our product, we continuously seek to improve our understanding of the user journey from first hearing about Pitch, to creating the first deck, to inviting team member to collaborate, and beyond.

One lens we've relied on to better understand this complex journey is data.

As a Senior Data Analyst on our Analytics team, you'll shed numerical light on the many mysteries that await us as we build and position Pitch as the greatest presentation tool known to humanity in 2023 and beyond.

What You'll Get To Do...

Inform and influence our growth and product strategy through data exploration.
Collaborate with Marketing, Sales, User Research, Customer Support, Finance and Product to make data-driven insights and recommendations.
Play a key role in enabling and promoting self-service analytics among stakeholders in the wider organization.
Guide teams through experimentation-based execution.
Partner with Data Engineering to maintain and extend our Data Warehouse (SnowFlake), improve data quality and documentation.


This role is perfect for you if you bring...

4+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, Data Scientist, or in a relevant field.
High proficiency in SQL and comfortable navigating data to perform a wide range of analyses.
High proficiency in using BI tools.
Experience with Git.
Strong communication skills with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Experience in playing the role of "project manager" when the occasion calls for it.


Not a must, but it would be great if you have…

Experience in SaaS business models.
Experience with marketing analytics.
Experience with dbt.
Understanding of statistical concepts like causal analysis.


Curious what it's like to work at Pitch? Find out more about how Pitch operates as a remote-first company through using powerful collaboration tools and dogfooding our own products!

Pitch was founded in Berlin, but as a remote-first company, our team works together from all over the world. With that mindset, we're building an inclusive workplace that invites diverse perspectives, and values talent from diverse personal and professional backgrounds. For more specifics on how we honour our commitment to diversity in our hiring process, check out our Recruiting D&I Pledge.

Sounds like a good fit? Join us on our mission to enable every team's best thinking - we look forward to hearing from you!

Not quite sure whether that's a role for you? No problem! If you can't find any open role that caught your eye, but are interested in working at Pitch, you can always submit your resume here. We will follow up as soon as we open up a position that matches your skillset and aspirations!

Title: Data Analyst / Decision Scientist, Vinted Go
Description:
Vinted is Europe’s biggest pre-loved fashion marketplace, with 75+ million registered members in 18 countries. We want to make second-hand the first choice worldwide.

A team of 1,200+ people from Vinted’s offices in Vilnius, Berlin, Prague, and Amsterdam develop and support our platform. We share a unique work culture that’s based on aiming high, taking ownership, co-creating, caring, and growth.

Vinted is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, colour, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion/beliefs, disability or age. We truly believe when we can be fully ourselves, we work better.

As a Decision Scientist at Vinted Go, you will be part of a newly introduced Vinted business – our own VGo Platform designed to provide shipping services for external clients. You will help the team to make data-driven decisions by performing data analyses, applying statistical methods and building automated dashboards. In this position you will apply decision science principles to optimise platform’s growth, visualise data, and identify opportunities. To achieve that, you will work together with a dedicated cross-functional product team which consists of engineers and a product manager.

Within Data Science & Analytics at Vinted, we have three distinct roles. We believe that each role can make a similarly-sized business impact, and therefore our salary ranges are the same for all three roles. To better understand your role as a Decision Scientist, here are brief descriptions of each role in the department:

Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and developing automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision making.
Data Scientists are responsible for identifying algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed in an optimal fashion and design, developing and maintaining production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms.
Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation: Translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.


In this position, you’ll:

Collaborate with your team and direct stakeholders to identify strategic opportunities and answer key business questions
Ensure these questions are answered in an optimal fashion (e.g. in the form of an ad-hoc deep-dive, experiment, dashboard, or automatically recurring analysis)
Set-up and own key performance indicators for the team, including activity tracking, and proactively flagging customer related issues
Design experiments and track their performance to provide data-driven insights
Enable your team and direct stakeholders to independently leverage data for business insights via dashboarding tools (e.g. Looker)
Help to create a backlog with prioritised hypotheses and analyses
Drive the usage of data & analytics within the organisation


About you:

Highly results-oriented and comfortable with iterative processes
Analytically curious with strong business acumen and strategic thinking
Fluent in SQL and working experience in an analytics language (Python, R, etc.)
Experience with dashboarding tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, etc.)
Statistical proficiency (e.g. A/B testing, regression analysis)
Extensive work experience in analytical / data / BI fields
Excellent at communicating in written and spoken English
Advantage: Experience working in a tech company or in a cross-functional product development team


Work perks:

Opportunity to join our share options programme
Learning budget (10% from net yearly salary)
30 working days of holiday
Mental and emotional health support from Mindletic
Frequent team-building events
A personal budget for shopping on Vinted
A daily allowance for ordering lunch
Work anywhere in the EU for 90 days out of the year
Dog-friendly office
Home office support (IT workstation equipment provided and a personal budget for home workplace furniture)


We want people to work from where they’re most comfortable, which is why we’re using a hybrid workplace model at Vinted for the foreseeable future.

Hybrid means that we encourage working from the office on Tuesdays and Wednesdays and the remainder of your time from either home or the office, but it’s not required. You’re welcome to work from either location all or some of the time, depending on what you think is best and safest for you, and how the Covid-19 situation is developing where you are.

The salary range for this position is 51,400 – 81,700 € (gross) per year.

If this sounds interesting – you may well be just who we need!

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (m/w/x)
Description:
Über COMO

#Produkt

Willkommen im COMOverse!

Social Media Analytics, datengesteuertes Influencer Marketing oder kreative Content-Produktionen - COMO hat alles im Griff.

COMOs einzigartige Analytics-Technologie ermöglicht es unseren Kunden, Transparenz über ihre Social-Media-Landschaft zu gewinnen, die Trigger ihrer Konsumenten zu verstehen und alle ihre Social-Media-Aktivitäten auszuwerten und zu überwachen - weltweit.

Konzeption, Scouting, Durchführung und Auswertung von Influencer Marketing sind das A und O im COMOverse. Auf der Grundlage von Daten schaffen wir authentische und bereichernde Verbindungen zwischen Marken, Influencern und Followern, um für alle Beteiligten den größtmöglichen Nutzen zu erzielen.

Und mit Hilfe innovativer Creator unterstützen wir Marken bei der Erstellung von ansprechenden Inhalten für alle wichtigen Social-Media-Plattformen, um eine hohe Content-Frequenz ohne aufwendige Inhouse-Content-Produktion zu gewährleisten.

Deine Aufgaben

Unser Bestreben ist es, die WARUMs zu eliminieren und mehr Zeit für das "Let's do its" zu schaffen! Als Marketing Data Analyst bei COMO helfen Sie, das Unbekannte in Sachen Influencer Marketing aufzudecken. Sie werden die Möglichkeit haben, mit Kunden und verschiedenen Abteilungen innerhalb von COMO zu interagieren, um komplizierte Datenanalyseprojekte zu organisieren und zu strukturieren.

Verantwortlichkeiten

Wöchentliche Priorisierung und Terminierung von Projekten in enger Abstimmung mit den jeweiligen Projektleitern unter Berücksichtigung von externen Terminen. Die Kernbereiche sind dabei:

Koordinierung und Optimierung von:

SLAs
Consumer Insight Reporting
Channel- und Account-Reporting
Standard- und erweiterte Analysen
Umsetzung von Problemen in lösungsorientierte Datenmodelle


Weitere Aufgaben:

Schriftliche und mündliche Kommunikation mit Ansprechpartnern bei Kunden und Partnern
Koordination und Abstimmung mit anderen Teams (Operations, Engineering und Product)
Priorisierung von Aufgaben und Delegation von Aufgaben an bis zu 3 Praktikanten.


Dein Profil

Sie sind Absolvent eines einschlägigen Studiengangs, z.B. Betriebswirtschaft oder Marketing
Sie haben idealerweise bereits erste praktische Erfahrungen im Marketing gesammelt und möchten in die Marketingdatenanalyse eintauchen
Sie lieben es, mit Zahlen und Daten zu arbeiten und haben fortgeschrittene Erfahrung in Excel/Google Sheets und erste Erfahrungen mit Metabase, Tableau oder anderen BI-Tools sind von Vorteil
Sie sind datengetrieben und gehen offen an jedes neue Projekt heran und bleiben neugierig auf das, was die Daten zeigen
Sie haben eine Hands-on-Mentalität und sind fokussiert und lösungsorientiert
Sie haben eine hohe Leistungsmotivation, die sich in einer hohen Qualität der Ergebnisse widerspiegelt.
Ihre Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse sind fließend in Wort und Schrift


Warum wir?

Die Möglichkeit, sich fachlich und persönlich weiterzuentwickeln und den Arbeitsplatz selbstbestimmt zu gestalten
Ein familiäres, freundliches und engagiertes Team in einem zukunftsorientierten Tech-Unternehmen
Eine offene Feedback-Kultur, die den Prinzipien einer lernenden Organisation folgt
Ein wettbewerbsfähiges Gehalt
Die Wahl zwischen einem Mobilitäts- oder Gesundheitsbudget von uns für Sie
Du bist Teil eines tollen Teams in Berlin (und in ganz Europa)
Ein hundefreundliches Büro im Prenzlauer Berg
Flexible Arbeitszeiten mit vollen Remote-Optionen
Show more Show less

Deine Aufgaben

Unser Bestreben ist es, die WARUMs zu eliminieren und mehr Zeit für das "Let's do its" zu schaffen! Als Marketing Data Analyst bei COMO helfen Sie, das Unbekannte in Sachen Influencer Marketing aufzudecken. Sie werden die Möglichkeit haben, mit Kunden und verschiedenen Abteilungen innerhalb von COMO zu interagieren, um komplizierte Datenanalyseprojekte zu organisieren und zu strukturieren.

Verantwortlichkeiten

Wöchentliche Priorisierung und Terminierung von Projekten in enger Abstimmung mit den jeweiligen Projektleitern unter Berücksichtigung von externen Terminen. Die Kernbereiche sind dabei:

Koordinierung und Optimierung von:
  • SLAs
  • Consumer Insight Reporting
  • Channel- und Account-Reporting
  • Standard- und erweiterte Analysen
  • Umsetzung von Problemen in lösungsorientierte Datenmodelle

Weitere Aufgaben:
  • Schriftliche und mündliche Kommunikation mit Ansprechpartnern bei Kunden und Partnern
  • Koordination und Abstimmung mit anderen Teams (Operations, Engineering und Product)
  • Priorisierung von Aufgaben und Delegation von Aufgaben an bis zu 3 Praktikanten.

Dein Profil
  • Sie sind Absolvent eines einschlägigen Studiengangs, z.B. Betriebswirtschaft oder Marketing
  • Sie haben idealerweise bereits erste praktische Erfahrungen im Marketing gesammelt und möchten in die Marketingdatenanalyse eintauchen
  • Sie lieben es, mit Zahlen und Daten zu arbeiten und haben fortgeschrittene Erfahrung in Excel/Google Sheets und erste Erfahrungen mit Metabase, Tableau oder anderen BI-Tools sind von Vorteil
  • Sie sind datengetrieben und gehen offen an jedes neue Projekt heran und bleiben neugierig auf das, was die Daten zeigen
  • Sie haben eine Hands-on-Mentalität und sind fokussiert und lösungsorientiert
  • Sie haben eine hohe Leistungsmotivation, die sich in einer hohen Qualität der Ergebnisse widerspiegelt.
  • Ihre Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse sind fließend in Wort und Schrift

Warum wir?
  • Die Möglichkeit, sich fachlich und persönlich weiterzuentwickeln und den Arbeitsplatz selbstbestimmt zu gestalten
  • Ein familiäres, freundliches und engagiertes Team in einem zukunftsorientierten Tech-Unternehmen
  • Eine offene Feedback-Kultur, die den Prinzipien einer lernenden Organisation folgt
  • Ein wettbewerbsfähiges Gehalt
  • Die Wahl zwischen einem Mobilitäts- oder Gesundheitsbudget von uns für Sie
  • Du bist Teil eines tollen Teams in Berlin (und in ganz Europa)
  • Ein hundefreundliches Büro im Prenzlauer Berg
  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten mit vollen Remote-Optionen

Title: BI-Analyst/ Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Ihr Aufgabenbereich


Anfertigung von Datenanalysen, Berichten, Dashboards, Prognosen und Simulationen
Weiterentwicklung der Kennzahlen der Abteilung Customer Service
selbstständige Identifikation von benötigten Datasets und Verknüpfung von Informationen
Auswahl der Algorithmen und mathematischen Modelle, Durchführung von Analysen und Prognosen und Visualisierung der Daten sowie Ableitung von Handlungsempfehlungen
Erstellung von Grobkonzepten und Unterstützung bei der Erstellung von Feinkonzepten für Change Requests und Projekte sowie Abstimmung der Konzepte mit anderen Stakeholdern
Sicherstellung der Eignung der technischen Lösung und des Einsatzes von Standards
Durchführung von Workshops, Schulungen und Präsentationen für Anwender in der Abteilung Customer Service zur operativen Nutzung von BI-Anwendungen
Mitwirkung in Projekten/Change Requests und Leitung von Arbeitsgruppen zur Umsetzung interner und externer Anforderungen


Ihr Profil


abgeschlossenes Studium der Richtung Angewandte Mathematik/Physik, Computerwissenschaften, Informationsmanagement, Statistik, Data Science oder vergleichbarer Abschluss
Berufserfahrung im Bereich Data Science
Fähigkeit zur Strukturierung komplexer Zusammenhänge und der Ableitung schlüssiger Handlungsempfehlungen
pragmatische Vorgehensweise und Kommunikationsgeschick im Kontakt mit unterschiedlichen Schnittstellen


Ihre Vorteile


Gemeinsam mehr erreichen: toller Teamspirit in einem kompetenten und zukunftssicheren Arbeitsumfeld mit einzigartigen Projekten
Attraktive Arbeitsbedingungen: ausgewogene Balance zwischen Beruf und Privatleben dank flexibler Arbeitsmodelle und -zeiten, 30 Tagen Urlaub im Jahr und mobilem Arbeiten
Moderne Arbeitsausstattung: top Equipment und innovative Tools für die interdisziplinäre Zusammenarbeit
Persönliche Entwicklung: individuelle Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowie Fach- und Führungskräfteprogramme
Optimale Verkehrsanbindung: attraktiver Standort mit sehr guter Anbindung an den öffentlichen Nahverkehr
Angebote zum Gesundbleiben: kostenlose Präventionskurse und Laufevents
Weitere Extras: betriebliche Altersvorsorge, vermögenswirksame Leistungen, unterstützende Maßnahmen bei der Kinderbetreuung und der Pflege von Angehörigen

Title: Data Analyst & Performance Marketing Specialist
Description:
For this position previous Experience in Paid Performance (facebook & Google) for E-commerce and in Data Management (preferably Tableau) are needed

About Us

Avea is a Swiss longevity startup with the vision to become the leading player in the evidence-based longevity supplement industry. We offer science-based longevity supplements to target multiple hallmarks of aging, allowing individuals to improve their well-being by slowing down aging itself. Our mission is to optimize people's health- and lifespan, helping them keep or regain their vitality to live as healthily as possible for as long as possible.

The Role

As a Performance Marketing Specialist you will be responsible for initiating, executing, and reporting on digital marketing initiatives to drive awareness and conversions. You'll set the strategy, optimise our existing performance channels, test new channels and own the results in our main markets (Europe and APAC).

This is a great opportunity to join a fast pace and mission driven start-up on where you will be exposed to incredible learning and growth opportunities.

Tasks And Responsibilities

Drive our digital performance marketing across all channels e.g Facebook, Google and TikTok
Plan and set up online marketing campaigns in coordination with the Co-Founder in charge of marketing
Monitor performance of individual assets (e.g. pictures, articles, videos), identify what works best and coordinate with the rest of the marketing team to produce more high performance assets and to implement best practices
Measure and analysis campaigns on a daily basis by using Google Analytics, Google data studio, Google Ads Dashboard & Facebook Ads Dashboard, Excel and other dashboards needed.
Identify improvement opportunities in digital performance marketing growth and efficiency by constantly testing ideas with audience targeting, split tests and A/B tests etc.
Test new channels and opportunities


You'll Fit Great With These Skills And Values

University degree, quantitative majors like engineering, physics, mathematics are strongly preferred
Data Driven, you are analytical, like looking at data and derive conclusions from it
Team player who is able to work independently on dynamic work environment that requires own thinking and problem solving
Eager to learn and adopt new tools/technologies as well as share knowledge with others
Very good command of Ms.Excel
You understand online shopping and have collected some experience in optimizing a conversion journey and online customer acquisition
At least 1 year experience in either Google AdWords platform or Facebook Ads Manager, ideally both
Basic understanding of google analytics, certification is a plus
Interest in the longevity industry


Why join us

We believe that the best companies help you live your life the way you want and become the person you want to be. That's why we focus on promoting your personal freedom and growth. Here are some of the benefits you'll enjoy as a member of our team:

Work at a well-funded, early-stage startup in the longevity industry
Be part of a dynamic, high-performing, and fun team
A high degree of personal responsibility, creative freedom and opportunities
Work with the brightest researchers within longevity and with successful and well-known serial entrepreneurs
Fully remote opportunity where you are free to live and work wherever you want
Strong team culture with regular team events and off-sites
